moche blamed sayth saynt bernard myllyfluous doctour moder lye stepdame vertues ouerthroweth stronge men synne quenchyth vertue nouryssheth pryde maketh waye redy goo helle iohan cassyodore sayth thouȝt hym ydle thynketh none thynge lychorous metys vyandes bely holy saynt bernard aforesayd sayth epystle whan tyme shal come shal behoue v rendre gyue acomptes ydle tyme reson may rendre answer shal gyue whan ydlenes none excuse prosper sayth someuer lyueth ydlenesse lyueth manere dombe beest cause haue seen auctorytees blame despyse moche ydlenes also knowe wel one capytal dedely synnes moche hateful vnto god therfore haue concluded fermelye purposed self ydle wyl applye self laboure suche ocupacion haue acustomed moche saynt austyn aforesayd sayth vpon psalme good werke ought doon englysshe whiche varyed many dyuers place also many hystoryes comprysed two bookes whiche englysshe book therfore haue wryten one oute sayd thre bookes haue ordryd otherwyse sayd englysshe legende whiche tofore made besechyng alle theym shall see redde pardone haue erryd made fawte whyche yf ony ygnoraunce ageyn wylle submytte hooly suche may correcte humbly bysechyng doo doyng shal deserue ye fader brother answerd lord fader old man haue brother yonge childe whiche born hym old age who brother moder deed sone fader loueth tenderly thou saidest v thy seruauntes brynge hem hether may see retorne bye corn saide may go theder yf yongest brother goo v yf absente dar approche ne come presence ye man answerd v ye knowe well wyf brought forth ij sone one wēte ye said wild beestis deuoured hym yet herd neuer hym ne apperid yf ye sholde take sone ony thyng happend hym waye ye shold brynge myn hore sorowe helle therfor yf shold come home fader brynge child sith sowle helth fader dependeth child see yt come v shal deye thy seruantes shold lede old age wayllyng sorowe helle self shal thy propre seruan̄t whiche haue receyuyd hym vpon faith haue promysed hym sayeng fader yf bryng hym agayn receyue thy seruyse thus said iudas moche iosephus ātiquitatū reherceth pytously saith ouer cause dide hyde cuppe beniamyns sacke knowe whether louyd bēiamin hated hym dide hym tyme sold hym gate money sellyng whete brought kynges tresorye whan alle peple lacked money egypte cam ioseph sayeng gyue v bre • e deye lackyng money answerd brynge beestis shal gyue vitailles yf ye haue money whiche whan brought gaf vitailles food horse sheep ox ass susteyned one yere chaungyng theyr beestis thenne cam agayn second yere sayd hyde fro lorde money faylled also beestis ben goon ther nothyng lefte bodyes londe thenne shal deye thy syght self also lande shal thyne bye v bondship seruytude kynge gyue v seed sowe leste erthe torne wildernes thenne ioseph bought lond egypte euery man sellyng possession vehement hungre hadde subdued vnto pharao peple fro laste termes egipte vnto vtterist endes exepte lande lā gyng preestes gyuen kynge gyuen vitaillis openly alle barnes garner therfore compellid selle possession ¶thenne said ioseph peples lo ye se know pharao oweth possessiō lande take seed sowe ye feldes ye may haue fruyte fyfte part therof ye shal gyue kynge four partes promyse sowe mete seruauntes chyldren whiche answerd helth thyn hōde late lord beholde v shal gladly serue ye kynge fro tyme vnto present day alle lande egipte fifte part paid kynge holden lawe exept londe longyng prestes whiche fre fro condicion thenne israhel dwellid egipte londe iessen possession therof encreced multiplied gretly lyuyd therin xvij yere alle yeres lyf honderd seuen fourty yere whan vnderstode day deth approched callid hym sone ioseph said hym yf may fynde moche grace thy sight moche mercy thou promyse swere thou berye egipte may reste faders take carye fro lande leye sepulchre forn faders ioseph answerd shal doo thou hast cō manded thenne said swere swore thenne israhel adoured worshipped lord torned hym toward beddes heed thenne anon told ioseph fader seke feble anon toke sone manasses effraim cam fader anon told fader lo thy sone ioseph cometh whiche thenne conforted satte vp bedde ioseph entrid iacob saide almyghty god apperid luza whiche lond canaan blessid saide shal encrece multeplye tourbes peples shal gyue londe thy seed sempyternal possession therfore thy two sone ben born londe egypte fore cam hether shal ben sone effraim manasses shal reputed symeon ruben thou shalt gete shal thyn shal called name theyr brethern theyr possession thenne seyng iosephs sone said hym ben thyse chyldren ioseph answerd sone whiche god haue gyuen place brynge hether said may blesse israel eyen dymmed myght see clerly grete age toke hym kyssed said ioseph defrauded fro sight furthermor god hath shewd thy seed thenne whan ioseph toke fro faders lappe worshippid hym knelyng lowe therthe sette effraym right side lyft syde israhel manasses right side fader israhel whiche toke right hande leyde heed effraim yonger brother lyft hande heed manasses first born thenne iacob blessyd sone ioseph said god who sight walked faders abraham ysaac god fedde fro yongthe vnto present day angele hath kepte alle euyllis blesse thyse chyldren name called name fadres abraham ysaac growe multytude vpon therthe thenne ioseph seeyng fader sette right hand vpō heed effraim yonger brother toke heuyly toke faders hande wold haue leyd heed manasses said fader nay fader conuenyent ye doo first begoten sone sette thy right honde heed whiche renyed wold doo said wote sone wote doo sone shal encrece peples multeplye yonger brother shal gretter seed shal growe gentyles blessyd sayēg tyme shal blessyd israhel shal said make god like effraim manasses said ioseph sone lo dye god shal yow shal reduce brynge agayn vnto londe faders gyue one parte aboue thy brethern whiche gate wan fro hande amorrey swerd mybowe thenne iacob called sone fore hym said hem gadre ye gydre may shewe yow thynges ben come fader israhel ¶and told eche condion singulerly whan blessid xij sone comanded berye hym faders double spelūke whiche felde ephron ethey ayenst mambre londe canaan whiche abraham bought saide gadred hym hys foot deyde whiche anon ioseph sawe fylle visage kissed hym comanded maistres phisik medicine whiche seruauntes shold enbame body fader swete spice aromatykes whiche alle thenne wente sorowyng hym xl dayes egypcyens waylled hym lxx dayes whan wayllyng passyd ioseph dyde saye pharao sworn promysid berye hym londe canaan pharao saide goo berye thy fader lyke thou hast sworn whiche thenne toke faders body wente hym accompanyed aged men pharaos hous noblest men burthe londe egypte hows ioseph brethern without yong child flockes beestis whiche lefte londe iessen felawship chares carte horsmen grete tourbe companye cam ouer iordan halowed thexequyes grete wayllyng vij day long whan contre sawe plancte sorowyng saide grete sorow thegypcyens place named yet bewayllyng egypte child israhel dyde cōmanded bare hym londe caanan buryed hym double spelūke whiche abraham bought thenne whan iacob fader buryed ioseph alle felowship retorned egypte thenne brethern deth fader spaken gydre pryuely dredyng ioseph wold auenge wronge euyll hym camen hym saide thy fader comāded v er deyde shold saye thus praye thou wilt forgete remembre synne trespaas thy brethern ne malyce executed beseche thou wilt forgyue thy fader seruaunt god wickednes whiche whan ioseph herde wepte bitterly brethern cā hym knelyng lowe grounde worshippid hym sayd ben thy seruauntes answerd ye nothyng aferd ne drede wene ye may resiste goddes wyll ye thought haue euyl god hath torned good hath exalted ye see knowe shold saue moche peple ye nothyng aferde shal fede child conforted fair wordes spack frendely ioyously abode duellyd stylle egypte alle hous fader lyuyd hondred ten yere sawe sone effraym thirde generation thyse thynges said brethern deth god shal vysyte shal doo departe fro londe vnto londe promysed abraham ysaac iacob whan tyme shal come take bone lede fro place thenne deyde who body enbamed swete spyces aromatikes leyde chest egypte thus endeth thystorye ioseph brethern hyer next foloweth thystorye moyses whiche redde chirche mydlēte sonday thyse ben name child israhel entryd egipt iacob eche entrid houshold meyne ruben symeon leuy iudas ysachar zabulon beniamyn dan neptalyn gad aser alle nombre entred lxx ioseph fore egypte whan deed brethern kynred chyldren israhel grewe multeplyed gretly fylled erthe thenne ther newe kynge vpon egypte whiche knewe nothyng ioseph said peple loo see peple child israhel grete strenger come late v wysely oppresse leste multeplye gyue v bataylle fyght v dryue v londe thenne ordeyned prouostes maystres ouer sette awerke put affliction burthen bylded pharao two tone phiton ramesses moche oppressid moche encreced multeplyed egypcyens hated chyldren israhel put affliction scornyng hauyng enuye oppressyd bytterly theyr lyf wyth hard sore labour tyle claye greuyd alle suche werkis kynge egypte said mydwyues hebrew one callyd sephora phua comanded whan tyme burth ye shal doo offyce helpyng burthe chyldren yf mā chyld slee hym yf maid childe kepe late lyue mydwyues dredde god dyde kyng comanded reseruyd kepte men chyldren kynge sente said cause ye reserue kepte men chyldren answerd ther ben thebrewys wymen crafte mydwyuys wel er come chyldren born god dyde wel herfore vnto mydwyues peple grewe gretly comforted cause mydwyues dredde god edefyed howses thenne pharao cōmanded peple sayeng whatsomeuer born male caste ye ryuer wymen kepe ye late ye thē lyue man hows leui wente toke wyf hys kynrede whiche conceyuyd brought forth sone sawe hym elegaunt fayr hydde hym thre monethes whan myght lenger hyde hym toke lytyl krybbe rysshes wykers pitchid glewe pitche put therin chylde sette ryuer lete dryue donn streme suster chyld stondyng aferre consyderyng shold falle therof happed tyme doughter kynge pharao descended doun ryuer wasshe water maydens wente brynke whiche thenne whan sawe lytyl crybbe fiscelle sente one maydens fetche take vp whyche fette brought sawe therm lyeng fayr chyld hauyng pyte said one chyldren ebrewis anon spack suster chyld wilt thou said goo calle woman thebrews shal may norysshe childe answerd go thy waye mayde wente called moder pharaos doughter saide ¶ take chylde norysshe hym shal gyue thy mede rewarde moder toke chyld norysshid whan wened coude goo delyured doughter kyng pharao se receyuyd adopted stede sone named hym moyses sayeng toke hym water ther grewe wexe praty chyld iosephus antyquitatū saith douhgter pharao whiche named termuthe louyd wel moyses reputed hym sone adopcion day brought hym fader beaute toke hym hys armes made moche hym sette dyademe heed wherin ydole moyses anon toke caste vnder foot trade wherfore kyng wroth demanded grete doctours magyciens shold falle child kalked natyuyte said shal destroye thy regne put vnder foote shal rewle gouerne thebrews wherfore kynge anon decreed shold put deth said moyses dyde chyldhood ought dye therfor conceyled make therof preef dyde sette fore hym plater ful cole brennyng plater ful cheryes bad hym ete toke put hoote cole mouth brenned tongue whiche letted speche euer thus escaped deth iosephus said whan pharao wold haue slayn hym thermuthe doughter plucked hym away sauyd hym thenne tyme moyses ful growen wente brethern sawe affliction man egypte smytyng one hebrew brethern loked hether theder sawe nomam smote thegypcien slewe hym hyd hym sonde another day wente fonde two hebrew braulyng syghtyng gydre thenne said hym dyde wronge smytest thou thy neyhbour whiche answerd hath ordeyned prince iuge vpon v wilt thou slee thou slewest day egypcyen moyses aferde said hym self dede knowen made open pharao herd herof sought moyses slee hym whiche thenne fledde fro syght dwellyd londe mady • n satte pyt syde ¶ preste madyan vij doughters whiche cam theder drawe water fylle vessel gyue drynke flockes sheep fader thenne cam herdmē putte thenne roose moyses defended maydens lete watre sheep whiche thenne retorned fader ietro said come ye erlyer ye wont doo sayde man egypte hath delyueryd v fro hande herdmē also drewe water v gaf sheep drynke saide lefte ye man goo calle hym may ete somme brede v thenne moyses sware wold dwelle hym toke sephora one doughters wedded wyf whiche conceyuyd bare hym sone callyd gersam sayeng straunger straunge londe brought hym forth another sone named eleazar sayeng god fader helper hath kept fro hande pharao longe tyme deyed kyng egypte chyldren israhel wayllyng made grete sorowe thoppressyon theyr labour cryde vnto god helpe crye cam vnto god theyr werkis god herde theyr wayllyng remembryd promyse made abrahā ysaac iacob lord beheld chyldren israhel knewe moyses fedde sheep ietro wyues fader whan brought sheep innerest part deserte cam vnto mount god oreb lord apperid hym flāme fyre myddys busshe sawe fyre busshe busshe brenned thenne said moyses shal goo see grete vysyon busshe brenneth lord thenne beholdyng wente see callyd hym beyng busshe said moyses moyses whiche answerd thenne said lord approche ner hytherward take thy shone fro thy foot place thou stondest holy groūd said also god thy fader god abraham god ysaac god iacob moyses thenne hydde face durst loke toward god god saide haue seen thaffliction peple egypte haue herde theyr crye hardnes yt suffre werkis knowyng sorow descended delyuer fro hand thegypcyens shal lede fro londe good londe spacyous land floweth mylke hony vnto place cananeis ethei amorrey pheresey eney iebusey crye chyldren israhel comen haue seen theyr affliction ben oppressyd thegypcyens come shal sende vnto pharao thou shalt lede chyldren israhel egypte thenne moyses said hym shal goo pharao lede chyldren egypte god said shal shal signe sende whan thou shalt haue bedde peple egypte thou shalt offre god vpon hylle moyses said vnto god loo yf goo chyldren israhel saye god faders hath sente yf saye name shal saye lord said moyses ego sum qui sum said thus shal thou saye child israhel sente yet shalt thou saye lord god fadres god abraham god ysaac god iacob hath apperid sayeng thys name euer memoryall fro generacion generacion go gadre gydre senyors aged men israhel saye lord god faders hath apperyd god abraham god ysaac god iacob sayeng vysytyng haue vysited haue seen fallen egypte shal lede thaffliction egypte londe canane ethei c̄ vnto londe flowyng mylk hony shal thy voys thou shalt goo take senyors israhel kynge egypte shalt saye hym lord god thebrewes hath called v shal goo ionrey iij dayes wyldernes may offre lord god knowe wel kynge egypte shal suffre goo stronge hande shal stratche hand shal smyte egypte meruaylles shal doo amyd emong shal lete goo shal thenne gyue grace peple fore thegypciens whan ye shal goon ye shal departe voyde ne wyth nought euery womā shal borowe neyhbour hostesse vessel syluer gold clothes shal ye leye sone doughtres ye shal robbe egypte thēne moyses answerd saide shal byleue ne voys shal saye god hath apperyd god saith thenne hym thou holdest thyn honde answerd rodde lord said caste ground threwe doun torned vnto serpent wherof moyses aferde wold haue fledde ¶ lord said hym put forth thy hande holde hym taylle stratched forth hys honde helde hym torned agayn rodde byleue haue apperid yet lord said hym put thy honde thy bosom whiche whan hath put drawen agayn lyke lepres hand lord bad hym withdrawe hys bosom agayn drewe thēne lyke flesshe yf byleue fyrst signe tokene shal byleue seconde yf byleue none two ne thy voys thenne take water ryuer poure drye ground someuer thou takest drawest shal torne blood thenne moyses said pray lord sende som eloquente haue lettyng speche lord said hym made mouth mā hath made man dombe deef seeyng blynde go therfor shal thy mouth shal teche thou shalt saye thenne said moyses beseche lord said sende somme thou wilt lord wroth moyses said aaron thy brother dekē knowe eloquent lo shal come mete seeyng shal glad hys herte speke thou hym put wordes mouth shal thy mouth mouth shal shewe ye ought doo shal speke peple shal thy mouth thou shal suche thynges parteyne god take rodde thyn hande whiche thou shallt doo signes meruaylles thenne moyses wente ietro wyuys fader said hym shal goo retorne brethern egypte see yf yet lyue ietro said goo goddes name pee thenne said lord moyses goo retorne egypte alle ben deed sought slee thenne moyses toke wyf hys sone sette vpon asse retorned egypte beryng rodde god hys honde thenne lord said aaron goo ayenst moyses mete hym deserte whiche wente mete hym vnto mount god kyssed hym moyses told vnto aaron alle lord said hym whiche sente hym alle tokenes signes bad hym doo cam bothe gydre gadred assamblyd alle senyors aged men chyldren israhel aaron told alle god said moyses made sygnes tokenes fore peple peple byleuyd herd wel lord vysyted chyldren israhel beholden thaffliction wherfore fyll doun lowe ground worshipped lord moyses aaron wente vnto pharao said said lord god israhel suffre peple departe may sacrefyse deserte thenne said pharao lord yt may 〈◊〉 voys leue israhel kno •• lorde ne wylle leue israhel said hym god • ebrewis hath callid goo 〈◊〉 iourney thre dayes 〈◊〉 sacrefyse vnto lord god 〈◊〉 parauenture pestelence • warre 〈◊〉 v kynge egypte said sollycyte ye moyses aaron peple fro theyr werkis labour goo ye vnto werke pharao also said peple moche see growe multeplye yet moche shold doo yf rested fro theyr labour therfore comāded day prefectes maistres theyr werkis sayeng wyse gyue nomore chaf peple make lome claye late goo gadre stopple make thē doo moche labour dyde fore lasse nothyng doo crye late v goo make sacrefyse god late oppressid labour excercisid attende lesynges thenne prefectes maistres theyr werke said pharao comanded gyue chaf shold goo gadre suche myght fynde ¶and theyr werke shold therfor mynusshed thenne chyldren dysperplyd gadre chaf maistres awayted bad make ende werke ye wonte doo whan chaf delyured yow thus put affliction wold make make many tyles dyde fore thenne vpperist chyldren israhel cam pharao complayned sayeng puttest thou thy seruants suche affliction said ye ydle ye saye ye goo sacrefyse god ye shal haue chaf gyuen yet ye shal werke custumable werke gadre chaf also thenne eldest vpperist emonge thebrews wente moyses aaron said haue ye ye haue ye haue made odour stynke ye sight pharao haue encoraged hym sle v god see iuge bytwene v thenne moyses counseylled lord shold doo said lord hast thou sente hether sith haue spoken pharao thy name hath put thy peple affliction fore thou hast deliueryd lord said moyses thou shal see shal doo pharao strong hande shal late goo boystous shal caste fro land yet said lord moyses lord god apperid abraham ysaac iacob myght name adonay shewd promysed made couenaunt shold gyue lond canaan duellyd haue herd wayllyng tribulacions thegypciens oppresse whiche shal delyure brynge seruytude thegypciēs moyses told thyse thynges chyldren israhel byleuyd hym anguyssh spiretes inne hard labour thenne said lord moyses goo entre pharao bydde hym delyure peple israhel land moyses āswerd shold pharao whā child israhel byleue thenne lord said moyses aaron bothe shold goo pharao gyue hym comandem̄t late chyldren israhel departe said moyses lo heue ordeyned god pharao aarō thy brother shal thy prophete thou shalt saye hym saye shal saye pharao suffre chyldren israhel departe fro hys land shal enharde herte shal multeplye signes tokenes land egypt shal ne byleue shal lede chyldren israhel peple ¶ shal shewe myn hande suche wonder egypte egypciens shal knowe lord moyses aaron dyde lord cōmanded moyses lxxx yer old whan cam stode fore pharao aroan lxxxiij yere whan spack pharao thēne whan fore pharao aaron caste rodde doun fore pharao anon rodde torned serpent thenne pharao callid magyciens iogelers badde made theyr witchecraft inuocacions caste doun roddes whiche torned lyke wyse serpentes rodde aaron deuoured roddes yet herte pharao hard endurat wold doo god bad thenne said lord moyses herte pharao greuyd wil delyuer peple goo hym morn mornyng shal come thou shal stande whan cometh banke ryuer take thy hande rodde torned serpent saye hym lord god thebrews sendeth sayeng delyure peple may offre make sacrefise deserte yet thou hast wille therfor lord said shalt thou knowe lord loo shal smyte rodde hand water flood shal torne blood fysshes ben water shal deye thegipciēs shall put affliction drynkyng thenne said lord moyses saye thou aaron take rodde stratche thyn hand vpon water first plaghe vengeance secōde god sente frosshes many londe ful ryuers howses chambres beddes woo begoon thyse frosshes entrid mete many couerd londe egypte thēne pharao prayd moyses aaron god wold take awaye frosshes wold goo suffre peple doo sacrefise thēne moyses axid whā wold delyure yf ye frosshes voided pharao said morn thēne moyses prayde uoyded alle whan pharao sawe quyt thē kepte promyse wold lete departe thirde vengeāge god sente grete multitude hongry horseflyes many thuste therthe men bote thē beestis thēchantours said thēne pharao fyngre god yet wold pharao lete thē departe fourth vengeance god sente alle maner kynde flyes lyse suche wyse vnyuersal londe egypte ful maner flyes lyse lā de iessen none yet indurate wold lete goo wold shold make sacrefyse god londe moyses wold good iij dayes iourney deserte sacrefyse god pharao said wil wel ye goo deserte goo fer come sone agayn praye ye moyses prayd hym lord flyes voyded ther one lefte whā goon pharao wold kepe promyse thēne fyfthe plaghe god shewd honde vpon feldes vpō horse ass camel sheep ox grete pestelence alle beestis god shewd wonder myracle bytwene possessyons egypcyens possession peple israhel beestis chyldrē israhel ther one perisshid yet pharao hard herted wold suffre peple departe ¶ sixt plaghe moyses toke asshes chymney casted londe anon alle peple egypte wel men beestis ful botchis beelis blaynes woundes swellyng bladder suche wise thēchantours coude ne myght stōde payne pharao yet wold pharao thē ne doo god comāded ¶ seuenth plaghe haylle grete ther neuer none like fore thōdre fire destroied gras herbes egipte smote doun alle feld men beestis londe iessen none herd ne harm doon yet wold pharao delyure ¶ eyght lord sente locustes whiche maner grete flye callyd som̄e place adder bolte whiche bote ete vp corn herbes left suche wyse peple cā pharao desyred hym delyure sayeng lond perysshyd ¶ thenne pharao gaf men lycence goo make sacrefyse leue theyr wyues chyldren stylle tyl come agayn moyses aaron said must goo wherfor wold lete departe ¶ ix plage vengeance god sente gret derknes vpon londe egypte derknesse grete horryble palpable endured iij dayes iij nyghtes whersomeuer chyldren israhel wente lyght ¶ thēne pharao callid moyses aaron said goo ye make sacrefyse vnto lord god late sheep beestis abyde moyses saide shal take v suche hostyes sacrefyses shal offre lord god flockes beestis shal goo v ther shal remayne moche naylle shal necessarye honour lord god knowe shal offre tyl come place pharao indurate hard herted wold lete goo bad moyses shold nomore come sight whan thou comest thou shalt deye moyses answerd thou hast said shal nomore come thy presence thēne lord said moyses resteth one plage vengeange ¶and shal lete goo first saye peple euery man borowe frende womā neyghbour vessell gold syluer clothes lord shal gyue peple grace fauour borowe thegypciens thenne gaf comandement shold departe lord said moyses mydnyght shal entre egypte first begoten chyld heyr alle egypte shal deye fro first begoten sone pharao sytteth trone vnto first begoten sone handmayd sytteth atte mylle first begoten beestis ther shal grete crye clamour alle londe egypte suche wyse ther neuer none lyke ne neuer shal emōg chyldren ther shal hound hurt ne noman ne beest wherby ye shal knowe myracle god deuydeth thegypcyens israhel moyses aaron shewd alle thyse sygnes plaghes fore pharao herte indurate wold late thē departe thenne whan moyses said chyldren shold dooer departed ete theyr pask lambe cerymonyes ben expressyd byble lawe tendure euer emōg thē whiche chyldren israhel obeyed accōplysshyd mydnyght lord smote slew euery fyrst begoten sone thurgh londe egypte begynnyng first sone heyr pharao vnto sone caytyf laye pryson also first begoten beestis pharao ar • o nyght seruaūtes egypte ther grete clamour sorouful noyse crye ther hows egyptebut ther laye therin one deed thēne pharao dyde calle moyses aaron nyght said aryse ye goo waye fro peple ye chyldren israhel ye saye ye wyll take sheep beestis lyke ye desyred departyng blesse ye thegypcyens constrayned chyldren departe goo theyr waye hastely sayeng shalle deye chyldrē israhel toke thenne mele put sholdres comanded borowed vessel syluer gold moche clothyng lord gaf suche fauour fore thegypcyens thegipcyēs lente thē yt desyred spoylled robbed egypte aed child israhel departed nyhe nōbre vj honderd thousand foot men besyde wymen chyldren whiche innumerable huge grete multytude beestis dyuerse kynde tyme chyldren israhel dwellyd egypte four honderd yere departed egypte wente ryght way philisteis lord lad way deserte whiche reed see chyldren descēded egipt armed moyses toke hym bone ioseph charged thē doo whā deyde wente thextreme endes wyldernes lord wento fore thē daye columpne clowde nyght colūpne fyre theyr leder ducthe pyler clowde faylled neuer daye ne pyler fyre nyght fore peple lord said moyses shal make herte hard shal folowe pursyewe shal gloryfyed pharao hoost thegipciēs shal knowe lord anon told pharao chyldren israhel fledde anō herte chaūged also hertes seruaūtes said shal doo shal suffre chyldren deꝑrte nomore serue v forthwith toke chare alle peple hym toke hym vjc chosen chares chares wayne egipte duke hoostes poursyewyd chyldren israhel folowed grete pryde whan approched chyldren israhel sawe hym come sore aferd cryed lord god said moyses ther sepulture ynough v egypt must deye wyldernesse said goo fro v late v serue thegypcyens ben moche better v haue seruyd thegypciens dye wyldernes moyses said peple ye aferd stāde see ye grete wondres lord shal doo daye thegypciēs ye see ye shal neuer see thē daye god shal fyght ye stylle lord said thenne moyses cryest thou saye ye chyldren israhel goo forth take thou reyse rodde stratche thy hande vpon see departe chyldren israhel may goo drye thurgh myddle shal indurate herte pharao shal folowe alle thegypciens shal gloryfyed pharao alle hoost carte horsmen thegypciens shal knowe lord whan shal gloryfyed angel god wente fore castellis israhel another cam clowde whiche stode bytwene egypte chyldren israhel clowde derke ye hoost pharao myght come nyght thēne moyses stratched hond vpon see ther cam wynde blowyng suche wyse waxe drye chyldren israhel wente thurgh myddes reed see alle drye foot water stode vp walle ryght syde lyft syde thegypciens thenne poursyewyng thē folowed entryd alle carte chares horsmen thurgh myddle see thēne lord behelde chyldren israhel passyd ouer land syde anon torned water wheles theyr carte torned vp doun drouned hoost pharao sancke doun depe see thenne said thegypciens late v flee israhel lord fightith ayenst v lord said moyses stratche thyn hand vpon see lete water retorne vpon thegypcyens vpon theyr carres horsmen moyses stratched hand see retorned first place thenne thegypcyens wold haue fledde water cam ouerflowed myddys flood couerid chares horsmen thoost pharao ther one sauyd chyldren israhel passyd thurgh myddel drye see cam londe thus delyueryd lord chyldren israhel fro hond thegypcyens sawe thegypcyens lyeng • ed vpon brynkes see alle peple thenne dred lord byleuyd hym moyses seruaūt thēne moyses ye childrē israhel songe sōge lord cātemꝰ dn̄o magnificatus est late v synge lord magnefied hath ouerthrowen horsmen carre men see marie suster aaron ꝓphetesse toke tympane hāde de alle wymen folowed tympanes cordes wē te fore syngyng cantemus domino thenne moyses brought chyldren israhel fro see deserte sur walked iij dayes iij nyghtes fonde water cam marath water bytter myght drynke therof thenne peple grutched ayenst moyses sayeng shal drynke cryde vnto lord whiche shewd hym tre whiche toke put water anon torned swetnes lord ordeyned comandementis iugements ther tempted hym sayeng yf thou herest voys thy lord god thou doo rightful fore hym obeyest comandements kepe preceptis shal brynge none langours sorowes vpon dyde egypte lord thy sauyour thenne chyldren israhel cam helym xij fontaynes water lxx palme tree abode tho watres thenne fro then wente alle multytude chyldren israhel deserte syn whiche bytwene helym synay grutched ayenst moyses aaron wildernes said wold god duellyd stylle egypte satte hath plente brede flesshe haue ye brought v deserte slee alle multytude hungre lord said thenne moyses shal rayne brede fro heuen late peple goo gadre euery day may proue thē whether walke lawe none sixte day late gadre doble moche gadred one day thenne said moyses aaron chyldren israhel euyn ye shal knowe god hath brought fro londe egypte morn ye shal see ye glorye lord haue wel herd murmour ayenst lord haue ye mused ayenst v yet said moyses lord shal gyue euen flesshe ete morn brede vnto fylle moche ye haue murmured ayenst hym murmour ayenst v ayenst lord aaron spack companye chyldren israhel beheld toward wyldernes lord spack moyses clowde said haue herd grutchynges chyldren israhel saye euē ye shal ete flessh morn ye shal fyllyd wyth brede ye shal knowe lord god whan euen come ther cam many curlew couerid lodgyngis morn ther laye lyke dewe aboute circuyte whan sawe cam gadre smal white lyke colyandre wondred said mauhu moche saye moyses sayd brede god hath sente ete god comandeth euery man shold gadre moche euery heed mesur gomor late notyng left tyl morn syxthe day gadre ye doble moche two mesures gomor kepe one mesure sabate whiche god hath sanctefyed comandeth halowe yet som̄e brake goddes comandement gadred ete kept tyl morn thēne began putrefye ful wormes kept sabate day good putrefyed thus lord fedde chyldren israhel xl yere deserte called manna moyses toke one gomor therof put tabernacle kept perpetuel memorye remēbraūce thēne wente forth alle multytude chyldren israhel deserte syn māsyons cam raphydym water thēne alle grutchyng said moyses gyue v water drynke whō moyses answerd grutche ye ayenst tēpte ye lord peple thirsted sore lacke penurye water sayeng hast thou brought v egipte sle v chyldrē beestis ¶ thenne moyses cryde vnto lord sayeng shal doo peple trowe within whyle shal stone deth thēne lord said moyses goo fore peple take oldremē senyors israhel take rodde thou smotest flood thy hand shal stonde fore vpon stone oreb smyte thou stone rodde water shal come therof peple may drynke moyses dyde fore senyors israhel callyd place temptacion cause grutche chyldrē israhel said god v thēne cā amalech fought ayenst chyldren israhel raphidim moyses said thēne iosue chese men goo fyght ayenst amalech morow shal stande toppe hylle hauyng rodde god hand iosue dyde moyses comanded hym faught ayenst amalech moyses aaron hur ascēded hylle whan moyses helde vp hādes israhel wan ouercam enemyes whan leyd thē doun thenne amalech better hādes moyses heuy aaron hur toke thēne stone put vnder hem susteyned handes eyther syde handes wery vnto goyng doū sonne iosue made amalech flee peple strength swerd lord said moyses wryte remembraūce book delyure ceris iosue shal destroye put awaye memorye amalech vnder heuē moyses thēne edefied aulter vnto lord callyd name lord lord myn exultacion sayeng hand god batayll god shal ayenst amalech fro generacion generaciō whan ietro prest madyan whiche cosyn moyses herd saye lord moyses chyldren israhel peple ¶ toke sephora wyf moyses ij sone gersam elyazar cam hym deserte moyses receyuyd wyth worship kyssyd hym whan gydre moyses told hym lord dō pharao thegypcyēs israhel labour endured lord delyuered thē ietro glad alle thise thynges god sauyd thē fro handes thegypciēs said blessid lord hath delyuerid fro hand thegypcyens pharao hath sauyd peple know grete lord aboue goddes cause dyde proudly ayenst thē ietro offred sacrefyces offryngis lord aaron alle senyors israhel cam ete hym fore lord next day moyses satte iuged demed peple fro mornyng vnto euenyng whiche whan cosyn sawe said hym doost thou sittest thou allone peple • arye fro morn til euen whō moyses answerd peple come demaūdyng sentence dome god whā ther ony debate dyfference emonge thē come iuge hem shewe preceptes •• wes god thēne said ietro thou • ost wel ne wysely folye thou consumest thy self peple yu doost aboue thy myght thou maist allone susteyne doo ther lord shal thou vnto peple tho thynges apparteyne god yt thou telle thē shold cerymonyes ryte worship god way whiche shold goo werk shal doo poruyde peple wyse men dredyng god trouth hate auaryce couetyse ordeyne trybunes centuriones denes may tymes iuge peple yf ther grete charge weight late referrid late iuge smale thinges shal esyer bere charge whan parted yf thou doo soo thou shalt fulfylle comandement god susteyne preceptis peple shall goo hom theyr place pe • thynges whā moyses herde vnderstonden dyde coūceyllyd hym chase ye strēgest wysest peple israhel ordeyned thē prynces peple tribune cēturiones quinquagenaries denes whiche alle tymes shold iuge deme peple alle grete weyghty mater referryd hym demyng iugyng smale cause thenne cosyn departed wente contre ¶ thirde moneth child departed egypte day cā wyldernesse synay ther boute regyon mounte fyxed theyr tentes moyses ascended hylle vnto god ¶ god callid hym hylle said shalt thou saye hows iacob chyldren israhel ye self haue seen haue egypciens haue born whynges egles haue taken yf ye therfor voys kepe couenaunt ye shal regne preesthod holy peple thyse ben wordes thou shalt saye chyldren israhel moyses cam doun gadred byrthe expowned alle wordes lord comaunded hym alle peple answerd alle euer lord hath said shal doo whan moyses shewd peple wordes lord lord said hym shal come clowde peple may spekyng byleue euer ¶ moyses wente told peple lord bade sanctefye peple day morow late wesshe clo • he redy thirde day thirde day lord shal descē de fore peple mount synay ordeyne peple markes termes circuyte said beware ye ascende hylle ne towche endes someuer towcheth hylle shal dye deth ther shal hande towche hym stone shal oppressid castyng hym shal tolben whether man beest shal lyue whan thou herest trompe blowen thenne ascende hylle moyses wente doun peple sanctefyed halowed thē whan wasshen herr clothis said ye redy thirde daye approche wyues whan thirde daye cam mornyng wexed clere herde thondre lyghtnyng saw grete clowde coure moūte crye trompe shrylle peple sore aferd whan moyses brouht forth vnto rote hylle stode mounte synay smoked somoche lord descended fyre smoke ascended fro hylle fro fornays mount terryble dredeful soun trō pe grewe lytyl contynued lenger moyses spack lord answerd hym lord descended vpon toppe mounte synay euen toppe hit called moyses hym whiche whan come said hym goo doun charge peple yt come termes hylle see lord yf doo moche multitude shal perisshe preestis shal come late sanctefyed lest smeton doun thou aaron shal ascende hylle alle peple preestes late passe theyr boundes leste god smyte thenne moyses descended told peple alle lord hath said lord callyd moyses said lord god brought egypte thraldom gaf hym comandemētis first spekyng many cerymonyes ben rehersed byble whiche requysyte wreton ten comandementes euery man bounden knowe er moyses receyued wreton wente vp mount synay fasted xl dayes xl nyghtes er receyuyd whiche tyme comanded hym make many thynges ordeyne lawes cerymonyes ben newe lawe also doctours saye moyses lerned tyme thystoryes fore wreton makyng heuen erthe adam noe abraham ysaac iacob ioseph brethern atte laste delyueryd hym two table stone bothe wreton honde god whiche folowen folowen ten comandemens lawe first comandement god comanded thou shal worshipe straunge ne dyuerse goddes seye thou shalt worshipe god thou shalt reteyne thyn hope setteth pryncypally hope ony creature faith byleue ony thyng synneth dedly suche ben worshippe ydoles make god creature someuer doth synneth ayenst comandement doo yt ouermoche loue tresours gold syluer ony erthely thynge ben passyng transytorye sette herte hope ony thynge whiche forgete leue god creatour maker whiche hath lente alle lyue therfor ought serue hym al goodes aboue alle thynge loue hym worshipe hym wyth theyr herte alle soule strengthe lyke first comandement enseigneth techeth v ¶ seconde comandement thou shalt take name god vayn saye thou shalt notswere hym nothyng comandement lord comandeth gospel thou shalt swere heuen ne erthe ne crature good cause rightful man may swere without synne iugement requyryng trouthe without iugement good nedful cause none maner without reson name lord nought yf swere false wetyngly forsworn ayenst comandement synneth dedely swerith ayenst conscience whan swerith auys delyberacion aman shold swere truly yet nought ony vayn ylle thynge ne malycyously swere lyghtly without hurte blame venyal synne custome therof perylous may wel torne dedly synne yf take hede thenne swereth horrily lord ony membris sayntes despyte blasphemeth thynges ben trewe wyse synneth dedely may haue reson wherby may excuse hym accustome synne synne c̄ ¶ thirde comandement thou shalt haue mynde remembre thou halowe kepe holy thy sabate day sonday saye thou shalt doo werke ne operacion sonday holy daye yu shalt reste fro alle worldly labour entende prayer serue god thy maker whiche restid vij· day werkes made vj dayes fore whiche made ordeyned world comandem̄t accōplyssheth yt kepeth power ye pee cōscience serue god holyly thēne day iewes called sabate moche saye reste comandem̄t may noman kepe spirituelly accōbred cōscience dedely synne suche cō sciēce reste ne pee lō ge suche astate stede sabate day straitly kept olde lawe holy chirche hath stablysshid sonday newe lawe lord aroos fro deth lyf ye sonday therfore ought kepe holyly reste fro werkes ye weke fore cesse werke synne tētende doo ghoostly werkes folowe lord besechyng hym mercy thācke hym benefaites breke sonday solēpne festes ben stablysshed halowed holy chirhe synne dedly dyrectly ayenst comandem̄t god aforsaid holy chyrche yf som̄e necessite holy chirche amytteth graūteth synne moche thēne ye ēploye sondayes festes synnes lecherye goyng tauernes seruyse tyme gloutonye drynkyng dronke synnes oultrages ayenst god ala sorowe trowe ther synne cōmysed sonday holy dayes festes werke dayes thenne ben drō ke fyghte slee ben ocupyed vertuously goddes seruyce ought doo god comandeth v remembre haue mynde kepe halowe holy day doo synne dedely obserue kepe third comandement thyse thre comandementes ben wreton first table apparteynen god ¶ fourth comandement thou shalt honoure worshippe thy fader moder thou shalt lyue lenger therthe comandem̄t admonesteth v wel ware angre fader moder ony wyse curseth sette hande euyl wylle synneth dedely comandement vnderstanden thonour shold doo goostly spirytuel faders thē haue cure v teche chastyse v ben prelate chirche haue charge cure sowles kepe bodyes wil obeye hym hath cure ouer hym whā enseigneth techeth hym good bound doo synneth greuously inobedyent whiche dedely synne ¶ fyfthe comādement thou shal slee noman comandement wil noman shal slee vngeance ne goodes ony euyl cause dedely synne slee malefactours executyng iustice good cause yf lawful may wel doon comandement defended synne wrath hate rauncour yre scripture saith hateth brother homycide whā wylle sinneth dedely ¶ bereth angre herte longe suche ire longe holden herte rauncour hate dedly synne ayenst comandement yet synneth doth pourchaceth shame vylonye hurte another wrongfully counseylleth helpeth greue another tauenge hym wrath angre lyghtly passed without wyll noye greue ony dedly synne ¶ sixthe comandemēt thou shalt doo aduoultrye saye thou shall haue flesshly cōpanye another mānes wyf comādemnēt forboden defended maner synne flesshe called generally lecherye whiche right fowle synne vylaynous ther somme braunche dedly synne ofte meuynges flesshe may eschewed whiche men oughte restrayne refrayne moche maye cometh ofte tymes outrageous drynkyng etynge euyl thought foule touchyng suche thynges may grete peryll comandement defended alle synne ayenst nature maner persone ¶ seuenth comandement thou shal thefte comandement forbedeth take away mē ne thynges someuer bee without reson ayenst wyll owe make comā dement defended rauayne vsure robberye deceyte begylyng haue theyr hauoyr good doth ayenst comandement bounden make restitucion yeld agayn hath goten taken yf knowe ought rendre ¶and yf knowe bounden gyue goddes sake doo counseyl holy chirch reteyneth wrongfully without reson mennes good agayn theyr wyll synneth dedely yf paye oweth yf knowe power hath wherof yf knowe late hym doo counseyl holy chirche doth synneth ayenst comandement dedely ¶ viij comandement thou shalt bere false witnesse ayenst thy neyghbour comandement forboden noman shall lye wetyngly lyeth doth ayenst comandement also forswere hym iugement ne make lesynges noye ne greue another ner ought myssaye ne speke euyl entencion tenpayre good name fame dedly synne ayenst comandement saye euyl good men behynde bacbyte wetyngly malyce whiche called detraction also accuse somme theyr folye herkene maner adulacion flateryng whan men speke present doo thus saye suche wordes doo ayenst comandement false witnessis nyne comandement thou shalt desyre wyf thy neyghbour ne shalt coueyte thyn herte saye thou shalt consente synne thy body comandement defendeth desyre haue companye maner wymen maryage euyl sygnes ben without forth make men drawe synne euyl wordes suche matere foule euyl attouchyng kyssyng handlynge suche dyfference bytwene comandement syxthe aforsaid syxthe comandement forbedeth dede wythout forth forbedeth consentyng within forth consentyng withinforth haue companye woman maryage dedely synne sentē ce gospel saith seeth woman coueyteth herte hath synneth herte dedly vnderstonde consentyng eypresse thought tenth comandem̄t thou shalt coueyte nothyng longeth thy neyghbour comandement defendeth wylle haue thynges longe men euyll rayson wrongfully comandedemēt defended ēuye mēnes wele mennes grace welfare suche enuye cometh euyl couetytyse haue suche good suche grace fortune seeth couetyse whan consentyng thoughte certaynly one thenne dedly synne yf ther ony ylle mouynges without wyll consentyng damage hurte dedly synne yf synne herin venyel synne thyse ben ye ten comdement lord whiche iij first belonge god vij ben ordeyned neyghbours euery persone hath witte vnderstandyng hym agayn whiche lord hym make therin lord wrote comandements lord comanded hym make arke tabernacle whiche arke kepte thre thinges ¶ first rodde whiche dide meruaillis potte ful manna ij table grudchyd agayn moyses wold haue ordeyned duc haue retorned egypte wherfore moyses woo desired lord delyure hym fro lyf cause sawe vnkynde ayenst god thenne god sente grete plente curlew two dayes one nyght flewe thycke ground toke gete nombre flewhe heyhgt two cubytes many dreyde hem hangyng tabernacle tentes yet content euer grutchyng wherfore god smote toke vengeaūce hem grete plaghe many deyde moyses humblest mekest man world anone thenne lord said hym aaron marye goo ye thre vnto tabernacle lord said ther none lyke moyses spoken mouth mouth repreuyd aaron maria cause spack moyses beyng departe ye castellis vij dayes shal callyd agayn maria shytte castellis vij dayes peple remeuyd fro place tyl callyd agayn lord cō manded moyses sende men londe canaan shold gyue thē charge see considere goodnes therof euery trybe shold sende som̄e moyses dyde soo lord comaunded whiche wente brought fruytee wyth hem brought braunche one clustre grape moche two mē myght bere bytwene vpon colestaf whan seen contre consydered space xl dayes thei retorned tolde commodytees londe som̄e said peple stronge many kynges gyauntes suche wyse said imprenable peple moche strenger wherfore peple anon aferde murmured agayn moyses wold retorne agayn egypte thenne iosue chaleph whiche two consydered lō de said peple grutche ye wherof ye aferd haue wel seen contrey good wynne contrey floweth ful mylke hony rebelle ayenst god shal gyue v ye aferd thenne alle peple cryed ayenst hem whan wold haue taken stone stoned hem lord glorye apperyd clowde vpon coueryng tabernacle said moyses thys peple byleueth sygnes wondres haue shewd hem shal destroye alle pestylence shal make prynce vpon peple gretter strenger thenne prayd moyses lord peple wold haue pyte destroye haue mercy magnytude mercy lord request forgaf neuertheles lord said tho men seen mageste sygnes meruaylles dyde egypte deserte haue tempted hym ten tymes obeyed vnto voys shal see ne come contrey londe haue promysed theyr faders iosue caleph seruantes shal entre londe theyr seed shal possesse moyses told vnto chyldren ¶ waylled sorowed gretly therfor peple remeuyd fro then cam deserte syn maria suster moyses aaron deyde buryed place thenne peple lacked water cam grutched ayenst moyses yet wesshed abyden egypte thenne moyses aaron entryd tabernacle fylle doun ground lowe prayd vnto lord seyeng lord god clamour thy folke ther bysshop entendeth moche behelde alleway vysage merualled grete beaute thus fyxed hys eyen hys corage hurte thauncyent enemye whan sawe herte hym hurte greuous dart deuyl apperceyuyd began tencrece beaute moche bysshop thenne redy requyre synne whā myght thenne pylgryme cam began smyte strongly yate oc dore wold opene thenne cryde knocked strongly bysshop axed woman yf wold pylgrym shold entre said men shold axe first hym question greuous ynowh yf coude answere therto shold receyuyd yf coude shold abyde wythout come worthy vnwetyng alle agreed sentence enquyred whiche suffysaunt put questyon whan none founde suffysaūt bysshop said none v suffyssaunt ye dame ye passe v alle fayr spekyng shyne wysdom alle propose ye question thenne said demande ye hym whyche grettest meruaylle euer god made lityl space thenne one wente demanded pylgrym pylgrym answerd messager dyuersyte thexcellence face men emonge also many men haue ben sith begynnyng world vnto thende ij men myght founden theyr face lyke semblable alle thynges whan thanswer herde alle meruaylled said thys veray ryght good answere question thenne woman sayde late seconde question proposed hym whiche shal greuous answere preue better wysedō hym thys whether erthe hyer alle heuen whan demanded hym pylgrym answerd heuen imperyal body ihesu cryst whyche fourme flesshe hye heuen thys answere meruaylled whā messager space fro abysme vnto heuen thenne messager demanded pylgrym answerd hym goo hym sente axe hym thynge knoweth better better answere hath mesured thys espace whan fyl fro heuene abysme neuer mesured thys nothyng woman deuyl whyche hath taken forme woman whan messager herd sore aferd told fore herde whan bysshop herde sore aferd anon forthwith deuyl vanysshyd away fore eyen bysshop cam agayn hym self repreuyd hym self bytterly wepyng repentyng requyryng pardon hys synne sente messager fetche brynge pylgryme fonde hym neuer thenne bysshop assemblyd peple told maner thynge prayd wold orysons bysshop haue deuocion remembraū ce seynt andrewe ¶ prouoste cyte taken away felde fro chyrche saynt andrewe prayer bysshop fallen stronge feuer thenne prayd bysshop wold praye hym wold yelde agayn predicacion vnto tytle hys passyon ther percid thurgh glayue deyde crysostomus saith whan thomas cam party thre kynges whiche cam worshippe lord baptised theym made helper ayders lord crysten feith ¶ praye thenne thys holy apostle saynt thomas wyll moyen vnto lord may haue grace hym amende v thys present lyf may come hys euerlastyng blysse amen endeth lyf saynt thomas thappostle foloweth lif seynt suche wyse cam hys cō pan •• • wente vysytyng crysten prysonners dyuerse prysons pouerte fowle clothyng admynystred suche thynge neded good therfor husbonde made straytly kept suche wyse nothyng ete wold slee cause wolde good make hys pryde iolytees thenne lady wel supposed haue deyed sente ofte lettres saynt grysogone holy saynte recomforted hys lettres well myght happed mene whyle husbonde deyde thenne delyuerd fro pryson thre damoyselles whiche susters serued enformed taught shold renye theyr fayth ne theyr good lyf ony menace ne thretenynges prouost shold doo prouost day cam drawe hym pottes pannes cawdrons kyssed thē suche wise foul horrible • nd black whan yssued hys meyne awayted hys comyng supposed ben hys wytte bete hym well fledde fro hym feer lefte hym allone wente complayne hym vnto themperour whan cam yate sergeant sawe hym black smotted bete hym wel wyth roddes cratchyd hym vysage helde hym wood caytyf knewe foull blak therfor meruaylled moche dyde hym somoche shame fore dyde hym somoche honour supposed clad whyte robe whan told hym arayed thēne supposed maydens enchaunted hym sente theym wolde haue despoylled alle naked fore hym cause myght see behold ease hym hys lecherye theyr clothes anone fast glewed theyr bodyes wyse myght take ne despoylled ¶ thenne fylle slepe rowted fast noman myght awake hym last thyse thre vyrgyns martred suffred marcus marcellianus taken constrayned thēperours worshipe doo sacrefyse vnto thydolles ther gyuen thē respite xxx dayes prison without receyue deth crystē faith within whiche tyme myght coūseyll aduyse self whether wold sacrefise thydolles leue frendes suffred tyme respite come thē prison tentrete reuoke fro faith saue lyues thēne cam parentis frendes bygan saye whens cometh hardnes herte ye despise old age fader moder whyche ben olde ye gete vnto thē new sorowes grete payne byrthe grete sorow haue sorow moder suffreth reherse wherfor right dere frendes praye ye wylle thyse sorowes put somme remedye departe leue errour crysten men anon thyse wordes theyr moder cam entred cryeng teryng heeres hede shewyng pappes sayd alle wepyng ala meschaunt vnhappy lese two sone haue gyuen souke nourisshyd swetely thou fair sone thou swete debonaire said thou lyke semblest wel thy fader ala meschief sorowe delyuerd fayr sone lese sone owen goon deye dere chyldren haue ye mercy sorouful moder grete mesease grete wepyngis pour caytyf shal doo lose two sone deth see goo theyr fre wyll ala thys newe maner deth desyre deth fore come moder vnneth said complaynt theyr fader brought bytwene ij seruantes whiche thentre shewde hys sone dust vpon pouerte hys hoore hede cryed ala sorowful caytyf come deth two sone theyr owen agreement wyll deye ouerderest sone sustenance staf myn olde age swetely nourysshed taught lerned science thys open folisshnes rage comen causeth loue desire deth ther neuer suche folye ne rage seen world ye frendes come forth helpe bywepe chyldren ye haue hertes pyte ye old yong wepe ye wyl wepe moche see deth sone whyle fader thus wepte said cam two wyues thyse ij sone whiche bare armes chyldreen whiche wepyng cryeng said saye ye ben dere husbondes ward leue ye v chyldren ala shal bycome v chyldren goodes sake shal lost ala caytyues thyng v happened haue ye herte yron maner may ye harded nature cruel also despyse fader moder refuse frendes chace aaway wyues renye forsake chyldren delyuer self deye shamefully thise lamentable wordes fore wretō ij said sone marcus marcellianus abasshed hertes mollified almost retorned fro crysten faith wold fauour parētis frendes haue sacrefyse thydolles thise wordes saynt sebastian knyght whan sawe thē thus trauelled amolisshid anon cam thē said ye right noble knyghtes ih̄u cryst wise hardy ben comē victorye goo abacke fewe blaundissyng wordes vayne myserable ye wyll lose victorye ꝑmanable lese ye euerlayng lif blaūdysshyng wordes wymen ye exāple cristen mē strong faith addresse ye hertes aboue ye world lose ye crowne wepynges wyues childrē wepe certes shold day glad ioyous yf knewe yt ye know ne ther none lif see fore eyen shal come nought yf knewe lyf without deth thithoute heuynesse ioye permanable euerlastyng wythoute doubte wold haste thē goo vnto lyf shold repute lyf vayne ful myserye also fals sith begynnyng world hath deceyued frendes conquerd yt haue affiance hym hath lyed promyse yet doth dayly lyf harme maketh gloutons maketh lecherons maketh theeues slee angry cruell lyars fals deceyuable putteth discorde emong wedded maryed peple debate emong peasible world cometh alle malyce alle felonnye thys euylle doo lyf putte theyr desyres wene longe lyue therin whan yt thus serue world haue vsed theyr lyf dooyng thise euyll aforsaid thenne gyueth doughter deth perpetuelle reward lyf thys world gyueth seruātes departe frō thys world despourueyed bere nothyng synnes thys saynt sebastien torned hym parentis frendes said thys maner ye frendes lo lyf thys world deceyueth suche wise ye discounseylle frendes fro euerlastyng lyf ye destrouble chyldren shold come companye heuene honoure permanable thamytye themperour celestyall folyssh wordes false wepynges yf shold assente repeell shold whyle dwelle wyth shold departe fro companye ye shold see tormentes shold neuer ende cruel flam̄e deuoureth soules mescreants worshipper ydollis dragon eten doo one course cote woldest helpe take vp thys rynge make grete feste prouost said wherfor hast thou put forth proposiciō tarquillinus answerde shewe adoure one god prouost said vnderstondest yu thys contemplacion comandement dacian prouost vyncent valeryen drawen valence caste pryson whan prouost supposed ben almost perysshyd hungre payne comanded come fore hym whan sawe hool ioyeful beyng wroth tymerous herte put thy voys escrye hym frely fader yf thou wylt comande shal goo answere iuge valerian said right dere sone longe sith haue cō mysed charge spekyng byhoueth answere fayth whyche ben bysshop shold put exile vyncente man presumptuous despytons shold put tormented place named eculeo made lyke crosse twhart whyche two endes fyxed therthe hys membres shold theron broken fere whan thus broken dacian said hym saye vyncente seest thou thy body vnhappy vyncent smylyng sayd hym thys way haue desired thēne prouoste beyng wroth began saye menace hym many turm̄ ti vyncent said hym vnhappy man wenest thou angre greuously thou tormentest moche pyte shal god haue aryse vp thou vnhappy man cursid thy wyckyd spyrite yu shalt vaynquysshyd thou shalt fynde strenger vertue god suffre thy tormentis thou hast power tormente thenne prouoste angry began crye bochers toke scorgis roddes began smyte bete hym wyth roddes yron saynt vyncent said saist thou dacyen thou thy self auengest tormentes thenne prouost wood sayd bochers ye wretch doo ye faylle wexe faynt hondes ye haue ouercomen murdrers aduoultrers coude hyde nothyng emong tormentes thys vyncent shal mowe surmoūt tormentes thenne bochyers toke combes yron began kembe hym side within flesshe blood ran doun ouer hys body thentrayllis guttes appiered ioyntures hys side dacyen said hym vyncent haue pyte thy self suche wise yu mayst recouer thy fayr yongthe wynne spare tormentes ben yet come vyncente said hym venymous tongue deuyll doubte nothyng thy tormentes fere sore thou wylt fayne haue mercy moche see angry moche reioysed wyll tha • thou wyse mynusshe ne lasse thy tormētes thou knowe thou vaynquysshed thynges thēne take tormente brought vnto torment fyre blamed repreued bochyers longe taryeng thenne wyth hys good wyll mounted vpon gredyron ther rosted broylled brente hys membres styked wyth smal • nayles yron pryckyd wyth brennyng poyntels yron whan blood ran fyre made woundes vpon woundes thenne caste salt fyre shold sparkle spryng woū de hys body alle partes woundes shold cruelle brenne doo hym payne hys body flammes suche wyse pryckys yren myght holde hys membres entraylles whyche henge hys body derke pryson gadre gydre sharp shellis prycke hys foot late hym stratched thē wythout ony humayn comforte whan shal deed come telle thyes right cruel mynystres obeyed hym theyr lord right cruel kyng martyr ouercomen prudencien wrote cruelte pyte sayeng vyncent sayd dacien torm̄ te pryson naylles vngles streynynge combes yron flāmes fyre deth whiche laste ende paynes thise ben playes iapes cristen men thenne dacian said ouercomen bynde hym drawe armes theyr ioyntes breke ye bone suche wyse alle membres departed thende breth hym sprynge holis hys membres torne knyght god lawhed thyse thyngis blamed blody handes cause put hokes naylles depper hys membres whan pryson angele god said hym aryse vp noble martyr surely aryse vp thou shalt felawe accōpanyed wyth sayntes knyght inuyncible strengest alle strōge thise aspre torm̄tes cruell doubte ye vaynquer prudencien saith yu art noble world yu berest victorie double batayll thou hast deserued ij crownes gydre praye thēne hym impetre grace lord ihesu cryste may deserue come vnto hys blisse ioye heuē regneth ¶ amen endeth lyf passion saynt vyncent foloweth lyf saynt basylle bysshop first interpretacion hys name basille said basis greke moche saye foūdement leo peple foūdement wold go maker elli sayd basilisco serpente ouercam serpent • enemye mankynde lyf saynt basille saynt basille venerable bysshop solempne doctour amphilonus bysshop ycome wrote lyf shewde vision hermyte named effraym moche holy tyme said eff • aim traunse sawe pyler fyre who hede areched heuens voys ther vpon sayeng suche basille lyke vnto thys pyber thou seest thys hermyte cā cite see daye epiphanye noble mā whan sawe hym clad whyte vesture goyng honourably clergie thēne thermyte said hym self see wel haue laboured vayn nought sette suche honour may suche haue seen haue born burthen labour ye hete day grete payne neuer suche thynge whiche sette suche honour also thus acōpanyed colompne fyre haue grete merueylle may saynt basylle sawe spirite made hym brought hym whan comen sawe tongue fyre spekyng hys mouth thenne said effraim truly basille grete truly basille pyler fyre verily holy ghoost speketh mouth effraim said saynt basille sire praye thou impetre god may speke greek saynt basille saide thou hast demaunded hard thyng neuertheles prayd hym spack greek another hermyte sawe saynt basille wente thabyte bysshop demed euyll hys thought delyted estate vayn glorye anon ther cam voys sayd hym thou delytest playng handlyng thy catte basille doth hys araye •• urnementis malens themperour whych susteyned tharryens heretikes toke away chyrche fro crysten men gaf arryens whome saynt basylle sayd thou emperour wreton honor regis iudicium diligit thonour kynge requyreth true iugement dome kyng iustyse wherfore thenne hast thou cōmanded catholyque crysten men ben put holy chyrche themperour said hym yet retornest thou saye vylonye apperteyneth saynt basille said apperteyneth wel also deye iustyce thenne demostenes prouost mete themperour vpholder tharryens spack made answere corrūped langage make satisfaction saynt basille said hym apperteyneth ordeyne mete themperour enquyre techynges dyuyne whiche confused held hym stylle said thēperour said saynt basille goo thou forth iuge thou bytwene fauour ne ouer grete loue thou hast one partye ne hate thou hast thenne saynt basille wente said fore tharryens catholyques yt doores chirche shold shette faste sealid wyth sealis eyther partye euery shold praye god hys right chyrche shold delyueryd thē who prayer shold opene thus accorded arryens verse dores opened entryd gaf lawde preysynd god chyrche rendryd agayn emperour dyde promyse saynt basylle moche good honour yf wold consente hym saynt basille sayd demande make chyldren fulfylled wyth dyuyne wordes wyl suffre one syllable dyuyne science corrupte thenne themperour grete indygnacion hym toke penne wryte sentence hym shold exyled first penne brake ye second also thyrde hys hande began tremble fere thenne grete indygnacion alle rente cedule ther honest worshypful man named heradius whiche one doughter dysposed consacre god fende enemy mankynde enflamed made one seruaūtes ye brēne loue thys mayde whan remēbred seruant hym thought possyble euer shold atteyne come hys desyre noble virgyne wente enchaaunteur promysed grete quantyte moneye yf wold helpe hym thēchantour answerd coude shal sende deuyll whych mayster lord yf thou doo shal saye thou shalt haue thy desyre yong man sayd wold doo enchanteur sente lettre hym deuyll thus conteynyng lord mayster cause must hastly besily drawe alle yt may fro religion crystendom brynge thy wyll thende thy partye alleway growe multeplye sende thys yong man esprysed loue mayde demandeth hys desyres may accomplysshyd herin haue glorye honour fro forthon may gadre drawe moo thēne gaf hym hys lettre hym goo mydnynght stande vpon tō paynem calle deuyll hold vp thys lettre thayer anon shal come anon wente forth dyde boden helde lettre thayer forth cam prynce derknes felawshipped grete multitude fendes whan redde cedule said yong man wylt thou byleue yf accomplyssh thy desire answerd wold doo thenne deuyl sayd hym renye thenne ihesu cryst whyche sayd renye hym deuyll sayd hym ye crysten men ye alle fals vntrewe whan ye haue doo ye come whan ye haue ye demande anon ye renye retorne ihesu cryst receyueth cause ryght debōnayr yf thou wylt doo thy wylle make londe thyn owne hand wrytyng delyuere lete conteyne thou hast forsaken ihesu cryst thy baptesme profession crysten relygion thou seruaunt wyth atte iugement dampned anon wrote toke ye deuyll put hym seruytude anon ye deuyl toke hym fēdes serued fornycacion comāded shold goo enflāme herte mayde loue yong mā whiche cam enflā med loue ye man fyll doun ground fore fader cryeng piteously sayenge fader haue pyte cruelly tormented loue seruaunt haue mercy shewe faderly loue ye owe ye gyue mariage yong man desyre yf ye doo ye shal see anone shal deye therof shal ye answere atte day dome fader wepyng said ala wretchyd befallen god haue mercy doughter yt thus taketh away tresour quenchyth light myn eyen wold haue gyuen spowse heuene wende haue saued weste saynt basylle sayd shal thou saye yf deye • y day ioseph sayd syre wyse possyble thenne sayd saynt basylle yf lyue vnto morowe none shalt thou doo ioseph sayde yf thou lyue vntyl morow houre shal deye saynt basylle sayd thou sayst trouthe thou shal dye synne shal dye thēde yu lyue ih̄u criste ioseph said wote wel yu saist yf thou lyue vnto tyme shal doo thou saist thēne saynt basille said wel nature shold haue deyde anon forthwith yet gate impetred god space shold thēne deye lyued vnto morn none thyng seyng ioseph merueylled moche byleued ihesu crist saynt basille thēne toke wold assaye yf myght reyse ony sklaundre ayenst saynt ioh̄n saynt ioh̄n cam cyte wente vnto alle bordelles comyn wymen said eche ordre gyue thys nyght doo fornycacion thenne entred hous one corner alle nyght hys knee prayer prayd morn wente comanded eche thē shold telle nomā yet one manyfested hys lyf anon saynt ioh̄n prayd began tormented deuyll anon wymen said god hath gyuen thou hast wyth monkis men thenne som̄e said hym take wyf chaūge thyn habite thou sklaū dre faynyng hym self wroth said veryly shal wyl sklaundrd late hym sklaūdred late hym smyte forhede ayenst walle ye ordeyned iuges god goo ye take heed self ye shal gyue none acomptes thys said lowde voys ne complayned saynt ioh̄n hys gouernaunce lord harded herte gaf credence wordes prayd god wold shewe hys werkes som̄e creature deth sholde torne hym synne defamed hym thys meane brought many conuerted sette many closed religyon morenyng wente fro one thyes comyn wymen mett wyth man entred doo fornycacion gaf buffette sayd thou wycked man amendest thou thy wycked lyuyng said hym byleue right wel thou shalt haue suche buffet alle alysaūdre shal assemble wondre fende cam lyknes man yaf hym buffete said hym thys buffet thabbot vytale promysed anon rauysshyd wyth fende tormented peple drewe hym wondred hym atte last repentaunt heled prayer saynt vytale whan seruaunt god nygh hys ende lefte wrytyng hys allone rede thynuocacions grete multitude feendis cam aboute hym made hym aferd made signe crosse anon vanysshed away whā maistre retorned told hym happend hym maistre said hym yt alleway hated fered signe whan thēne emperour remēbrid rof cause wold vse craft deuyll ouerall fonde ye signes crosse destroyed thē persecuted crysten men cause knewe well otherwyse feendes wold doo hym happed descended regyon called perside fro then sente thoccident deuyl haue answere sayd hym deuyl wente abode x dayes one place wythout meuyng cause ther monke contynuelly prayer nyght day whan myght doo retorned thenne iulien demanded hym ben longe answerd haue ben place fonde monke nyght daye prayeng supposed haue troubled hym shold nomore pray whyle coude neuer torne hym fro prayer thus retorned wythout doyng ony thyng thenne iulien thapostata grete indignacion sayd whan cam thider wold auenge hym monke whan wente perse deuylles promysed hym yt shold haue victorye cyte maister enchantemens whyche deuyned deuyl hym said crysten man dooth smythis sone said yt made sepulture iulyen maistre redde thistorye saynt basille cam cesar • e capadoce saynt basille cam ayenst hym presented thre louys hym whyche sente hym iulien grete indygnacion yefte breed sent saynt basille heye sayeng thou hast sente mete dombe beestis therfor take sende saynt basille said haue sente suche ete thou sendest v thou nourisshest thy beestis whiche answere iulien wroth said whan shal haue perse shal destroye cyte suche wyse shal better ordeyned ere sowe peple dwelle ye nyght syewyng saynt basille sawe vision chyrche lady grete multitude angellis myddle woman beyng trone whyche said calle mercurye iulien thappostata hath slayn whyche blasplemeth sone mercurye knyght fayth god slayn iulyen buryed chyrche thenne anone mercurye alle armes kept present comandement lady wente bataylle seynt basylle awoke affrayed wente ye tombe knyght buryed opened sepulcre fonde neyther body ne armes thenne comanded kepar take away body sware euen fore saynt basylle morn retorned fonde body armures spere blody anone cam one fro bataylle whyche sayd iulyen thapostata emperour bataylle thyder cam knyght vnknowen armed wyth hys spere whych hardyly smote hys hors wyth hys spore cam iulyen themperour brandysshyd swerd smote hym thurgh body sodenly departed neuer seen gydres yel whan shold dye toke hys hand ful blood caste ayer sayeng ¶ thou hast vaynquysshed man galile thou hast ouercomen cryeng thus myserably espyred deyed grete payne left wythout sepulture hys men flayn perses hys skynne made kyng perses vndercoueryng thus deyed cursedly thus enden lyues foure holy sayntes euerich named iulien one fals apostata foloweth lyf saynt ignacien bysshop fyrst thynterpretacion hys name lady epistle wise vnto marye virgyne bare ih̄u cryst body humble ignacien seruaūt sende gretyng yet nouyse fayth dysciple ihesu cryst ioh̄n thy dere frende desyre haue som̄e comforte consolacion som good enseygnem̄t techyng ihesus thy sone haue herde saye many merueylles whiche enioyed hast ben alleway companye thou knowest wel secret desire hym thou hast playnly enformed yet yong fayth truste moche endoctryned enformed creaunce byleue lady god salewe lettre answerd gloryous virgyne marye manere ignace good disciple iesus especyal frende humble handmayd ih̄u cryst sendeth gretyng doo wete ioh̄n hath sayd ihesu cryst thou hast lerned hym trewe doctryne thyng certayne goo alleway good creāce byleue kepe fermly promesse thy crystyn fayth doo thy werkes acordyng shal come wyth ioh̄n visite cristen mē hold alleway well fayth good werkes late persecuciō ne aduersite yu shal suffre moeue fro thy fayth ne fro thy creaunce haue solaas affyaunce ih̄u crist thy sauyour thanswere lettre saynt ignacien man right wel lerned thyrde bysshop saynt peter thappostle chirche anthyoche moche desired martir ye faith ihesu crist happed traian whych emperour rome passyd anthioche ignace shewed hym blamed thys persecuted crysten men wherfor themperour dyde hym taken put yrons wyse x knyghtes ladde rome presented fore themperour alle senatours rome constrayned promesses menace tormentis many grete horryble adoure thydolles saynt ignace shewd clerely yt theyr goddes ben theuys rybauldes men abhomynable euyl lyf dampned helle ben grete errour thys cursid men made theyr goddes worshypped deuyllys forsake god whyche made created world hys blessyd sone whyche humayne nature redemyd sauyd world fynably thys tormented fyre betyng pryson themperour dyde sende romayns place dyde groū den bytwene teeth thyse bestes whych may pure brede presented lord anon lyon cā strangled hym wythout treryng hys flessh ony thyng hurtyng wherfor traian grete merueylle departed fro place wymen siewed hym whyche gadred vp dropes hys blood whyche wymen anon taken constrayned sacrefye theyr goddes whyche said yf thou wylt worshippe thy goddes doo reuerence sende thē water wasshe make agathe virgyne right fayr noble body herte riche goodes thys gloryous virgyne serued god cyte gathanence ledyng pure holy lyf quyncyen prouost secyle beyng lowe lygnage lecherous auaricious me • vnto ydolles whan sawe ferme purpoos put kepyng woman named affrodysse whyche ix doughters ouer foule lyke vnto moder thys dyde enduce saynt agathe doo hys wyll • wythin xxx dayes affrodysse doughters entreted holy virgyne consente wyll prouoste somtyme made grete promysses temporell goodes grete eas somtyme made menace greuous tormentes suffre grete paynes saynt agathe answerd frely courage thought ben fermly founded vpon ferme stone ihesu cryst payne may chaunged wordes ben wynde promesses ben rayne menace ben ryuers passe wel yt thyse thyges hurtle atte foundement courage yet shal wexe softe torne yron soft leed torne corage thys mayde take fro crysten fayth dought • e haue done none thyng nyght ne day one another laboure myght torne herte consentyng haue promysed name precious aournementes clothes gold howses londes townes seruantes grete maynees thys despyseth reputeth valew whan quyncian herd thys anone made come fore hym iugement demaunded lygnage atte laste wold constrayne make sacrefyse vnto thydolles saynt agathe answerd goddes deuylles thydollys made marble wood ouergylte qunncianus said chese one two doo sacrefyse goddes thou shall suffre payne tormentes saynt aghate sayd thou sayst goddes cause thy wyf one venus thy goddesse thou thy self jupyter whyche homycide euyll quyncyanus sayd appyereth wel thou wylt suffre tormentes thou sayst vylonnye saynt agathe sayd meruaylle moche one wyse man suche fole becomen thou sayst thy goddes who lyf thou ne thy wyf wylle folowe yf good wold thy lyf lyke vnto theyres yf thou refusest theyr lyf thenne art thou one accorde wyth saye thēne euyll foule forsake lyuyng suche lyf thy goddes quyncianus said goost thou thus vaynly spekyng make sacrefyse vnto goddes yf thou doo shal make deye dyuerse tormentis saynt aghate abode ferme stable fayth theenne quyncianus dyde doo put derke pryson wente also gladly good wyll ben prayd goon weddyng morn quyncianus made brought fore hym iugement said agathe art thou aduysed thy helth answerd cryst myn helthe quyncianus said renye cryst thy god whyche thou mayst escape thy tormentis saynt agathe answerd nay renye yu thyn ydolles whyche ben stone wood adoure moche ioye alle hys syne wes shronken feble sore tormented wyth palsye iosephus heryng therof dylygently enquyred cause sekenesse tyme therof manere cause ne sekenes knowen tyme whan herde theleccion cryste sythe cristen thou hast taken fro whiche noyed thenne dyd iulyan melte leed cast mowthe dyd doo brynge bedde yron made quyriache layed stratched theron leyed vnder brennyng cooles threwe therin grece salte tormente hym whan quyryache moeuyd iulyan themperour said hym outher thou shalt sacrefye goddes thou shalt say leste thou arte crysten whan sawe wold doo neuer neyther dyd doo make depe pytte ful serpentes venemous bestys caste hym therin whan entred anone serpentes al deed thenne iulyan put hym cawdron ful boylyng oyle whan shold entre hit blessyd sayd fayre lord torne thys bayne baytym marterdom ¶ thenne iulyan moche angry commaunded shold ryuen thorugh herte wyth swerde manere fynysshed lyf vertue crosse declared v many myracles happed tyme one enchauntour dysceyued notarye broughte hym place assembled grete companye deuylles promysed hym wold make hym haue moche rychesse whan came saw one persone blacke syttyng grete chayer alle aboute hym al ful horryble people blacke whiche speres swerdes thenne demaunded thys grete deuyll enchauntour clerke thenchauntour sayd hym syr owres thenne sayd deuyl hym yf thou wylte worshyp seruaunte • enye ihesu cryste thou shalt sytte right syde clerke anone ble • syd hym wyth sygne crosse sayd seruaunte ihesu cryste sauyour anone made crosse grete multitude deuylles vanysshed aweye happed notarye tyme entryd wyth lord chyrche saynt sophye knelyd doun knee tofore ymage crucyfyxe whiche crucifyxe semed loked moche openly sharpelye hym thenne lorde made hym goo parte another syde alle weye crucifyxe torned tyen toward hym thenne made hām goo lyfte syde yet crucifixe loked hym thenne lord moche admerueyled charged hym commaunded hym shold telle hym wherof soo deserued crucifyxe behelde loked hym thenne sayd notarye coude remembre hym good thynge doon saufe one tyme wold renye ne forsake crucifyxe tofore deuyl thenne late v blesse v sygne blessyd crosse may therby kepte fro power ghoostly dedely enemye deuyl brynge damoysel fro place exyle sente hyr two vyrgyns named eufrosyne theodore whyche nourysshed hyr ende shold torne chaunge hir vowe conuerted thyse two vyrgyns feythe hir exortacion thenne aurelyan toke husbondes two maydens thre enchauntours wyth hym came domycelle wedde accomplissh maryage force ageynst hir wyll domycylle god wold conuerted yonge men feyth ihesu cryste whan aurelyan sawe conuerted two yonge men two vyrgyns afore sayd ledde hir chambre maad enchauntours synge commaunded daunce hym wold defoule domycelle iogelers lefte syngyng daunsyng hym self seced daunce two dayes contynuelly vnto tyme exspyred deyed tofore alle thenne luxuryus whyche hys brother gate leue slee alle byleuyd ihesu cryste dyd moche place dwellyd dyd doo sette fyre beyng theyr prayer rendryd theyr sowles vnto god who bodyes saynt cezayre vpon morne fyndyng thynge hurte buryed 〈◊〉 thenne lete v praye may come euerlastyng blysse heuen amen thus endeth lyues nerey achilley foloweth saint pancrace first interpretacion name pancrace sayd pan moche saye al gratus cicius moche say curtoys hys yonge age otherwyse said book called glosayr pancrace sayd rapynge pancrace subget betynges tormentys pancrace also sayde dyuers colour soo appyeryd hym vsed rapyne rauysshyng exortacyon praye caytyues mysbyleuyng bryngyng theym feythe also subgette betynges tormentys suffrynge also dyuers colour full alle vertues saint pancrace pancrace right noble lignage borne contree frige whan fader moder dede put gouerned hande denys hys vncle whiche broder hys fader bothe came rome patrymonye grete rentys strete pope cornelyus helde hym pryuely whiche pope pancrace denys receyued crysten feythe fynably denys deyed contrey pancrace taken presented cesar thenne pancrace aboute fonrtene yere age whome emperour dyoclesyan sayd lytel chylde warne counceyl thou aduyse wel ende thou deye euyll dethe chylde thou art lightly deceyued cause thou arte noble blood ayd lignage sone one right dere frende praye thou leue madnesse thou hast emprysed may haue wyth sone whome pancrace answerd yf chylde body yet myn herte olde vertu lord ihesu cryste thretenyng menace make moeue dothe payntyng see vpon walle thyse goddes thou woldest shold worshyp ben deceyuers creature haue germayns fornycacions maad ageyn god theyr creatour haue spared kynne ne yf thou haddest knowleche thy seruaū te suche thou sholdest commaūde shold sleyne moche meruayle ye adoure suche goddes whan themperour herde chylde thus speke doubted ouercomen hym commaunded heed shold smyten marterd aboute yere lord two hondred foure score fyue who body worshypfull lady named octouylla whiche senate grete dylygence buryed honourably hym sayd gregory turone doctour yf man wyl make false othe place sepulcre tofore come chauncel quyre shal trauaylled wyth euyl spyryte mynde shall falle pament alle deed happed tyme grete altercacyon bytwene two men iuge wyste wrong ialousye iustyse brought bothe vnto aulter saynt peter swere prayeng appostle wold declare right whan wronge sworen none harme iuge knewe malyce hym sayd al hyghe ¶ olde peter eyther ouer mercyful pro • yce thys yonge man lete v goo pancrace demaunde • ym trouthe whan came sepulcre culpable sware stratched forthe hys honde myght wythdrawe hys honde ageyn hym anone deyed therfore vnto day moche peple vsed grete notable cause men make theyr othes vpon relyques saynt pancrace thus endeth lyf saynt pancrace foloweth saynt urban first thynterpretacion name vrbanus sayd vrbanyte curtosye sayd vr saye fyre lyght bana saye responce answere
