who doughter conceyued chylde knyghte whan perceyued therof examyned begoten chylde sayd monke maryne leyen hir goten thenne anone fader moder wente abbay maad grete compleynte grete clamour thabbot monke maryne thēne thabbot beyng herof sore abasshed sente maryne demaūded hym doon horryble synne mekely answerd sayd holy fader aske lord mercy haue synned thenne abbot heryng thys moche angry sorowe shame commaunded anone shold put hows thenne maryne ful paciently wente monasterye dwellid yate thre yere lyued straytly wyth morsel breed day whan chylde wened fro moders pappe sente thabbot sente maryne bad hym kepe suche tresour broughte forthe thenne toke mekelye pacyently chylde kepte hym two yere al thyse thynges toke grete pacyence al thynges gaue lord thankynges atte last brethern pyte hym consyderyd humylyte pacyence dyd moche thabbot taken monasterye al offyces moste foule enioyned hym toke gladly alle thynges dyd pacyently deuoutely laste beyng ful vertuous lyf deyed departed world whan shold take vp body wasshe dyspose hyt buryed sawe woman alle astonyed aferde knowleched tr • spaced gretely seruaunte god thenne ranne alle see syght asked foryeuenes theyr ygnoraunce trespaas thenne bare body hyr chyrche honourably buryed ¶ thenne enfamed seruaunte god taken vexyd wyth deuyl knowlechyng hyr synne came sepulcre blessyd vyrgyne delyuerd made al hool who tombe people oueral aboute came assemblyd lord shewyd many myracles hys blessyd vyrgyn maryne deyed xiiij kalendys iuyl thus endeth lyf saynt maryne ¶here folowen lyues saint geruase prothase firste ynterpretacion name • eruase sayd gerar whiche moche say vessel holy gena say straū ge syor lytel holy meryte lyf vessayl receyue vertues hym self straunge despysyng world lytel despysyng hym self prothays sayd prothos che moche say fyrst syon dyuyn prothas may sayd procul ferre stasis sette say fyrst dygnyte dyuyn dyleccion ferre sette fro worldly affecaon saynt ambrose fonde theyr passyon wryten book founden sepulture theyr heed saynt geruase prothase saynt geruase saynt prothase brethern one burthen fader moder theyr fader saynt vytal theyr moder blessyd valerye gaue theyr goodes vnto poure loue god dwellyd saynt nazaryen whiche made right fayr oratoyr cyte hebredune chylde named celsus bare hym stone yf nazaryen thenne childe celsus none wote neuer hystorye nazaryen reherced celsus offryd hym longe whan offryd ladde nero emperour thys chylde celsus folowed muche sore wepyng one knyghtes buffeted smote hym nazaryen thenne blamyd hym thenne knyghtes grete angre bete defowleden nazaryen vnder theyr foot put celse wyth pryson threwe hym see ladde geruase prothase melan nazaryen delyuerd myracle came melan tyme came thyder erle astase whiche wente batayle ageyn marcomannos whiche came ageynst hym thenne kepers ydolles came hym said theyr goddes wolde gyue none answer yf geruase prothase shold fyrst offre sacrefyse ¶ thenne anone broughte ledde sacrefyse thenne geruase sayd ydolles deef dombe shold requyre helpe almyghty god ¶thenne erle wrothe commaūded hym beten scorges leed longe tyl gaue vp spyrite suffryd dethe thenne commaunded prothase brouȝt hym whome said thou cursyd wretche thynke saue thy lyf deye euyl dethe thy broder whome prothase sayd wretche drede thou dredest whome tasyus sayd shold drede wretche whome prothase sayd thou dredest thou sholdest hurte yf made sacrefyse thy goddes yf thou dreddest hurte thou woldest neuer compelle sacrefyse ydollys thenne prouoste commaunded hym hanged gybet thenne sayd prothase hym angry see thyn eyen thyn herte blynded haue grete pyte cause thou seest thou doest doo thou hast begonne thys day benygnyte sauyour may brynge broder thenne erle commaunded hym heed shold smyton thus suffred marterdom lord phelyp seruaut ihesu cryste wyth sone toke bodyes buryed secretely hows tombe stone layed book hyr heedes conteynyng theyr natyuyte theyr lyf theyr ende suffred dethe vnder nero abowte yere lord lvj thyse bodyes hyd many yerys tyme saynt ambrose founden thys manere saynt ambrose prayer chyrche saynt felyce saynt nabor suche wyse neyther slepte ne woke hooly apperyd hym two yonge men clad whyt vestementys wyth one cote mantel hosed apperyd prayeng hym theyr hondes holden vp thenne saynt ambrose prayed yf illusyon shold appere nomore yf trouthe sholde shewyd hym ¶thenne whan cocke crewe yonglynges apperyd hym adouryng hym semblable manere thyrd tyme apperyd thyrd nyght whan fasted slepte ¶ wyth apperyd saynt peter appostle seen hym paynture thenne yonglynges sayd thyng appostle spake thyse ben desyre none erthely thynge haue folowed myn admonestementes thyse whome thou shalte fynde bodyes suche place thou shalt fynde arche stone couerd xij foot erthe thou shalt fynde theyr heedes litel book wherin conteyned theyr byrthe theyr ende thenne saynt ambrose callyd alle hys neyghbours began fyrst dygge erthe fonde lyke thappostle sayd hym layn place wel thre hondred yere fresshe ben layed houre right swete sauour yssued theyr tombe contynent blynde man touched byer anone syght ageyn many seek people helyd merytes theyr solempnytees pee reformed bytwene lombardes emperour rome thenne saynt gregory pope establisshed introyte ye masse loquetur dominus pacem offyce aperteyned partye sayntes partye grete aduentures tyme saynt austyn reherceth book cyte god present emperour moche grete companye blynde man receyued hys syght melan bodyes geruase prothase knowen whether hit blynde man ¶ also telleth book yonge mā towne named victoryan rode hys hors ryuer laye assone therin deuyl strangled hym threwe hym water alle deed whyles songen euensonge chyrche saynt geruase prothase whiche smyton wyth voyses songe sterte vp lyue grete haste entryd chyrche grete drede helde fast aulter lyke bounden therto thenne deuyl menaced hym sayd yf wold come then wold breke alle membrys lytel whyle merytes holy marters playnly helyd saynt ambrose sayth hys preface ben heuenly baner toke tharmes appostles vaynquysshed haue vyctorye ben assoyled fro snare world destroyed felawshyp fende folowed frely without ony empesshement lord ihesu cryste lyke vnto debonayr fraternyte lerned holy wordes fylthe medlyd emonge glorious stryf thys causeth crowned heuen lyke yssued one bely thus enden lyues saint geruase saynt prothase foloweth lyf saynt edward kyng marter saynt edward yonge kynge marter sone kyng edgare kynge iij yere seuen monethes whan owne moder deed fader kynge wedded another wyf whiche ful wycked hir sone named ethelrede quene laboured sore destroye thys yonge kyng edward make hir owne sone athelrede kynge litel loued kynge edwarde thenne kynge edgar deed whyche ben good iustyser chastysyng rebellys cherysshyng good well dysposed peple blessyd holy man saynt dunstō whiche chyef counceyl moche ruled hym tyme ioye myrthe alle englond quene thorugh entysyng fende enemye laboured euer awayted destroye thys yonge kynge edward happed thys sayd yonge kynge edward rood huntyng knyghtes wode dorset besyde toune warham chaas happed kynge departe aweye men rode forthe allone see broder athelrede therby quene moder castel named corf whan quene saw hym beyng allone ioyeful glad hir herte hopyng thēne taccomplysshe whiche sore laboured fore wente kynge welcomed hym wyth fayre blaundysshyng wordes commaū ded fetche brede wyne kyng whyles kyng dranke botelyer toke knyf roof kynge thorugh body herte suche wyse kynge fyl doun deed anone thenne quenes seruaū te buryed body desolate place wode ende man shold knowe becomen whan saynt dunston knewe kynge murdred maad moche grete sorowe shorte tyme yet parte ageynst wylle crowned hir sone ethelrede kynge thenne sayd kynge moche manslaughter wronge thou arte comen kynge thou shalt therfore haue grete sorowe trowble thy lyues ende al shal falle dethe thy broder edwarde wyl knowe sorowe fyl may see lyf saynt alphey shal see sorowe fyl al dethe saynt edwarde alle poure peple londe sorowed gretely good kynges dethe especyal cause coude knowe buryed wold burye hym moche worshypfully yf myght fynde hym tyme god wolde men warham contre goon seke holy body saynt edward grete deuocion prayeng lord myght haue knowleche holy body sone one soo soughte sawe grete lyght desolate place wode liknes pyler fyre stratchyng fro heuen euen vnto graue holy body laye thenne people ful reuerently dygged vp body brought wyth solempne processyon chirche warham buryed holy body chyrche yerde este ende chyrche durst doo otherwyse dysplesure ye quene ouer graue bylded fayre chapel lady place first buryed right fayre welle whyche callyd saynt edwardes welle lord sheweth many myracles holy marter saynt edward lyke wyse chapel warham holy body laye longe lord sheweth also myracles longe tyme laboure erle alphere whiche moche louyd saynt edwarde bysshoppes clergye counceyl saynt wylfryde saynt edythe susters saynt edwarde nonnes wylton holy body take chapel warham broughte wyth grete solempnyte vnto nonnerye shaftesburye waye men bare thys holy body two creples made al hole folowed holy body wyth grete ioye myrthe thankyng god holy saynt theyr helthe whan came shaftesburye layed thys holy body walle hye aulter right worshypfully bord shewyd many myracles hym whan quene stepmoder herde telle myracles god shewed hym thenne repented hir ful sore cryed god mercy holy saynt hyr trespaas purposyd ryde thyder doo worshyp holy body aske foryeuenes deth cōmysed doon hym whan wolde haue ryden thyderward hir hors wolde goo forth wyse betyng ne drawyng thenne lyghte doun wente thyder ful mekely hir foot ofte hir iourney repentyd hyr cursed dede caused doon thys holy saynt edward whan came shaftesburye thys holy body buryed dyd full grete reuerence therto cryed god mercy holy saynt hir grete offence became ful good woman grete repentaunce therof vnto hir lyues ende whan holy body restyd walle certeyn yeris saynt edward apperyd holy religyous man bad hym goo dame althrede abbesse place say hyr purueye body shold layed worshypful place thenne wente saynt dunston praye hym helpe matere sone saynt dunston came wyth multitude bisshoppes abbottes pryours clergye toke vp holy body layed worshypful shryne whiche abbesse wel dysposed people ordeyned hit whan body take walle came graue flauour like smoke frankencence smellyng swete alle peple gretely comforted therby thus holy kynge marter translated yere lord thousand somwhat whan kyng etheldrede deed edward hys sone regned hym whiche holy glorious kynge confessour lyeth buryed westmestre worshypfully shryned lord hath shewed many grete myracle hym thenne lete v praye holy marter saynt edward kynge saynt edward kynge confessour praye lord v may thys wretchyd world amēde repente v wretchyd lyf whan shal departe hen may come hys euerlastyng lyf heuen amen endeth lyf saint edward kynge marter foloweth lyf saint albone saint amphiabel iulyus cezar first emperour rome deuyded londe fraunce made shyppynge grete brytaygne whiche called englond tyme cassybelan kynge brytons twyes dryuen thyrd tyme helpe one androgeus duc kente vyctorye conqueryd royame subdued rome made paye yerely trybute ordeyned stablisshed certeyn statute londe whiche longe obseruyd kepte emonge whyche ordeyned none thys londe shold receyue ordre knyghthode onely rome handes emperour lest perauenture rude peple vnworthy wold take vpon ordre vnworthely whiche grete dygnyte also shold make othe neuer rebelle ne bere armes ageynste emperour whyche statute vsed al place obedyent rome vnder theyr subieccion thenne regned londe britayne called englond kynge named seuerus whiche plese emperour dyoclesyan sente sone hyght bassyan wyth many lordes sone cornewayl walys scotlond yrelond vnto nombre thousand fyue hondred xl emonge prynces sone walys grete araye whyche hyght amphyable goodly yonge man wel lernyd latyn frensshe greke hebrewe also felawshyp lordes sone cyte verolamye named albone whyche wel disposed semely yonge man dyscrete gouernaunce al thys felawshyp came prosperouslye rome tyme whan zephyrus pope rome whyche sawe grete bewtee thys yonge companye compassyon crysten laboured moche myght conuerte feythe ihesu cryste emonge al conuerted prynces sone wale amphyabele baptysed hym enformed hym secretely feythe thenne thys holy amphyabel forsoke pompe glorye worlde toke hym wylful pouerte loue ihesu cryste euer contynued lyf perfeccion also many conuertyd tyme whome dyoclesyan dyd seke none coude fynde thenne ordeyned day whiche thyse yonge men shold receyue thordre knyghthode themperours honde hym self gyrded theyr swerdes aboute enformed rule estate ordre whan alle cerymonyes doon longyng ordre othe sworen bassyanus sone kynge seuerus desyred emperour myght preue feetes knyghthode iustyng torneyeng whyche graunted hym gretelye alowed manly desyre noble requeste whiche torneye iustes bassyanus felawshyp pry vyctorye emonge al albone beste knyght moste beste preuyd strengthe wherfore souerayn name tofore al who armes asure sawtyre golde whiche armes afterward bare noble kyng first foūder monasterye called saynt albons beryng armes euer glorious vyctorye deth lefte tho armes monasterye saynt albons thenne whan bassyanus felawshyp longe soiourned rome axed lycence themperour retourne home britaygne whiche emperour graunted alle saufe albone whome manlynes prowesse wold reteyne seruyse aboute persone abode hym seuen yere dyuers cause maxymyan felowe dyoclesyan sente britayne wyth grete armye subdue rebellys wyth albone came ordeyned prynce knyghtes entrid brytaygne ageyn tyme saynt poncyan satte see rome whiche hym self vertuous men prechyd shewyng myracles conuerted vnto feythe ihesu cryste cristenyd cyte rome lxvj thousand men whan emperour herde herof assemblyd alle senatours kynges prynces lordes euery londe beyng vnder thobeysaūce rome haue aduys myght destroye crysten faythe thenne concluded pope shold dampned wyth al cristen people punysshed wyth dyuers tormentes al bookes cristē lawe shold brente chirches throwen doun alle men holy chyrche slayne euery place whiche ordenaunce whan knowen emonge crysten people rome dyuerse partyes world thenne wente departed theyr owne contre emonge whome saynt amphyable whiche longe dwellyd rome departed came home brytayne ageyn borne soo came vnto verolamye none wold receyue hym hys hows walked aboute stretes abydyng comforte god thenne happed mette wyth albone whyche lord cytee prynce knyghtes steward londe hauyng aboute hym grete multytude seruauntes tyme albone rychely arayed clothes frengyd wyth golde whome alle peple dyd grete worshyp thenne amphyabel lefte armes knyght arayed lyke clerke knewe wel albone albone knewe hym hit ben tofore bothe one felawshyp desyred prayed albone herberough loue god albone wythout faynyng alwey loued hospytalite graūted hym herberugh wel receyued hym gaue hym mete drynke necessarye hym whan seruauntes departed wente vnto thys pylgryme secretely sayd hym thys wyse sayd thou arte crysten man comest thyse partyes vnhurte gentyles whome saynt amphyabel sayd lord ihesu criste sone lyuyng god hath surely conduyted hath kepte power fro alle parylles lord hath sente thys londe preche denounce peple feythe ihesu cryste thende shold made peple acceptable hym whome albone sayd sone god whome ye afferme ih̄u criste sone vyrgyne thyse newe thynges haue herde wold fayn knowe crysten men fele therof thenne amphyabel expowned hym declared feythe byleue whyche anone albone dysputed ageyn sayd reson myght le departed fro hym nexte nyght saynt albone sawe dreme alle mysterye faythe wel second persone trynyte came doun toke nature becam man suffred dethe resurrexyon assencion wherof gretely troubled came morne amphyabel tolde hym dremyd thenne saynt amphyabel thanked lord soo enformed hym feythe saynt albone stedfast beleue ihesu cryste thus kepte mayster amphyabel hows vj wekys alwey place named tygurryum helde theyr holy comynycacion longe tyl atte laste espyed compleyned vnto iuge wherfore iuge sente albone clerke cause clerke shold goo walys saynt albone dyd clothe hym like knyȝt lad hym towne departed wyth many teerys commendyd eche lord saynt albone sente fore whiche came hauyng hym clerkys araye clothyng beryng crosse ymage lord hangyng theron ende shold knowe verayly crysten man men came hym drewe hym cruelly iuge askepodot whan paynyms sawe hym bere sygne crosse vnknowen sore trowbled aferde thenne cruel iuge demaūded hym who seruaunte kynrede cause wold telle moche wrothe emōge many questyons tolde hym name albone veray crysten man thenne iuge demaūded hym clerke entryd cyte late spekyng cryste come begyle deceyue cytezeyns knowe ye wel wold haue comen vnto presence hys conscyence hath remeuyd hym hath mystruste cause gyle falsenes hyd vnder doctryne thou mayst wel knowe euydently vnderstonde thou hast gyuen thy consente folyssh man wherfore forsake hys doctryne repente make satysfaccion thy trespaas doyng sacrefyse goddes doon thou shalte onely haue foryeuenes thy synne thou shalt haue townes prouynces men golde power thenne sayd albone iuge thou iuge wordes menace thou hast spoken vayne superflue openlye knowen clerke yf thoughte hym good proffytable also yf bothe hertes accorded therto come thyn audyence wolde assente therto knowyng peple euer redy euyl knowleche haue receyued doctryne repente thynge therof feythe haue receyued restoreth feble seke hele dede preuyth hit feyth dere thenne alle rychesse •• thou promysest precyous thēne al worshyp thou purposest yeue sh • rtely goddes ben false fayllyng moste besely serue theym moste wretchydly dysceyued thenne came anone forthe grete multitude paynyms wyth force strengthe wol • compelle hym sacrefyse commaunded hym offre goddes wyse wold consente theyr cursed rytes commaundemente iuge taken stratched brode scourged greuously beten torned hym lord wyth glad • vysage sayd lord ihesu cryst beseche kepe mynde meue ne falle fro estate thou hast sette hit lord alle herte offre sowle veray sacrafyse desyre made thy wytnesse shedyng blood wordes sowned emonge betynges tormentours bete hym longe theyr hondes wexyd wery peple hoped saynt albone wolde chaunge purpoos therfore kepte vnder gouernaunce iuge vj wekys al tyme elementes bare wytnes iniurye doon holy albone fro tyme takyng vnto tyme delyuerd fro bondes flesshe came neuer dewe ne rayne vpon erthe brennyng hete sonne also nyghtes al tyme vnsufferable hete neyther tree ne feldes brought forth fruyte thus elementes foughten holy man ageynst wicked men iuge askepodot dredde slee hym cause grete loue emperour hym reuerence dygnyte power kynrede vnto tyme enformed dyoclesyan conuersacion whan emperour seen lettres anone maxymyan came brytayne destroye feythe ihesu criste commaunded crysten man shold sparyd sauf onely albone whome sholde entrete ꝑuerte hym fayr promysses fere hym menace soo compelle hym torne ageyn theyr secte yf wolde wyse leue crysten feyth thenne haue capytal sentence byheded sōme knyght worshyp ordre knyghthode clerke conuerted hym suffre fowlest dethe coude ymagyned byholders therof may haue drede horrour semblable paynes whan maxymyan came brytaygne toke wyth hym kyng askepodot wente strayte cyte verolamye fylle commaundement emperour thenne saynt albone brought forth tofore pryson alle weyes coude ymagyne tempted peruerte hym holy man constaunt ferme feythe wherof hauyng indygnacion ordeyned day iustyce whiche day comen gaue sentence fyrst amphyabel euer founden shold scourged bounden stake alle naked thenne nauel openyd bowel fastenyd one ende stake thenne dryuen goo rounde aboute stake tyl al bowellys woūden aboute stake haue heed smyten towchyng saynt albone yaue sentence shold byheded whiche sentence gyuen vnder wrytyng thenne al burgeyses verolamye london townes abowte sōmoned come nexte thursday folowyng iugement see execusyon vpon albone prynce knyghtes steward britaygne whiche day came peple wythout nombre foe see sayd execucyon thenne albone brought pryson whome desyred make sacrefyse iubyter appollyn whiche vtterly refused prechyd feythe cryste conuertyd moche peple crystenyd thenne maxymyan askepodot yafe fynall sentence hym thus sayeng tyme emperour dyoclesyan albone lord verolamye prynce knyghtes stewa • alle brytayne duryng lyf hath despysed iubiter appollyn goddes hath doo derogacyon dysworshyp wherfore lawe iuged deed honde somme knyght body buryed place heed shal smyton sepulture made worshypfully thonoure knyghthode wherof prynce also crosse bare sklauyn ware shold buryed wyth hym body closyd cheste leed layed sepulture sentence hath lawe ordeyned cause hath renyed pryncypal goddes thēne aroos grete murmour emōge peple sayd oughte suffre suche iniurye doon soo noble good man specially kynrede frendes laboured ful sore delyueraunce wherof albone aferde delyueryd fro passyon theyr requeste instaunce stood vp holdyng crosse lokyng toward heuen sayeng lord god ihesu cryste beseche thou suffre fende preuayle ageynst deceytes peple lette marterdom thenne torned peple sayeng wherfore tary ye lose tyme execute ye sentence lete wyte grete enemye goddes whiche haue power ne may doo thynge ne ne see ne vnderstonde whome none wold lyke vanytee blyndenesse emōge worshyp suche ydollys wyl knowe ihesu cryste onely sone god veray trewe lawe thenne paynyms spake gyder assented shold put dethe chose place shold executed named holmesherst thenne aroos contencion emōge people dethe shold suffre somme wold haue hym crucefyed like cryste wold hane hym buryed quycke iuge peple cyte wold haue hym byheded accordyng commaūdemēt emperour ladde forth toward marterdom people place folowyng thys holy man wyth despytous wordes rebuke wherto blessyd mā albone answerd worde mekelye pacyently suffred alle theyr repreuys peple grete multitude ocupyed place whiche large grete heet sonne grete brente scalded theyr foot wente soo ladde hym tyl came swyfte rennyng ryuer myght lyghtly passe prees people many shyfte ouer brydge water drowned many cause myght goo ouer bridge prees vnclothed theym swymme ouer ryuer sōme coude swymme presumed wretchydlye drowned wherof grete rumoure noyse pytously emonge people whan saynt albone perceyued thyynge waybed wepte harme deth enemyes perisshed knelyd doun holdyng hondes vp god besechyng water myght lassed flood wythdrawen people myght wyth hym hys passyon forthwyth god shewed atte requeste saynt albone fayre myracle water wythdrewe ryuer dryed vp suche wyse peple myght saufly goo drye foot ouer ryuer also prayer thys holy man tofore drowned restored ageyn lyf founden lyue depnes ryuer thenne one knyghtes drewe saynt albone toward marterdom sawe thyse myracles god shewyd hym anone threwe aweye swerde fyl doun foot saynt albone sayeng knowleche god myn errour demaunde foryeuenes wepte sore sayd albone seruaunte god verayly thy god almyghty none god therfore knowleche seruaunt duryng lyf thys ryuer thy prayer made drye wherfore bere wytnes god thy god whiche doeth suche myracles whan sayd thus theyr furye woodnes encreced sayd hym thou arte false thou sayest ne thou affermest ryuer thus dryed benygnyte goddes therfore worshyp iubyter appollyn whiche ease haue take vp thys water thys grete hete cause thou takest aweye worshyp goddes rewardest euyl interpretacion thou hast deserued payne longeth blasphemar ¶and thenne forthwyth drewe tethe heed holy mowthe borne wytnesse trouthe greuously beten wyth soo many lefte tare alle membris body brake al bone alle rente body lefte hym lyeng vpon sonde myght wythout wepyng teerys expresse thys holy man albone drawen ledde thorugh bryers thornes sharpe stone blood foot coloured waye wente stone blody thenne atte laste came hylle holy albone shold fynysshe ende lyf whiche place laye grete multytude peple nygh dede hete sonne thurste whan sawe albone grynted wyth theyr tethe hym angre sayeng thou moste wycked man grete thy wyckednesse makest v deye wyth thy sorcerye wytchecrafte thys grete myserye hete thenne albone hauyng pyte sorowed grete affeccion sayd lord madest mannes body erthe sowle vnto thy liknesse suffre thyse creature perisshe ony cause commysed blessyd lord make ayer attemperate sende water refresshe thenne anone wynde blewe fresshe cole also foot thys holy man albone sprange vp fayr welle wherof al peple meruayled see colde water sprynge vp hote sondy grounde hygh toppe hylle whyche water flowyd al aboute large stremys rennyng doun hylle thenne peple ranne water dranke well refresshed thus merytes saynt albone thurst clene quenchyd yet alle grete goodnes shewyd thursted strongely blood thys holy man dethe gaue praysyng lawde theyr goddes toke holy mand bounde hym first stake hynge hym boughe heer hys heed sought emonge peple one smyte heed thenne cruel man redy angre toke swerde smote heed thys holy man one stroke body fyl grounde hede hynge stylle boughe tormentour smyten heed bothe eyen sterte heed wretche myght wyse restoryd ageyn syghte thenne many paynyms sayd vengeaūce came grete riȝtwysnesse thenne knyght whyche lefte deed vpon sonde lityl enforced hym self moche myght crepte vpon hondes vnto toppe hylle whereas saynt albone byheded iuge seyng hym began scorne hym alle myracles ben shewed saynt alboue sayd hym thou lame croked praye thyn albone restore thy fyrst helthe renne hye take heed whiche thou mayst receyue thyn hele taryest thou soo longe goo burye body hym seruyce thenne knyght brennyng charite sayd beleue fermelye blessyd albone hys merites may gete parfyte helthe gete lord whiche ye say scorne whan thus sayd toke enbraced holy heed armes reuerently losed hyt fro boughe sette fayre body myracle lord forthwith restoryd firste helthe forthwyth began preche grete power lord ih̄u cryste merytes saynt albone thenne strenger labour euer tofore wherof yafe thankynges lawde god thys holy marter saynt albone place buryed holy body layed fayre tombe ouer hym afterward paynyms toke knyght bonde hym stake smote heed day iuge gaue lycence people departe goo home nyght seen clere b • comyng doun fro heuen sepulcre saynt albone whiche aungels descendyd assendyd alle nyght duryng syngyng heuenly songes emonge whiche thys songe herde albone glorious man noble martyr ihesu cryste people came beholde syght wherfore many torned theyr false byleue byleuyd ihesu cryste many sone wente walys seche amphyabel baptysed enformed feythe ihesu cryste fonde hym prechyng worde god thenne tolde hym albone marterd token broughte crosse whiche helde honde yet blody hys blood wherby myght euydentelye knowe suffred dethe wherof holy man gaue lawde thankynges lord maad thenne vnto noble sermone suche wyse alle peple came fro verolamye baptysed receyued feythe sone iuge knowleche departyng thys people fro cytee gone walys receyue feythe amphyabel saynt albons mayster wherof moche angry sore moeuyd enquyryd nombre gone fonde thousand moo who name wryton thenne ordeyned multytude people wel armed deffence seche amphyabel people goon hym whiche wente walys fonde alle thyse peple awaytyng amphyabel heryng hym preche word god whome one soo sente sayd amphyabel thou dysceyuer moste wycked alle men hast thou disceyued peple thy deceyuable prechyng steryng forsake trewe lawes goddes commaunde theym leue theyr errour retorne home ageyn cyte yf thou doo shal slee al brynge cyte tormentyd dethe whome one crysten men sayd certeynly thys man verey trewe seruaunte god whome god doeth shewyth dayly myracles al knowleche v veray trewe crysten men redy loue feyth lord ihesu cryste suffre dethe haue therfore rewarde heuen euerlastyng ioye blysse counceyl baptysed receyue feythe cryste whan paynyms herde grete furye ranne vpon al blessyd companye cruelly slewe gladly offred self suffre dethe lord fader slewe sone sone fader brother slewe brother cosyns theyr cosyns thenne holy man amphyabel seyng blessyd companye thus cruelly put dethe recomended sowles almyghty god thēne tormentours toke amphyabel sware theyr goddes wold brynge hym verolamye quycke deed bonde hondes behynde hym faste drewe hym forth goyng fote rydyng foot bledde greuously tyl came place saint albone buryed waye seek man goyng fro verolamye toward amphyabel receyue feythe cryed amphiabel releuyd sekenes paynyms scorned amphiabel ye name lord made hym al hole hys bondes hondes boūde losid wherof sōme paynyms glorefyed lord said amphyabel brought shold come wherof cite glad supposed shold haue forsake feyth tormentours toke bonde hym wyth stondyng alway preched word god one tolde frendes slayn myracles god shewd theyr deth suche wyse many conuerted fayth peple ran cyte place thys holy man stode whiche tombe saynt albon one tormentours grete furye toke holy man bonde hym fast opened hys nauel toke one ende bowellis fastned stake whiche pyght ground made holy man goo rounde aboute stake droof hym whippes bete hym tyl bowellys wounden hys body ¶ al thys payne thys holy man yaf token sorow ne dysease ¶and thenne theyr wodenes ronne vpon hym speres swerdys compelle hym renne aboute tyl alle drawen whiche merueylle peple pacientely myȝt endure suche greuouse tormentes longe wherfor many forsoke theyr ydolles becam crysten whan iuge sawe knewe peple becomen crysten commanded slee incontynent ther slayn nombre thousand peple whiche amphyabel sawe thanked god recommandyng hym sowles thenne tormentours seeyng yet lyf holy man caste stone hym stoned hym alway perseuerid prechyng counseylled baptysed shold haue foryeuenes al theyr synnes yates heuen shold opened cessed theyr cruel castyng stone tthenne atte laste thys holy man amphyabel lyfte vp eyen heuen besechyng lord receyue spirite thenne sawe saynt albon stondyng emonge angellys sayd holy saynt albon beseche thou pray lord hit plese hym sende angel lede surely lette way cursyd ennemy fende vnnethe sayd word two angellys descended fro heuen sayd hym thys day shalt thou heuen wyth albon whan paynems herde thys heuenly voys sore aferd abasshyd angelys toke sowle heuenly songe myrthe bare vnto heuen ¶ departed holy sowle body paynems perseueryng germayns doughters two susters thyse two zacharye wyf elizabeth iust tofore lord lyuyng al iustyficacions holdyng al cōmaūdementes lawe without murmure ne compleynt preysyng thankyng lord god chyldren holy woman bareyn grete desyre haue sone myght byshop lawe successyon lygnage zacharye herof theyr yongthe prayed moche lord whan plesyd vnto lord toke worthe thanked god alle seruyd deuoutely lord god charge onelye serue entende vnto hym many withdrawe fro seruyce loue lord loue theyr chyldren bothe olde wyf elysabeth happed solempnyte iewes august bysshop dyd holy sacrefise doyng offyce apperteyned hym weke wente encence entryd temple peple abode wythout makyng prayer awaytyng comyng ageyn holy bysshop thus allone encencyd aulter aungel gabryel apperyd hym stondyng ryght syde aulter whan holy bysshop sawe hym abasshyd grete drede aungel sayd hym thynge aferde zacharye thy prayer ben herde hast foū den grace tofore lord elysabeth thy wyf shal conceyue bere sone whome thou shalt calle iohan whome thou shalt haue grete gladnes moche people shall make grete feste ioye natyuyte shal grete grete meryte tofore lord shal drynke wyne ne syther ne thynge wherof myght dronken moders wombe shal sayntefyed fulfylled wyth holy ghoost shall conuerte many sone israhel say iewes lord shal goo tofore hym spirite vertue helye prophete conuerte fader sone olde myscreauntes sen rightwysnesse seruyce god whan aungel thus sayd zacharye answerd may byleue knowe trouth thou sayest • olde auncyen wyf olde bareyn aungel answerd sayd gabryel aungel seruaunt tofore god whiche salutacyon yssued body lady gretyng entryd eerys body saynt elyzabeth hir chylde wythin hyr whyche chylde enoynte blessyd holy ghoost presence lord sayntefyed wombe hys moder replenysshed wyth grace thy salutacyon entrid myn eerys chylde bely made ioye feste remeuyd thou arte wel blessyd happy thou hast gyuen feythe byleuyd wordes aungel whiche sayd al thynges shal performed hath sayd alle thyse came parys aceylle felon kynge hougrye enterprysed destroye waste partyes fraunce subdue domynacion bourgeyses parys grete drede sente theyr goodes cytees sure saynt geneuefe warned admonested good wymmen town shold wake saftynges orysons whiche myght asswage yre lord eschewe tyrannye enemyes lyke dyd somtyme two holy wymmen iudyth bester obeyed hir longe many dayes chirche wakynges fastynges orysons sayd bourgeyses shold remeue theyr goodes ne sende towne parys cytees supposed shold sure shold destroyed wasted grace god parys shold haue none harme somme indygnacion hir sayd false prophete deth came said fayre syrres goddes sake myschyef whome ye trete saynt germayn wytnesseth chosen god hyr moders bely loo letter hath sente hyr recōmendeth hym hyr prayer whan bourgeyses herde thyse wordes recyted hym saint germayn sawe letter meruaylled fer • god lefte theyr euyl counceyl dyd nomore therto thus lord kepte hyr fro harme kepeth alle weye deffēdeth thappostle saith hir loue dyd worthy handes anone hool good poynte ther brought hir xij men wood byset deuyls vnto parys ouer harde bystad tormented thenemye virgyn grete pyte went prayer orison requyryng lord salte teris grace goodnes wold delyuer pestylence perseuerid hir prayer hanged ayer suche manere touched thynge aroos fro hir prayer said shold goo saynt denys wode men answerd myght vnbonde virgyn grete sorowe commaūded shold goo thenne anone suffred ledde secretely theyr handes bounde behynde backes wente whan chirche saynt denys stratched hir self grounde orison wepynges thus perseueryd prayer wepynges wode men cryed hygh voys approched whome vyrgyn callyd helpe none ought doubte enemye sawe must nedys yssue goo signefyed mowthe demonyaks appostles marters sayntes holy virgyn callyd came vnto hyr vyrgyn nonne wyf wydowe answerd vyrgyn sacred geneuefe sayd nay tellyng hir place tyme hir defloracion man done feyte whan sawe nought sayd vyrgyne conscience remorsed hir fyl doun hir foot requyryng pardon semblable wyse holy genouefe dyscouerd many secretes theyr conscience whiche ben wryton cause ouer noyous longe wryte woman whome holy vyrgyn helyd chylde age foure yere whiche fyl pyt therin enchauntour mortal mete maad hym ete whiche mete thys holy man ete without ony greuaunce hurte yet dyd make sayd enchaūtour strenger venym thenne dyd tofore gaue saynt vyctor whiche ete hit wythout ony hurte lyke dyd whan enchauntour sawe venym myght wyse greue holy man brente alle bookes renounced al worldely goodes conuertyd hym feythe god alle thyse thynges duc yet admonested saynt victor shold doo sacrefyse hys goddes whyche thynge saynt vyctor refused dyd tofore thenne duc commaunded al synewes body shold al drawen put hym boyllyng oyle dyd doo hange hym chaynes sette vnto sydes pottes alle brennyng neuerthelesse alweye suche wyse recomforted lord felte payne thenne iuge moche abasshed commaunded take quycke lyme vynagre medlyd gyder made auale throte dyd doo put eyen thenne saynt victor said hym spare al prest redy suffre alle tormentys thenne tyraunte commaūded foot hynge vpwarde soo henge thre dayes longe suche wyse moste partye blood bodye ranne nosethrilles ende thought whiche lord hath receyued gree dyd sacrefyse abel whan woman xvj yere olde sayd thys good thynges wordes put sayd loo see ye thaungels paradys brynge two crownes whiche thou shalte haue gretter lasse wel feble vayssel neuerthelesse haue ferme hope lord ihesu cryste shal gyue heritage whan duc vnderstode wordes said commaunded shold doo sacrefyse goddes answerd sayd named corone thou requyrest lose corone whan duc herde hir answer commaunded knyghtes force shold make two tree enclyne bowe doun one ageynst theron henge corone sodaynly lete tree goo dyd whome radour force tree spryngyng rendryd hir sowle lord ferme feythe affyaunce lyf eternal two said tree adressyd hyr glorious body abode two pyeces grounde duc commaunded saynt vyctor shold byheded smytyng heed bledde mylke blood gyder whyche myracle moche people sawe whyche thenne byleueden lord ihesu cryste qui cum patre et spiritu sancto viuit regnat deus per omnia secula seculorum amen ¶thus endeth passyon saynt uyctor marter iohan paule constance doughter constantyn themperour ij prouostes one named ioh̄n paule happed tyme gallycan whiche duc conduytour thoste romaynes shold goo batayle ayenst barbaryns whyche taken dacye contray aboute demaūded cōstance doughter thēperour shold gyuen hym mariage rewarde themperour wold wel hym thoughte myght bycause constance seynt agnes heled wold neuer consent maryed vowed virginyte wherfor wold rather suffre deth enclyne therto neuertheles mayde trusted god said fader retornyng fro batayle yf victorye might wel spoken ye mariage hope therof desired haue ij doughters gallican dwelle hir myght knowe better maners fader delyuerd hym ij pronostes iohn poul go hym batail thēne duc went batail descōfyted fledde cite tharse anon barbaryns assiged thēne said seint ioh̄n seynt poul make thyn avow god heuen thou shalt neuer wedde wyf yu shalt veynquyssh thyn enemyees better thā thou hast thēne dide coūseill morne yonglyng yt bare crosse sholder appered hym said take thy swerde com whan gallican duc takē swerd lede hym thrugh al hys enemyes kyng slewe al host aferde yelded al hym thēne subdued made thē subgettis tributary rome whan went enemyes ij knyghtes appered cōfermed hym faith becam cristē retorned agayn rome receyued wyth grete honour thenne prayed emperour pardonne hym takyng hys doughter ¶ purposed neuer haue wyf kepe hym contynent chaste plesyd wel emperour thenne hys two doughters also conuerted lefte hys duchye gaf poure peple hym self serued god dyd many myracles moche deuyls wicked spirites went bodyes creature symple regarde syghte herof renommee fame went fro est vnto west peple cam fro ferre see grete man chaunged wesshe feete pour men sette atte table gaf ete serued seek men dyd offyce seruytude moche besily happed whan constantyn dede emperour sone grete constantyn emperour alle herresie arryens held thempyre ij neuewes one called gallus iulyan thys gallus badde dyd sle hym thenne iulyan doubtyng beyng afferde entrid relygyon dyssympled semed holy made lector magycyen counseylled wyth fendes answere shold yet emperour happed afterward suche nedes cam constantyn created iulyan gouernour oste named hym cezar grete bateyller man werre thenne whan constantyn dede becam emperour thenne commaunded gallycan duc whyche becom blessyd man shold make sacrefyse thidollys ellys go contraye emperour durst slee grete man thenne went alexādrye mescreantes made one renne hym thorough wyth swerd deserued crowne martirdom ¶ thenne shewed iulyan emperour couetyse hys herte ¶ confermed wytnes gospel seyeng lord ihesus sayde renounceth alle hath may dyscyple therfor herd blessyd sayntes ioh̄n poul riches custance theyr lady lefte susteyned pore cristen peple lord iesu crist demaunded lyke ben wyth constantyn wold shold hym thenne sayd hym whan glorious constantyn constant sone gloryfyed crysten wold wel serue syth thou hast forsaken thy relygyon ful vertues ben departed fro ne wyl nomore obeye iulyen thenne sayd estate clerke chirche yf wold haue abyden moste worshipful bycause vanyte folye serue parisshis ydle haue sette herte cheuallrye therfor haue made sacrefise goddes haue gyuen empyre thus ye haue brought forth norisshed paleys ought syde yf ye haue despyte shal moche shal despysed thēne ansuerd loue better god doubte nothyng thy menace cause wyl angre god thenne sayd iulyan yf ye wylle within x dayes agrement ye shal ayenst youre wylle sayntes said hym thynke ye though ten dayes goon thys day whiche thou purposest doo thenne whome iulyan wene ye crysten men shall make marters yf ye consent shalle punysshe martirs comen enemyes thēne ioh̄n poule duryng thyse x dayes entended prayer almesse tenth day terencyen sent whiche sayd lord iulyan hath sent ye sholde honour ymage iouys whiche bryng ellys ye must deye thenne sayd hym yf iulyan thy lord haue thou pea wyth hym haue none lord ihesu cryst whan iulyen herde thyse wordes made theyr hedes smyte rum offe secretlye buryed theyr hows made said thei wer sent exyle thenne anon fende entred sonne terencyā began crye hous brent deuyl whan tirencyan sawe thys knoulechyd hys trespaas becam crysten put wrytyng passyon thys ij holy seyntes hys sonne delyuerid deuyl den yere grace four hondred sixty four seynt gregory recordeth lady vysitid ofte gladly chirche thyse two seyntes whan cam tyme fonde two monkes straunge abbyte supposed monkes commaunded gyue almesse whyles hyr despencier approched approched sayd thou visetest v shalle visyte atte day iugement shalle gyue may whan sayde anon vanysshed awaye thenne late v praye vnto god theyr merites gyue v thys worlde hys grace hys glorye per cristum dominum nostrū amen endeth lyues holy seyntes iohan paule foloweth seynt leon pope leon pope redde myraclys blessyd lady chirche seynt marie song masse moche people ordre comyned houseled matrone certeyn woman kissed honde wherof tempted vehemently flesshe holy man grete wreker auenger hym self cutte hys honde day pryuelye threwe fro hym afterward people murmured among cause pope song masse dyd dyuyne seruyse solempnly wont doo thenne leon torned hym vnto blessid virgyne lady cōmysed hym self holy hir prouydēce thenne anon appered hym restored hym hys hond reformed hir holy handes cōmaundyng shold goo forth offre sacrefyse vnto hir sonne thenne thys holy man leo preched vnto alle people cam theder shewed euydently hond restored hym agayn leo pope helde coū seyle calcydon ordeyned vyrgynes vayled also made statute vi • gyne marye shold called moder god tyme attila destroyed italye thenne leo wakyng prayed ye chirche thappostlys thre dayes iij nyghtes sayde hys men wyl folow late hym folowe whan thenne approched attylle anō sawe seint leon descēded fro hors fyl doun platte hys foot prayed hym shold aske wold desyred shold goo italye relece cristen peple captyuyte seruauntes repreued hym tryumphyng prynce world shold ouercomen prest answerd haue prouyded self sawe right syde knyght stondyng aswerd drawen sayeng yf thou spare mā thou shalt slayn alle thy men thenne seynt leo wrote pistle fabyane bisshop constantynople ayenst enticium nestonum layde vpon sepulcre seynt peter contynuell fastynges prayer sayeng holy peter haue erred thys epystle man thou whome cure chirche commysed correcte amende xl dayes peter apperid hym prayeng sayde haue redde amended thenne leo toke epistle fond corrected amended handes thappostle also xl dayes contynuelly fastynges prayer sepulcre seynt peter bysechyng gete hym forgyuenes hys synnes peter appered sayd haue prayed lord hath forgyuen alle thy synnes sauf thymposicion thy honde thou shalt examyned deyed aboute yere lord four hondred sixty thus endeth lyf seynt leon pope foloweth seynt peter thappostle first name peter grete name called symon bariona symon moche saye ryght obeysaunt commysyng grete heuynesse bariona moche saye sone douue culuer obedyent whan lord callyd hym atte voys one callyng obeyed lorde cōmysing heuynes sorowe whan renyed ihesu cryst went wepte bitterly sonne douue serued god wyth symple intencyon secondly callyd cephas whiche moche saye chief stone blamyng mouth sayd chief reson pryncipalyte prelacyon stone reson stedfastnes passyon blamyng mouth reson constaūce prechyng thirdly called peter whiche moche say knowyng vnhosyng shoyng vnbyndyng knowyng knewe dygnyte cryst whan sayd thou art cryst sonne lyuyng god vnhosyng shoyng whan vnshodde hys foot fro thaffectyon alle dedely erthely werk sayeng loo haue lefte alle thyng c̄ vnbyndyng hath vnbounden bondes synne keyes receyued lorde thre surname sayd simon iohanna whiche moche saye beaute lord secondly sayd symon iohānis saye gyuen thyrdly sayd symon bariona say sonne douue whiche gyuen vnderstonden beaute maners yefte vertues habundance teeres douue hath waylyng song name peter ihesus promysed put hym ioh̄is primo thou shalt called cephas saye peter secondly dyd promysyd sayd mathei quarto named symon peter c̄ thirdly confermed mathei xvj saye thou art peter vpon thys stone c̄ martirdom wrote marcellus linus papa egesippus leo pope ¶ seynt peter saynt peter thappostle among al aboue alle thother moost feruent brennyng loue wold haue knowen traytre shold betraye lord ihesu cryst seynt austyn sayth yf knowē hym wolde haue torn hym tethe therfore lord wold name hym hym crisostome sayth yf named hym peter arysen alle torn hym peter went vpon see chosen god transfiguracōn reysed mayde deth lyf fond statere piece money fisshes mouth receyued lord keyes kyngdom heuē toke charge fede sheep ih̄u crist conuerted whitsōtide thre thousand men heled claude ioh̄n thenne conuerted v thousand men sayde ananye saphyre deth byfore heled enee palscy reysed thabyte baptysed cornelye shadowe body heled seek men putte pryson herode angelle lorde delyuerd mete hys clothyng boke seynt clement wytnessith sayde brede wyth olyues selde wortes myn vsage haue suche whan remembred renyed hym wepte habundauntly grete plente teres suche wyse acustomed wepe hys face brent wyth teres semed lyke clement sayth sayth also nyght whan herde cocke crowe wold wepe hys staffe cōmaunded shold retorne felawe lay hit vppon hym dyd thenne whiche ben xl dayes deed anone aroos al lyuyng tyme symon thenchauntour ierusalem sayd first trouthe affermed wold byleue hym shold proufyte fynd trouth theuys haue pea among ther • desyre pea bataile whan ij men fyghten one ouercomen thenne pea thenne sayd peter dredest thou pea synnes growe bateylles y synne pee dysputyng trouthe founden werkis ryght wysnes thenne sayd symon thou sayest shalle shewe power dygnyte anon thou shalte adoure fyrst trouthe may flee ayer make newe tree torne stone brede endure fyre wythout hurtyng alle wyll may doo seynt peter disputed ayenst alle thyse disclosed alle malefyces thenne symon magus • eyng myght resyste peter cast alle bokes see lest seynt peter shold preue hym magycyen bokes went rome hadde reputed god whan peter knewe folowed cam rome iiij yere claudyus themperour peter cam rome satte xxv yere ordeyned two bisshoppis hys helpars lyne clete one within walles nero sayd dredest thou simon certeyn thynges affermeth godhed ¶ peter sayd ¶ yf dygnyte godhed hym late hym telle thynke doo whiche thoughte shalle first telle shal mow lye thynk nero sayd come hether sayd doon symon answerd lat peter saye thynke peter answerd symon thynketh knowe shal whan hath thought ¶ thenne symon hauyng indygnacion cryed lowde cōmaund dogges come deuoure hym sodenly appered grete dogges made assaulte ayenst peter gaf hem brede blessyd sodenly made flee thenne sayd peter nero lo haue shewed thought ayenst wordes dedes wher promysed angellis come ayenst browght dogges bedde body abode vnmeuable ¶ peter stondyng aferre makyng hys prayer cryed dede body seyeng yong man aryse name ihesu cryst nazareth crucified anon arose lyuyng walkyd thenne whan peple wold haue stoned symon magus peter sayde payne ynough knowyng hym ouercomen herte mayster hath taught v doo good euyl thenne said simon peter poul yet comē ye desyre ye worthy haue martirdom answerd desire haue shal neuer wel thou lyest alle thou sayest thenne marcel sayth symon went hous marcel bond grete dogge black dore hous sayd shall see yf peter whyche accustomed come hether shal come yf come dogge shal strangle hym ¶ lytil peter poul went theder anon peter made signe crosse vnbond hound hound tame meke lambe pursewed non simon went hym toke cast hym grounde vnder hym wold haue estrangled hym thenne ran peter hym cryed vpon hound shold hym ony harme anon hound lefte touched body alle rente tare goun wyse almost naked thenne alle peple specyally chyldren ran hoūd vpon hym hunted chased hym toun ben wulf thenne repreef shame durst come toun alle hole yere thenne marcelle dissciple symon magus seyng thyse grete myracles came peter fro thēne forthon hys disciple ende yere symon prayer went awaye whan cam gate leo witnesseth called scā maria adpassus mette ih̄u cryst comyng ayenst hym peter sayd hym lord whither goost thou sayd hym goo rome crucyfyed agayn peter demanded hym lord shalt thou crucifyed agayn sayd ye peter sayd lord shal retorne agayn thēne crucyfyed sayd oure lord ascended heuen peter beholdyng whiche wepte sore whan peter vnderstode lord sayd hym hys passyon retorned whan cam hys brethern told lord sayde anon taken mynystres nero delyuered prouost agryppe thēne face clere sonne sayde thenne agrippe sayd hym thou art glorifyest peple wymen thou departest fro bedde theyr husbondes thappostel blamed sayd hym glorifyed crosse lord ih̄u cryst thenne peter commaunded crucyfyed stranger cause poul cytezeyn rome hit cōmaunded hede shold smeten pylers world withoute waylyng wepyng brethern thenne sayd seint poul seint peter pee art foundement chirche pastour schepe lambes lord peter thenne sayd poul go thou pee precher good maners medyatour foot vpward hede dounward thenne peple wer angrye ayenst nero prouost wold haue slayn hem cause made seint peter dye requyred shold lette passyon leo witnesseth lord opened eyen wepte saw angelys wyth crownes rose lylyes standyng peter crosse angelys thenne peter receyued boke oure lord wherin lerned wordes sayd thenne egesippus saith peter sayd thus lord haue desired moche folowe crucyfyed vpryght haue vsurped thou art allwey ryghtfull hye souerayne ben sone first man whiche haue hede enclined therth whō falle signefyeth forme generacōn humayne also borne ben seen enclyned therthe effecte condicion chaūged world weneth suche thyng good whiche y euyll badde lord thou art alle thyng nothyng thou yelde thankynges wyth spyrite whiche lyue whiche vnderstande calle whan seint peter sawe good crystyn men sawe glorye yeldyng kynges god cōmendyng good peple hym rendred vp spirite thenne marcel apuleus broder wer dissciples toke body fro crosse whan dede enoynted hit wyth moche precyous self body slewe hym self place redde deuoured wolues romayns retorned fonde frosshe threwe cite brent hit tyme seint cornelys pope grekes stale awaye bodyes appostles peter poul deuyls wer ydoles constreyned deuyne vertue god cryed sayde ye men rome socour hastely goddes whiche ben stolen fro whiche thyng good crysten peple vnderstode bodyes peter poul paynems supposed ben theyr goddes thenne assembled grete nombre cristen men paynems also pursewed long grekes doubted haue slayn threwe bodyes pitte catacumbas afterward wer drawen crysten men seynt gregorye sayth grete force thondre lightnyng cam fro heuen made affrayed departed eche fro lefte bodyes thappostles catacombes pitte doubted whiche bone wer peter whiche poules wherfor good cristen men put prayer fastynges answered heuen grete bone longed prechour lass fisshar departed bone wer put chyrche hym dedicate saye siluester pope wold halow chirches toke bone togyder departed weyghte grete smale put one half one chirche half seint gregore recoū teth dyalogue chirche seint peter wher bone restē man grete holynes mekenes named gencyen came mayde chirche whiche crepel drewe hir body legges hir hir handes whan long requyred prayed sent peter helth appered hir vision sayd hyr go gencyen seruaunt shall restore thy helth began crepe chirche enquired gencyn sodenly happed cam hyr hym sought sayde hym holy appostle seynt peter sent thou sholdest make hole delyuer fro disease answerd yf thou sent fro hym aryse thou anon goo thy foot toke hand anon alle hole suche wyse felt nothyng grief maladye thenne thanked god last cam grete deserte hermyte dwellyd hermyte preched hym ihesu crist enformed hym fayth dylygently sayd hym thys kyng thou desirest serue requyreth seruyse thou must oft faste xpōfer sayd hym requyre somme thyng shall doo whiche thou requyrest may doo hermyte sayd thou must thenne wake make many prayer cristofer said hym wote may doo suche thyng thenne hermyte sayd hym knowest thou suche ryuer whiche many perysshed lost cristofer seyd knowe wel thenne said heremyte cause thou art noble hye stature strong thy membris thou shalt resident ryuer thou shalt bere ouer al shall passe shal thyng ryght couenable lord ih̄u crist yu desirest serue hope shal shewe hym self thēne sayd cristofer certes seruyse may wel promyse hym doo thenne went cristofer ryuer made habitacle hym grete pool hand stede staf susteyned hym water bare ouer al maner peple wythout cessyng obode thus doyng many dayes tyme slepte lodge herd voys chylde whiche called hym sayd xpōfer come bere ouer thenne awoke went fond man whan agayn hous herd voys ran fond body thyrd tyme called cam theder fond chylde besyde ryuage ryuer whiche prayed hym goodly bere hym ouer water thenne xpōfer lyft vp chylde sholdres toke hys staffe entred ryuer passe water ryuer aroos swellyd chyld heuy leed alway went ferther water encresed grewe chyld wexyd heuy moche xpōfre grete anguysse aferd drowned whan escaped grete cleopatra fledde vaynquysshed slewe self grete sorowe octauyen destroyed entierly royame egypte made vnder romayns ¶ fro then went alle hast myght alexandrye despoyled alle rychesses brought rome encreased comyn prouffyt rome gyuen one peny whyche fore sold foure bycause batayles peple wasted destroyed cyte rome renewed sayeng fond couerd wyth tyles shalle leue couerd wyth marble thyse cause made emperour fyrst euer callyd auguste hym ben alle come hym called augustes lyke vncle iulyus cezar ben called cezariens also thys moneth auguste whyche tofore called sextilys peple entituled hys name callyd angustus thonour rememberaunce victory • e emperour first day thys monthe moche alle romayns made day grete solempnyte vnto tyme theodosye themperour whyche began regne yere lord ccccxxvj thenne eudosie doughter sayde theodosyen emperour wyf valente went bowe iherusalem iewe gaf grete loue grete yefte ¶ bondes wete ij chaynes wyth whiche seynt peter vnder herode bounden wyth wherof moche ioyous whan retorned rome sawe romayns halowed fyrst day august thonour emperour paynem whyche deed thenne moche sorouful cause dyd moche honour man dampned thought myght lyghtely wythdrawen fro thys custome yf myght moche doo wold leue thus shold made thonour seynt peter alle peple shold name day day seynt peter ad vincula herof collacōn seynt pelagyen pope brought wyth fayre wordes remembraunce prynce paynems forgoten memorye prynce thappostles halowed plesed ryght well alle people thenne brought forth chaynes whyche brought fro iherusalem shewed alle peple pope brought forth chayne wyth whiche bounden vnder nero ¶ assone chayne touched alle thre myracle one lyke neuer one thenne pope quene establysshed folisshe relygyon peple makyng solempnyte paynem chaunged better made seynt peter prynce thappostles pope quene sette chaynes chyrche seynt peter ad vyncula gyuen quene sayd chyrche ryght grete yeftes ryght fayre preuyleges establysshed day halowed ouer alle ¶ thys lede sayth sygybert also sayth thys thyng grete vertue thys chayne apperyth wel yere lord foure hondred xl iiij erle whiche nyghe emperour octone cruelly vexyd tormented deuyll fore alle peple wyth owen trethe bote tare hym self commaundement themperour ledde pope ioh̄n put chayns aboute hys necke nother put aboute hys necke thys wode man demonyake • dyd hym none alegement cause vertu atte last chayne seynt peter broughte put aboute necke sayde man demonyake suche vertue deuyl myght bere departed went cryeng tofore alle thenne theodoryke bysshop mets toke chayne said wold departe fro maner yf hand cut cause grete descorde bytwene pope bysshop clerkes atte laste emperour appeased noyse gate pope lynke chayne • kepte moche worthely grete deuocion mylet also recompteth cronyque wreton thystorie tripertite tyme grete horryble dragon whiche apperyd empyrum bysshop donat • spytte mouth kylled hym forthwith bysshop made tofore signe crosse fyngres vpon dragon grete behoued seuen cople ox drawe hym then toune place brent cause ye stenche hym shold corupt ayer yet sayth mylet also sayd thystorye tripertite deuyl apperyd toune named creta semblaunce moyses creta nygh montayne whiche nygh see assembled grete multitude iewes alle place brought toppe hyest montayne promysed lede goo drye foot vppon see londe promyssyon assembled peple wythout nombre byleue deuyl despyte iewe gyuen chayne quene whyche feste octauyen cessed made whan deuyl sawe iewes wythout nombre aboue ye grete montayne made many falle doun toppe ground bynethe made wythout nombre drowned see thus deuyll aduenged hym many escaped bycam cristen ffor whan wold haue goon vp montayne wyth myght go vp sharpe roches suche wyse went vp alle cutte stone drowned see alle deed whan wolde haue doon tarryed cause wyst happed certayn fysshers goyng told fallen thus myght escape retorned wente al thise thynges ben conteyned said historye fourth cause instytucion feste may assygned wyse • lord delyuerd seynt peter chaynes myracle gaf hym power bynde vnbynde ffor holden bounden vnto londe synne haue nede assoyled therfor worship solempnyte chaynes afor sayd deserued vnbounde bondes chaynes receyued power lord ih̄u crist assoyle v thys last reson may lyghtly apperceyued thou seest thepystle accordeth thabsolucōn losyng chaynes made thappostle gospell recordeth power gyuen hym tassoyle thoryson dethe requyreth absolucion made v thys somtyme gyueth absolucion assoylleth dampned otherwhyle power kayes whiche receyued apperyth myracle blessid virgyne marrie tyme monke scolyer whiche cyte coloyne monastery seynt peter whiche monke synful whan monke supprysed sodeyn dethe deuyllis accused hym cryed hym alle maner synnes one sayd couetyse whiche oft thou hast coueyted ayenst commaundement god another sayd vayne glorye whyche thou hast enioyed makyng vaunte emong men another sayde thy lesyng whiche thou oft syn • edest lyeng lyke wyse contrarye good werkys excused hym sayeng obedyence whyche thou dydest thyn elder soueraynes another sayd song psalmes thou hast songen god moche ardantly seint peter monke went god pray hym lord ansuerde hym hath prophete sayd inspyracion onē quis hitabit tabernaculo tuo lord shal dwell thy tabernacle shal reste thy hye holy montayn shall wythout spotte synne may man thenne saued whiche entred wythout spotte ne hath doon rightwisnesse yet peter prayed hym blessid virgyne moder god thenne lord gaf vpon hym sentence soule shold retorne agayn body shold doo penaunce thenne seynt peter kay held hond fered deuyllis made flee delyuerd soule monke monastery commaunded hym shold bryng body bare hym requyred hym rewarde brought agayn shold say euery day hym psalme miserere mei deus shold te swepe sepulture kepe clene thus reuyued fro deth cam agayn world dyde hys penaunce recompted alle peple happed hym thenne late v praye gloryous appostle seynt peter aduocate lord ihesu cryste may power kayes gyuen hym haue absolucion oure synnes accomplysshemēt short transitory lyf may come euer lastyng lyf heuen amen thus endeth thistorye seint peter ad vincula foloweth lyf seynt stephen pope whan seynt stephen pope conuerted many paynems vnto cristen fayth word example also buryed many bodyes marters yere lord two hondred lx sought grete studye valeryen galyen thenne empereurs cause clerkes shold doo sacrefyse vnto theyr ydolles elli myght shewed yet second tyme third tyme nexte fryday folowyng appered lyke dyd tofore said hym wherfor hast thou desdayn whiche haue requyred sayd hym syre haue desdayne haue prayed god yf name apere thestablysshement 〈◊〉 whiche rauysshed spirite sawe blessed virgyne lady seint marie knelyng handes ioyned prayeng sonne humayn lygnage ofte withstode requeste atte last sayd besily requyred hym moder may doo haue sent patriarkes prophetis litil haue amended cam self haue sent appostles haue sleyn sent also martirs confessours doctours accorded ne theyr doctryne cause apperteyneth wythsay thy request shalle gyue prechours may enlumyned made clene ellys shal come ayenst self yf wyl amende another sawe tyme whan xij abbottes ye ordre cystews sent tholous ayenst heretikes whan sone ansuerd moder aboue said moder sayd hym fayr sone thou oughtest doo theyr malyce thy mercy sone vaynquysshed prayer sayd shalle yet doo mercy thy requeste shal sende prechours shal warne enforme yf thēne correcte shalle spare frere menour longe tyme felow seint fraunsoys recounted many freres ordre prechours whan seint domynyke rome confirmacōn ordre pope sawe nyght ih̄u crist thayer holdyng thre speres hande brandysshed ayenst world moder ran hastely ayenst hym demaunded hym wold doo sayd alle world ful vyces pryde luxurye auarice therfor wil destroye wyth thyse thre speres thenne blessyd virgyne fyll doun hys foot sayde dere sone haue pyte tarye thy iustyce thy mercy ihesu cryste sayd seest thou many wronges iniuryes answerd sone attempre thy wrath tarie lityll haue trewe seruaunt noble fighter ayenst vyces whyche shalle renne oueral vaynquysshe worlde subdue vnder thy seygnorye shal gyue hym nother seruaunte hys helpe shal fight doth lord sone saide appeased receyue thy prayer wold see thou wilt sende grete offyce thenne presented hym seynt domynyk ih̄u cryste sayde truly thys good noble fyghter shalle doo dilygently thou hast sayd thenne shewed hym offryd hym seint ffraunsoys preysed hym dyd first seynt domynyk consydered dylygently hys felawe vysyon neuer seen hym byfore fond hym morne chyrche knewe hym seen hym vysyon wythout shewer began kysse hym sayd thou art felawe thou shalt renne wyth shalle gydre none aduersarye shal surmounte v thenne recounted hym alle ordre sayd vysion fro forthon one herte one soule lord commaunded loue shold kepte shold come perdurably whan tyme seynt domynyk receyued nouyse thordre ben felawes peruerted hym suche wyse wold retorne world demaunded gowne whan seint domynyk herd went prayer yong man despoyled hym relygyous clothyng hym sherte began crye wyth hye voys saye chauffe brenne certaynly alle brente doo doo cursed sherte whiche brenneth al body myght endure wise til despoyled sherte clothed agayn wyth relygyous clothes brought agayn cloystre religious whan seynt domynyk boleyne tyme freres goon slepe frere conuerse began tormented deuyl whan ffrere reyner losanne knewe sayde seynt domynyk seynt domynyk commaunded shold brought chyrche tofore aulter lady x ffreres myght vnnethe bryng hym thenne said seynt domynyk coniure wicked spyryte thou telle wherfore thou vexyst thus creature god wherfor thou entredest answerd vexe hym ffor hath deserued dranke yesterday cite without lycence priour made signe crosse theron entred thenne signe botel thende shold drynke wyn sonner thenne founden dronken toun mene whyle made signe crosse ronge matyns whan deuyll herd sayd may lenger abyde syth grete hoodes aryse thus constrayned prayer seynt domynyke yssue goo hys waye frere delyuerd hool wel ware euer doo ayenst wyl pryour seynt domynyk tyme cam ryuer toward party tholouse bookes whiche custodye fyl water coude fynde must leue behynd hym thyrd day fisshar cast hoke water supposed haue teken vp som grete fysshe drewe vp bookes seynt domynyk ony wetyng lyke ben kepte dylygently almarye tyme whan cam monasterye al brethern reste wolde destrouble ne awake put hym prayer entred felawe yates beyng shette closed also lyke wise conflicte theretikes conuerse cystews euentyde cam certayn chyrche fonde hit shytte closed made prayer sodenly chyrche abode nyght prayer whan prayed alway custome staū che thurst sōme welle fontayn lest shold haue ony desyre drynke hous hoost scolier hows freres boloyne masse hit happed seynt domynyk sang masse whan cam offryng scolier wente kyssed honde seynt domynyk grete deuocion whan kyssed felte come honde grete swetenes swete odour euer felte fore lyf fro forthon ardeur brennyng lecherye began wexe colde hym whiche tofore ben vayn lecherous contynent flesshe shone alle clerenes chastite flesshe seynt domynyk shone moche grete chastyte purete odour cured filthes thought ¶ preest sawe seynt domynyk ardantly predycacion felawes concluded hym self wold ioyne hym yf myght haue book newe testament necessarie hym preche thought thys cam yong man beryng book newe testament selle vnder vestement anon preest bought grete ioye doubted yet lytil made prayer almyghty god made crosse vpon book without forth sythe opened book loked within forthwith first chappytre fonde actes thappostles whiche sayde peter cam first syght arise vp descende goo nothyng doubtyng haue sent thēne went ioyned hym tyme whan noble mayster scyence fame regent tholouse theologye mornyng tofore day whyle purueyed lesson surprised slepe enclyned hym chayer lytil hym semed seuen sterres stode tofore hym merueylled nouuelte said sterres grewe sodenly grete lighte enlumyned world whan awoke strongly amerueylled whan entred scoles redde seynt domynyk vj freres habite entred cam amyably hym shewed theyr purpoos said coueyted haunte scoles thenne mayster remembred hys vision doubted thise seuen sterres seen whan saynt domynyke tyme rome mayster reynold saynt aman deene orleaunce wyse lawe canon hadde ben fyue yere doctor comen bisshop orleaunce see passe rome hadde ben long purpoos haue lefte world entende prechyng yet auised myght accomplisshe herd thynstytucion thordre prechours cardynal whome told called saynt domynyke exposed hym purpoos thenne hadde counseylle entre ordre withoute taryenge taken greuous sekenes despayr helthe thenne saynt domynyk prayd hertely oure blessid lady vyrgyne whome commysed alle ordre wolde gyue deen helthe lytel tyme sodenly quene mercy cam thre maydens reynold wakyng abydyng dethe sawe come hym oure lady sayde hym good chere requyre thow wylt shalle gyue thought shold requyre one maydens saide hym softely shold requyre nothyng commytte hym alle wille whan hadde done thenne put forthe vyrgynal honde touched eres nosethrellis mouth handes foot raynes enoynted oynemente helthe whiche brought sayeng propyrly forme wordes whiche apperteyne membres sayd raynes raynes restreyned girdel chastyte thenne torned foot sayd enoynte foot preparacion theuangely pee said shalle sende ampulle restablysshe ful helth thenne shewed hym habyte ordre sayd hym habyte thyne ordre saynt domynyke beyng prayer sawe alle vysyon morn saynt domynyke cam hym fond hym hoole herde hym alle ordynaunce vysyon toke thabite vyrgyne shewed hym fore freres vsed surplys thirdde daye moder god enoynted body reynold took awey hete feuers also extyncted quenchyd ardour luxurye lyke confessyd one meuyng luxurye hym vysyon sawe ageyne relygyous man hospytal owne eyen beyng present saynt domynyk astoned therof vysyon seynt domynyk publysshed many bretheren dethe thenne reynold sente boloyne entended moche ardauntly prechyng encreaced nombre freres sente parys whyle deyed oure lord yong man cardynal esteuen fylle hors dyche drawen oute therof deed offryd saynt domynyk made prayer yong man restablysshed lyf chirch saynt sixte mason hyred freres repayre broken walles pece wal fyl vpon man slewe hym saynt domynyke commaunded body shold brought hym anone helpe prayer restablysshed lyf helthe chirche rome tyme fourty freres lytel brede thenne saynt domynyke commaunded put brede thre partyes sone eche broken morselle brede ioye cam two yōg men ye habite forme whiche entrid ye refectory fraitour lappes mantel ye henge neck ful brede whā gyuen al fully seynt domynyk departed sodēly yt none wist whens cam ne whider thy wēt thēne seynt domynyk gaf forth hād freres said ete bretheren whan saynt domynyke tyme iourneye greuously troubled greete floodes rayne made signe crosse chaced awey rayne fro hym fro felawe lyke pauyllon vpon hym grounde al weet aboute hym drope cam nyghe hym space thre cubites tyme passid shyppe toward partes thoulette shipman demaunded hym peny passage holy man god promysed hym kyngdome heuen labour sayeng disciple ihesu crist bare neyther gold n • syluer ne money drewe hym forsybly cope said thou shalt leue thy cope thow shalt paye peny good mā god lyft vp eyen heuen • relygyous man whiche good conuersacyon holy acompanyed straū ge langage sory couthe vnderstonde eche comforte eche prayd gate grace oure lord thre dayes wente gyder signes wordes eche vnderstode mente ther man whiche vexyd many deuylles offryd brouȝt hym took stole put owne necke bounded aboute necke demonyake commaunded hym fro then forthon shold tormente nomore man anone tormented within hym baganne crye late v goo wherfore constreynest thou tormented sayd shalle lete yow goo tylle ye haue gyuen pledge ye shalle retorne ageyne sayd pledge maye gyue yow sayd holy martirs resten yonder chirche sayde may enmerytes requyre sayd ye muste nedes gyue shalte suffre yow goo quyte answerd wolde done theyr payne lytell whyle sayd worthy haue goten hooly martirs shalle oure pledge requyred haue signe token thyng said goo shryne heedes martirs ben ye shalle fynde reuersed torned thenne wente fond lyke said prechid tyme somme ladyes ben deceyued heretykes ••• eled foot sayde hym seruaunt god helpe v yf trewe thou prechest spyryte errour hath blynded oure synnes said ye forme tarye lytell ye shalle see lord ye haue serued ¶ anone sawe sprynge oute myddell catte right horryble whiche greete dogge grete eyen flawmyng tonge longe brood blody longe vnto nauel tayll short reysed vp hyghe shewed end whiche way torned hym oute whiche ther yssued terryble stenche hadde torned hyther thyder among ladyes longe laste mounted vp belle rope steple vanysshed awey leuyng grete stenche hym ladyes thanked god conuerted feyth catholyque ouercomen somme heretykes partyes thelouse condempned brente sawe one among whiche named reymond saide mynystres kepe ye thys man brente maner thenne sayd hym spekyng swetely hym knowe wel sone thou shalt yet good man lefte abode twenty yere euylle heresye thēde conuerted frere prechoure ordre fyuysshed lyf well laudably tyme spayne accompanyed somme freres sawe vysyon right grete dragon whiche swolowed hym bretheren hym vnderstode vysyon warned bretheren resiste strongly fende enemy lytel whyle alle freres excepte frere adam two conuersys departed hym demaunded one yf wolde go also saide nay fader shalle loue hede folowe feete anone gaf hym self prayer conuerted almost al prayer saynt syxte tyme rome sodenly hooly ghooste lyghted hym called hys bretheren chappytre said apertely fore alle foure bretheren sholde deye shortely two body tweyne sowle anone two freres deyde lorde tweyne departed oute thordre tyme boloyne frere almayn born named conrade hym whome freres desired moche haue thordre saynt domynyk spak pryour cassamarye cystews vygyle thassumpcyon oure lady certeyne mater saide hym amyable affyaunce telle pryour thyng whiche neuer yet said man ne thou shall neuer telle hit long shalle lyue ¶ neuer yet requyred thyng god lyf desyre said pryour saide hym perauentur sholde deye byfore saynt domynyk spyryte prophecye saide hym sholde lyue long hym pryour sayde hym fader requyre mayster cō rade gyue hym self thordre freres desyre hym moche saide broder thou requyrest moche harde thyng thenne whan complyne sayde freres wēt reste abode chirche dyde hadde acustomed alle nyght oryson prayer freres grete tempest thondre lightnyng descended heuen vpon hym thenne fled tempest cam tofore hows fond shette knocked atte dore entre thostesse answerd rightwysnes enhabyted hous myne thou art rightwys therfore thou mayst enhabyte thenne wepte bytterly thyse wordes went nother hous sawe beyonde knocked dore come thostesse whyche within answerd trouthe thou art trewe ther may receyue fro then went iij hous beyonde requyred myght come tempest wythin sayde pea duelle pea felon men good wylle cause thynke thoughtes pea shalle gyue good coū seyl suster dwellyth aboue whiche alway helpeth kaytyues entrid cyte lodged ennuche candace quene phelyx baptysed thenne discouerd faytes dedes thenchaunteurs maner • alle dyd men hurte torned mathewe helthe thenne eu • uche demaunded saynt mathewe vnderstode soo many tonges thenne mathewe told hym holy ghoost descended gyuen thappostles alle scyence tongue lyke emprysed theyr pryde make toure vnto heuen whiche cessed confusyon tongue chaunged alle lyke wyse appostles made toure scyences tongue nothynge stone vertues byleue shalle mounte vp heuen thenne cam man sayd thenchauntours comen two dragon whiche caste fyre sulpher theyr mouthes nosethrellys slewe alle men thenne appostle garnysshed hym signe crosse went surely anone dragon sawe hym anone cam slept foot thenne sayd mathewe thenchauntours crafte awake ye ye maye yf wold praye oure lord whiche ye wold haue commysed shold soone execute yow whanne peuple assembled commaunded dragon shold departe withoute hurtynge ony wente anone thappostle made grete sermon glorye paradys terrestre sayeng apperyd aboue montayns nyghe vnto heuen neyther thornes ne roches lylyes rose flourysshed alwey waxyd neuer olde peple alweye yonge sowne angel souned alweye byrdes cam anone callyd sayd oute paradys man caste called paradys heuen natyuyte lord sayd wordes peuple anone grete noyse aroos grete wepynge made sone kynge whiche deed whanne enchaunteurs myght reyse hym made kyng byleue rauysshed company goddes shold make hym temple ymage thenne forsayd ennuche kepar quene candace made thenchaunteurs kept sente thappostle whanne appostle comen made prayer reysed kynges sone anone thenne kynge whiche named egyppe sente alle men prouynces sayenge come see ye god lykenes man thenne peple cam wyth crownes gold dyuerse manere sacryfyses wold haue sacryfyed hym thenne saynt mathewe behelde sayd ye men god seruaunt oure lord commaundemēt hym made grete chirche gold syluer brouȝt whiche thyrtty dayes space edyfyed achyeued whiche chirche appostle sat thre thyrtty yere conuertyd al ethyope faythe cryste thenne kynge egesyppe wyth wyf douȝter peple baptysed thenne thappostle ha • owed god ephygene kynges doughter made maystresse gouernesse moo two honderd vyrgyns hyrtake succeded kynge coueyted sayd vyrgyne ephygene promysed appostle half royamme wolde make consente wyf thappostle sayd hym customme predecessour shold come sonday chirche ephygene beynge present virgyns shold sholde say goodnes laufull maryage thenne departed grete ioye supposed wold haue styred ephygene maryage whanne vyrgynes alle peple assembled spack long good lawful matrymonye moche alowed kynge whiche supposed sayd haue ioyned vyrgyne hym consente maryage thenne scylence made made rehersaylle sermone sayenge maryage good yf truly hold good alyaū ce ye • en knowe ye well yf ony seruaunt hooly veyle mayst thow take wyf puyssaunt kynge couple maryage whanne kynge herde began tenrage departed al wode frantyke thappostle withoute drede constant confermed alle pacyence ephygene lyenge hym
