wherof sayd legende dyuyne prouyden gaf hym name cause hym synguler acustomed name thoppynyon mysterye knowen thorugh oute alle world thyrdly reason offyce effect wheruppon gyuen vnderstonde hym sone shold make many seruauntes deuylle bonde synne free fourthly reason grete courage magnanymyte herte frensshe men ben sayd fyersnes naturell fyersnes grete c • rage herte fyftly reason vertuosyte spekynge word keruyd awaye vyces lyke axe sixtely reason chaced awey comnnely deuyls seuenthly reason honeste conuersacyon perfection werke said somme signes brought rome fore consul whiche terrour peple worship callyd franciscas ¶of saint fraunceis fraunceis seruaunt frende almyghty god borne cyte assyse maade marchaunt vnto xxv yere age wasted tyme lyuyng vaynly whome lord corrected scorge sekenes sodenly chaū ged hym another man soo beganne shyne spyryte prophecye tyme wyth men peruse taken prysoner put cruell pryson waylled sorowed gladde enioyed whanne repreuyd hym therof answerd knowe ye sayd ioyeful shall worshipped saynt thorugh oute alle world tyme wente rome cause deuocion tooke alle clothes cladde hym clothes beggar satt amonge poure men fore chirche saint peter one begged hem coueytously moche oftener wold haue done shame knowen peple letted hym old enemy deuylle enforced hym lette hym hooly purpos shewed hym woman monstruous horrybly diffygured croke bak lame whiche cyte sayd hym left enterprysed wold make hym semblable lyke vnto comforted lord whiche herd voys sayenge hym fraunceys take bytter thynges swete despyse thy self yf thow desyre knowe tyme mette lepre whome naturelly men abhorre remembryd hym word sayd god ranne hym kyssed hym anon lazare vanysshed away wherfor wente thabytacion lazar kyssed deuoutely theyr handes gaf moneye lete hem haue nede suche myȝte doo ¶ tyme entryd chirche saynt damyan make prayer thymage ihesu cryst spak vnto hym sayd fraū ceis goo repayre hows alle destroyed thou seest houre sowle hym lyquefyed passion ihesu cryst merueylously infyxed herte thenne dyde grete payne besy repayryng chirche sold alle hadde gaf money therof preeste durst receyue hit fere parentes kynne thenne castynge awey fore preeste dust settynge therby wherfore taken fader bounden restored hym money resygned also clothes soo naked fled lord clad hym hayre thenne blessyd fraunceys wente vnto symple man whome took stede fader prayd hym lyke fader doublyd hym curse contrarye shold blesse hym owne broder germayn sawe hym wynter tyme haue hym fowle fewe clothes tremblid cold entendynge prayer sayd felawe goo fraunceys saye hym selle penyworthe swote whanne herd answerd glad chere wylle selle hit vnto lord god day herd chirche whiche oure lord sayd discyples whanne sente preche anone adressyd hym alle myght doo kepe tho thynges dyd hosyn shone fro foot clad hym fowle cote tooke corde gyrdle wente tyme snowe woode taken theues demaunded hym sayd messager god anone toke hym caste hym snowe sayenge hym lye thou vilayn messager god many noble vnnoble clerkes laye men hadde despysed world begonne folowe hym hooly fader enseygned taught perfection gospel whiche pouerte shold go wey symplenesse wrote thenne rule gospel hym self bretheren whiche pope innocent confermed fro forthon beganne sprede ardauntly sedes word god wente aboute cytees castels feruent merueylous desyre frere whiche semed outward merueylous holynes kepte scylence soo straytly wold shryuen wordes sygnes euery man preysed hym saynt hooly man fraunceis cam thyder sayde leue ye bretheren preyse hym shall yet preyse hym leste fayntyse deuylle late hym warned shryuen twyes weke worde spekynge yf doo temptacion deuylle fraudelous deceyte thenne freres warned hym doo put fyngre mouthe shoke heede shewed wyse wold confesse hym anone retourned ageyne worldly lyf hound vomyte wente oute ordre fynysshed lyf synful actes werkes tyme saynt fraunceis wery goyng rood vppon asse felawe one leonard assyse also wery goynge saynt fraūceis biganne thynke thus saye hym self kynne kynne lyke incontynent alyghte doune sayd frere apperteyneth ryde goo afoote thow art noble frere abasshed kneled doune requyred pardon tyme passed place noble lady ranne soo hastely ageynste hym myght speke werynes axed wold saide praye fader maye performe purpoos helthe whiche haue bigonne husbond whiche letteth doth many aduersytees seruyce god said goo thy waye doughter thow shalt haue anone comfort hym saye thyn husbond goddes name myn tyme helthe herafter shall tyme equyte righte hadde said husbond man sodenly chaunged auowed god contynence chastyte tyme poure labourer almost lost woode thurst hooly saint impetred fontayne preyers said tyme frere famylyer hym secrete whiche shewed hym hooly ghoost ther seruaunt god lyuynge worlde daye whoos sake long shal lyue lord shall suffre famyne among peple withoute doubte said deede alle condicion chaunged contrarye blessid deth apperyd frere said hym loo famyne comen whiche longe lyued vppon erthe lord wold suffre come eester daye freres grekes desert hadde leyd table curyously tyme made redy glass sette lorde saynt fraunceis sawe anone withdrewe hym sat hede hat poure mā whiche bare staf honde wente oute abode gate fre • ete dyner cryed dore sholde gyue loue god almesse poure seke man thenne poure man callid entrid satte doune allone vppon erth set dysshe dust whiche whanne freres sawe abasshed sore agast sayd see table arayed aourned knowe well poure men seke mete fro dore dore loued pouerte hym self soo called alwey pouerte lady whanne sawe one poure hym self therof enuye doubted ouercome hym day sawe poure woman shewed felawe sayde pouert • woman doth v shame repreueth strongly oure pouerte rychesses haue chosen lady pouerte shyneth woman whanne tyme poure man passid fore hym hooly man meuyd inward compassion felawe sayd hym though man poure parauenter ther rycher wylle alle prouynce thenne saynt fraunceis sayd hym anone despoylle thy cote gyue poure man knowleche thy self culpable knele doun foot whome anone obeyed dyd tyme thre wymmen lyke vysage thynges habite entrid met hym salewed manere welcome lady pouerte anone vanysshed awey nomore sene tyme cam cyte arete mortall bataylle meuyd cyte holy man sawe vpon burgh ground deuyls makyng ioye glad thenne called felawe named syluestre sayde hym go yate cyte commaunde deuyls goddes name almyghty go oute cyte· thenne wente hastely ceyed strongly al ye deuyls departe hen name god commaundemēt fraunceis • e fader wente awey thenne cytezeyns anone bycam accorde forsayd syluester whanne yett seculer preest sawe slepe golden crosse yssue oute mouth saynt fraunceis whiche ouer ende touched heuen armes crosse stratched fro one parte world thenne preest hadde conpunction left world folowed perfightely hooly man saynt fraunceis tyme holy man prayer deuyll callid hym thryes owne name whanne holy man answerd hym said none world soo grete synnar yf conuerte hym lord wold pardone hym sleeth hym self hard penaunce shall neuer fynde mercy anone hooly man knewe reuelacion fallace deceyte fende wold haue withdrawen hym doo well whanne deuyll saw myght preuayle ayenst hym tempted hym greuous temptacion flesshe whan holy seruaunt god felte despoyllid clothes bete hym self right hard hard corde sayeng thus broder asse behoueth remayne beten whan temptacion departed wente oute plonged hym self snowe al naked made seuen grete balles snowe purposed haue taken body sayd grettest thy wyf foure two ben thy doughters • two thy sone tweyne one thy chā berer othir thy varlet yemā haste clothe al deye cold yf thy besynes thow hast aboute greue sore thenne serue lord parfightely anon deuyll departed al confused saynt fraunceis retournyd ageyne celle gloryfyeng god dwellyd tyme leon cardynal saynt crosse nyght deuils cam hym bete hym right greuously thenne callyd felawe said hym ben deuyls iaylers lord whome sendeth punysshe excess remembre none offencis haue done ye mercy god haue wasshed awey satisfaction parauenture hath sente cause wylle suffre falle cause dwelle courtes greete lordes whiche thynge perauentur engendreth good syspection right poure bretheren whiche suppose habounde delyces erly mornynge aroos departed then tyme prayer sawe vpoon couerynge hows assembles companyes deuyls whiche ranne hyder thyder grete noyse wente oute signed hym signe crosse sayd saye yow name almyghty god ye deuylles body suffrid yow doo shall suffre hit pacyently haue gretter enmye body ye shal auenge myn aduersarye whyles ye take hit vengeaunce lyf thenne vanysshed awey al confused frere whiche felaw saynt fraunceis tyme rauysshed sawe spyryte gloryous place heuen wherin sawe amonge seetes ryght noble seete shynynge noble glorye merueyled whome noble syege sete kepte herd sayd sete longed somtyme one prynces fylle nowe made redy meke humble fraunceys saynt fraunceys yssued fro prayer frere demaū ded hym fader wenest thou thy self sayd wene grettest alle synners anone spyryte cam herte frere sayd beholde vysion thow sawest fro humylyte shal lyfte vp mooste meke man vnto sete lost pryde hooly man saynt fraunceis sawe vysion aboue hym seraphyn crucyfyed whicehe emprynted hym signes crucyfyenge hym semed crycyfyed handes foot syde hym semed signe woū de crucyfyeng dyde hyde tokenes moche myghte noman shold see yet neuertheles somme sawe lyf deth seene many shewed many myracles tho signes trewe whiche myracles tweyne shalle suffyse sette man named rogyer puylle fore thymage saynt fraunceis beganne thynke saye maye trewe man ennobled suche myracle illusion inuencion dissimyled bretheren freres thought herde sodenly sowne lyke quarel shotte arbalaste crosse bowe felte hym greuously hurte lyfte honde ther appyeryd hurte gloue thenne took gloue sawe palme honde wounde hadde ben arowe oute whiche wounde ther yssued soo grete payne ache brennynge almoost deyde sorowe payne thenne repented hym sayd byleuyd ryght veryly signes toknes saynt fraunceis hadde praid tw • dayes saynt fraunceis holy signes stygmates anone delyueryd payne maade al hoole royamme castyle ther man deuoute saynt fraunceis whiche wente tyme complyne chirche seynt fraunceis men lay wayte slee hym stede another man taken errour ignoraunce wounded left half deede cruel morderer stycked swerd throte lefte therin myght drawe oute wente way thenne men cryed ranne hyder thyder man bewayled lyke hadde ben dede ronge matyns mydnyght chirche freres wyf man beganne cry aryse vp syre goo matyns belle calleth anone lyfte vp hande shewe man shold take awey swerde fro throte anone syȝt alle swerd sprange oute ferre throwen stronge champyon anone man arose parfyghtely hole sayd saynt fraunceys cam hym ioyned stygmates woundes enoynted swetenes signes sewyd gydre merueylously towchynge whanne wold haue gone shewed hym shold take aweye swerd el shold conne speke anone tooke oute threwe awey ferre hym heled touchyng throte signes two clerkes grete lumynayres world saye saynt domynyke saynt fraunceys cyte rome fore lord hostyence whiche afterward pope rome bisshop sayd wherfor make ye freres bisshops prelate whiche shold preuayle techynge example gyuynge ther long contencion bytwene sholde fyrst answere humylyte ouercam fraunceys wold speke fore thenne saynt domynyk humbly obeyed sayde syre oure bretheren ben lefte vp good degree yf knowe hit shalle neuer suffre power euer shalle hope haue ony hyer dygnyte ¶ answerd saynt fraunceys syre bretheren ben callyd mynours cause wold made gretter blessyd saynt fraunceys ful ryght grete symplycyte admonested warned alle creature loue creatour prechyd byrdes herd hem suffryd hym touche • withoute lycence wold retorne ne flee fro hym tyme whanne prechyd swalowes chyteryd songe anon comaundement stylle also tyme byrde fygge tree besyde celle whiche sange ofte ful swetely saynt fraunceys put forth hand called byrde anone byrde obeyed cam vppon honde sayd synge suster preyse thy lord thenne anone songe departed tylle hadde lycence spared touche lyghtes lampes candels cause wold defowle handes wente honourably vpon stone worship hym callyd stone gadryd smale wormes oute waye cause shold troden feete passyd commaunded wynter gyue hony vnto bee shold perysshe hongre called alle beestes bretheren replenysshed merueylous ioye loue creatoure behelde sonne mone sterres somoned loue theyre maker defended make hym greete crowne sayenge wylle symple bretheren haue parte hede ¶ seculer man whiche sawe saynt fraunceis seruaunt god prechynge att saynt seueryns sawe reuelacyon god saynt fraunceys stratched crosse maade two clere swerdes whiche one cam fro heede feete stratchyd one hande soo neuer hadde sene suche demonstraunce thenne moeued herte entryd ordre fynysshed goodly lyf ¶ tyme saynt fraunceys seke hys eyen contynuelle wepynge hys bretheren sayd hym sholde refrayne hym fro wepynge answerd vysytacyon lyghte perdurable putte awaye lyghte haue flyes whanne bretheren constrayned hym take medycyne eyen surgeon helde brennynge yron hande blessyd fraunceys sayde brother fyre thow houre debonayre curable praye lord made thou attempre hete thenne made signe crosse ageynste fyre fyry yron wat put tendre flesshe ere vnto eye lyddes felte payne strongly seke deserte saynt vrban whanne felt nature faylled hym axyd drynke wyn ther none brought hym water blessid made signe crosse theron conuertid torned ryght good wyne hooly man gate lord pouerte deserte myghte gete sone tasted becam stronge alle hoole hadde leuer blame self preysynge cause peuple preysed hym ony thynge meryte holynes commaunded somme broder saye hym ere somme vylonnye blamynge hym defowlynge ¶and whanne suche broder soo constrayned ageynste wylle called hym vylayne marchaunt vnprouffytable foole thenne gladde blessyd hym sayd god blesse thou sayest ryght trew wordes thynge apperteyneth hooly saynt fraunceis wolde neuer mayster ne gouernour wold subgette ne commaunde obeye therfore lefte general demaunded vnder wardeyne who wyll alwey submytted hym self al thynges promysed alweye obedyence frere whome wente kepte hit ¶ whanne frere done ony thynge ageynst rule obedyence hadde sygne penaunce yet hooly saynt fraunceis fere commaunded cast hode hym fyre whanne hadde ben whyle fyre commaunded take gyue ageyne frere hode taken oute fyre withoute hurte wente tyme venyse fonde grete multitude byrdes syngynge sayd felawes susters byrdes gyue lawde theyr maker late v goo myddle synge houres canonycals lord entrid amonge meued cause myghte eche chyterynge noyse byrdes sayd susters byrdes cease songe tylle haue yolden vnto lord due praysynges thenne held hem stylle whanne hadde fynysshed theyr lawdes gaf lycence synge ageyn anone reprysed songe theyr customme tyme herberowed knyght saynt fraunceis sayd hym brother fayre hooste agree shalle saye confesse thy synnes thou shalt soone ete place anone graunted hym ordeyned hys meyny tooke penaunce helthe also soone wente table hooste deyde sodaynly ¶ tyme fonde grete multitude byrdes thenne sayde theym bretheren ye oughte strongly prayse gyue lawde youre maker hath cladde yow fethers hath gyuen yow penne flee hath graunted yow purete ayer gouerned yow wyth oute charge besynesse byrdes torned beckes bylles hym spradde theyr wynghes stratchyd neckes adressyd theyr hedes behelde hym ententyfly passyd forth myddle soo nyghe towchyd cote none aroos oute fro place tylle gaf hem leue flewhe gyder ¶ tyme whanne prechyd castelle almarye myghte herde swalowes whiche maade theyre nestes whome sayde sustres swalowes hit tyme speke ye haue sayd ynough ye stylle tyll word god accomplysshed obeyed stylle anone holy man saynt fraunceis passed thorugh puylle fonde way purs full moneye felawe sawe wold haue taken haue gyuen poure peple wold suffre hym maner sayd hym sone apperteyneth take goodes others whanne felaw hasted take saynt fraunceys prayd lytel commaunded hym take purs whiche thenne fonde therin grete addre stede money whanne frere sawe beganne double wolde obeye tooke purs hys hondes ther sprange oute anone serpent venemous thēne saynt fraunceys said hym money • ne thynge seruauntes god deuylle whiche serpent venemous frere greuously tempted began thynke yf ony thynge wreton hand fader saynt fraū ceis temptacion shold chaced awey anone durst wyse discouere thyng tyme seynt fraunceys called hym sayd sone brynge perchemyn ynke wyl wryte somme preysyng god whan wreton said take chartre kepe vnto day thy dethe dylygently anone alle temptacion wente awey frere whanne saynt fraunceis lay seke beganne thynke fader approcheth deth yf myght haue dethe cot • shold gretely comforted saynt called hym sayd gyue cot • yf thou haue therto deth playne ryght lodged tyme allexandre lombardye honest man whiche demaunded hym yf thobseruaunce gospelle sholde ete whiche sette fore hym consentid douocion hooste thenne hoost dyde doo make redy capon seuen yere old ete ther cam vntrewe man whiche demaunded almesse loue god anone whan blessid man herd blessid name sente hym membre capon cursyd man kept morne whanne holy man prechid shewed pyece capon sayd loo see flesshe frere eteth whome ye honoure saynt gaf hit yester euen pyece capon sene alle peple fysshe man blamed alle peple sayd madde whanne vnderstode ashamed demaunded pardon man cam ageyne good thought flesshe retorned ageyne owne kynde fourme ¶ tyme satt table collacion made pouerte blessid vyrgyne lady anone saynt fraunceis aroos beganne wepe sobbe sorowfully vysage al wete teeres beganne ete remenaunt breed vppon ground wold also ryght grete reuerence sholde done handes prestes whome gyuen power sacre blessid sacrament lord thenne seyd ofte yf happed mete ony saynt comynge fro heuen also poure preest wold fyrste goo kysse prestes handes wolde saye saynt hooly saynt abyde whyle handes preest haue handled sone lyf hath perfourmed thynge aboue humanyte ennoblyd hys lyf many myracles breed brought hym blesse gaf helthe many seke men •• nuertid water wyn whiche seke man tasted reuyued anone helthe also dyd many myracles laste dayes aporochyd greuyd longe infyrmyte thenne made hym self leyd vpon bare ground dyd doo calle alle freres whanne alle present blessyd lyke oure lord fedde disciple souper sherthursdaye gaf eche morselle breed warned woned doo gyue lawde theyr maker dethe whiche alle men horryble hatefulle admonested preyse also warned admonested deth come hym sayd deth suster welcome thou whanne cam laste houre slepte lord whome frere sawe soule maner sterre lyke mone quantyte sonne clerenes frere named augustyn whiche mynystre seruaunte londe laboure erthe last ende lost speche escryed sodaynly sayde abyde fader abyde shalle goo thenne freres demaunded hym sayd sayd see ye oure fader fraunceys goth vnto heuen anone slepte pee folowed holy fader ¶ lady hadde deuoute blessyd fraū ceys deyed clerkes prestes byere synge thexequyes aroos vp sodenly biere called one preestes sayd fader wold confesse deed shold haue put cruelle pryson cause hadde shryuen synne shalle saye saynt fraunceys prayd confessyd shewed shalle haue foryeuenesse anone shalle haue seyd confessyd hit shalle reste pee fore yow alle thenne confessyd assoylled rested anone lord freres vyterbe wold haue borowed carte man answerd despyte leuer see two yow flayn saynt fraunceys shold leue yow carte cam ageyne hym self repreuyd hym self repentyd hym blame sayd doubted ire god anone hys sone seke deyde whan sawe sone deed slepte erthe wepyng called saynt fraū ceis sayd synned thou sholdest haue beten gyue ayene hooly saynt prayenge • uoutely whome thow hast taken away fro blamynge blasphemynge wyckedly anone sone reuyued sayde whanne deed seynt fraunceys ladde longe way derke atte laste brought vnto ryght faire grene sayd retorne thy fader wylle lenger holde ¶ poure man whiche ought vnto certayne ryche man quantyte moneye· prayd hym loue saynt fraunceys wold prolonge terme payment whome answerd prowdely shalle sette suche place neyther fraunceys ne none shalle helpe anone took bonde hym sette hym derke pryson anone saynt fraū ceis cam thyder bracke vp pryson losed bondes brouȝt man al saufly owne hows ther knyghte whiche detracted werkes myracles saynt fraunceys tyme played dye beynge alle araged full woodenes cruelnes sayd theym stoode hym yf saynt fraunceis saynt late come eyghten dye anone cam thre dye eche hem sixe soo apperyd nyne tymes euery tyme thre six eche caste thenne adioustyng woodenes wodenes sayd ysit trewe yt fraūceis seynt late swerd ryue thurgh body day yf saynt escape saufly whan playenge dye ended cause hadde made prayer synne sayd iniurye neuewe tooke swerd stack thurgh belye slewe hym anone ¶ man hade loste thye couthe moeue hit cryed saynt fraun •• thus sayenge helpe saynt fraceis remembre deuocion seruyse haue done caryed vppon myn asse kyssed thy foot thy hondes deye payne thys ryght hard tormente thenne hooly man appyeryd hym litille staf helde whiche hadde signe thau touchyd therwith place payne postume bracke receyued anone ful helthe signe thau abode alwey place signe saynt fraunceys wonte alwaye signe lettres mayde whiche duellyd montaynes puylle castel fader moder ne doughter deyde moder moche deuout toward saynt fraunceis thenne full heuynes saynt fraunceys appyeryd sayd wepe nomore lyght thy lanterne quenchyd apperteyneth yelde ageyne thy prayer yet moder affyaunce trust saynt wold suffre bere awey body callynge saynt fraunceis took doughter deed reysed vp alyue hoole ther lytel childe rome fallen oute wyndowe ground deyde forthwythe called saynt fraunceys help anone restored lyf cyte swetse hit hapned hows fylle slewe child whanne putt corp chyste berye moder callyd saynt fraunceys deuocion aboute mydnyght chyld cowhyd aroos hoole beganne preyse god frere iames reaten passyd floode vesselle freres whiche sette lond hasted sore goo oute cause laste shyppe recuyeled backward water soo fylle doune deppest flood thenne alle freres prayde saynt fraunceys hym hym self myght lyke deuocion callid hooly saynt vnto ayde helpe herte frere beganne goo bottom water drye gone erthe caught bote whyche drowned brought hit banke cam vp withoute wetynge clothes ware ne nener drope water touchyd cote ne wette thynge hym thenne late v deuoutely praye hooly fader saynt fraunceis oure socoure ayde aduersytees peryllys helpe merytes maye short lyf come euerlastynge lyf heuen amen ¶thus endeth lyf saint fraunceis foloweth lyf saint pelagyeune first hir name pelagyenne said pelagus whiche moch saye see see alle water habounde lyke wyse habounded see world alle rychesses delyces see inyquyte flood synnes plonged see teeres weesshe flood baptysme saint pelagienne pelagyenne formest noblest wymmen antyoche fulle rychesses thynges ryght fayr body noble habyte vayne varyable courage chaste body tyme wente thorugh cyte grete pryde ambycion ther thynge sene gold syluer precious stone oueral wente fylled thayer dyuerse odour swete smellys fore wente grete multitude yonge men maydens whiche also clad ryght noble vesture ryche hooly fader whiche named • onnon bisshop leopoleos whiche called daunete passyd thorugh cyte sawe thenne beganne wepe ryght bytterly cause hadde cure plese world hadde plese god thenne fylle doune vpon pamente smote therthe wyth vysage wette • erys sayde moost hyhe god haue pyte synnar adournemēt araye one comyn woman hath surmounted one day alle wysedome lyf lorde late tharray one woman folye cōfoūde tofore syght thy dredefull mageste hath arayed self wyth hyhe studye alle myght erthely thynges purposed lord haue pleased haue accomplysshyd cause neclygence thenne sayd hym trouthe saye yow god shalle sette woman wytnes ageynst v dome cause soo besyly paynteth plese worldly frendes louers ¶and whanne ben neclygent please heuenly spouse oure lorde god whanne hadde sayd semblable wordes fylle sodanly slepe hym semed foule douue black culuer flewhe hym whyles masse aulter whanne commaunded baptysed shold departe goo way douue departed anone cam ageyne masse plungyd vessel ful water wente clene whyte flewhe vp soo hyghe myght sene thenne awoke ¶ tyme whanne prechyd chirche pelagyenne present thenne becam repentaunt sente hym lettre messager thus sayenge hooly bisshop ihesu cryst pelagyenne disciple deuylle et cetera yf thow art veryly disciple ihesu cryste whiche haue herd sayd descended heuen synners vouchesauf receyue repentaunt synful woman whome bisshop sente ageyne praye tempte humylyte synfulle man yf thow desyrest saued thow mayst see allone among men thow shalt see thenne cam hym fore many tooke feete moost bytterly wepynge sayd pelagyenne see inyquyte flood synnes swalowe perdycyon deuourer sowles haue deceyued many deceytes whiche alle abhorre ¶ thenne bisshoppe demaunded sayenge thy name sayd haue called fro byrthe pelagyenne pompe clothynge men calle margaryte thenne bisshop receyued benyngnly enioyned helthfull penaunce enformed drede god dylygently regenered hooly baptysme deuylle thenne cryed sayenge vyolence suffre old seruaunt god vyolence euylle old age acursyd day whiche thow born contrary thow hast taken aweye grettest hope nyght whyles pelagyenne slepte deuylle cam awoke sayd lady margaryte harme dyde euer haue aourned alle rychesses alle glorye praye telle wherynne haue angryd shalle amende anone requyre leue leste made reproche vnto crysten peple thenne blessid blew hym deuylle vanysshed away third day assembled alle goodes gaf hit poure peple loue god lytell whyle fled awey nyght without knowlege ony persone tooke thabyte heremyte set self lytell celle seruyd lord moche grete abstynence moche grete good renommee vnto alle people ladde ryght hooly lyf good called broder pelagyen deken bisshop baptysed wente iherusalem vysyte hooly place thenne bisshop sayd hym vysytacion hooly place shold see monke named pelagyen sholde vysyte hym shold fynde trewe seruaunt lord soo dyd anone knewe hym knewe grete lenesse pelagyen demaunded hym haue ye bisshop sayd ye lady sayd hym say hym praye truly thappostle ihesu cryste thenne preest departid came ageyne thyrdde day whanne cam knockyd atte dore celle anone answerd opened wyndowe sawe deed thenne cam told hit bisshop thenne bisshop clergye monkes assemblyd doo thexequyes holy man whanne hadde taken body oute celle fonde woman thenne merueyled gretely gaf thankynges vnto god buryed body moche honourably eyght day october yere oure lord two honderd foure score thus endeth lyf saint pelagien foloweth saint margarite saide pelagyen • first name virgyne margaryte hadde tweyne name called margaryte pelagyen soo moche named margaryte alwey lykened floure hadde floure vyrgynyte called pelagyen myghte sayd pena payne lego legis gadre gadred payne many maners relygyon putte self man kepe god vyrgynyte saint margarite wyse pelagyen margarite otherwise callyd pelagyenne ryght noble vygyne ryght ryche ryght fayre moche nobly kepte dylygence frendes instruct good maners ententyf kepe chastyte honeste suche wyse reffused sene men ony manere att laste requyred maryage noble yong man accord one eche frendes alle thynges necessarye weddynges maade redy hadde wythe moche grete glorye rychesses delyces whanne day weddynge cam yonglynges maydens assembled ryght grete noblesse fore chambre faders moders made grete feste maryage grete ioye vyrgyne enspyred god damage vyrgynyte brought soo grete harmeful enioyenge stratched erthe sore wepynge beganne thynke herte recompence vyrgynyte sorowes folowen maryage reputed alle ioyes world ordure fylthe nyghte kepte fro companye husbond mydnyght commaunded god cutt heer clad thabyte mā fledde fro thennes monasterye monkes dyd calle broder pelagyen ther receyued thabbot dylygētly instruct tauȝt helde self holyly relygyously pryour whiche therby nonnes deed consent thabbotte thauncyent men set mayster thabbeye nonnes hit refused strongly admynystred theyr necessaryes also fode soule contynuelly withoute blame deuylle enuye thoughte myght occupye good tyme somme obiection synne vyrgyne whiche dwellynge oute gate synned lechery thyntymacion deuylle whan bely aroos soo myght hyde alle vyrgynes aferd shamefast also monkes eyther monasterye wyst doo supposed veryly pelagyen whiche prouost also famylyer woman hadde done dede soo condempned hym withoute iugement thenne put oute wyste closyd pytte within roche thenne moost cruell alle monkes ordeyned mynystre hym whiche seruyd hym barly brede water ryght lytell quantite whanne monkes hadde enclosyd hym departed left pelagyen allone troublyd ony maner euer thanked god comforted self contynence thensample hooly sayntes atte laste whanne knewe ende aporochyd wrote lettres vnto thabbotte monkes wyse noble lygnage callyd margarete world wold eschewe temptacions world called self pelagyenne man haue lyed deceyue haue shewed haue vertu man haue vertu synne whiche put innocent therof haue done penaunce therfore requyre yow moche knowen woman hooly sussters maye burye soo demonstraunce deyenge maye clensynge lyuynge wymmen may knowe vyrgyne whome iuged aduoulterer whanne herd herof monkes nonnes ranne vnto pytte enclosyd wymmen thenne knowlege woman vyrgyne withoute touchyng man thenne penytente hadde grete repentaunce whiche done buryed chirche amonge vyrgyns honourably ¶thus endeth lyf saint margrete otherwise called pelagyen foloweth saint thai thaisis first name thaisis said taphos saye dethe cause deth many deyde synne sayd thalos saye delyte delycious men accomplysshed worldly delytes sayd thalamo wylle affection maryage laste wyll maryed god grete penaunce ¶ saint thaisis thaysis redde vitas patrum comyn woman grete beaulte many folowed solde alle substaunces cam vnto vtterest pouerte louers often faught stroof ialousye otherwhyle slewe eche therof hows ofte fulle blood yong men drewe whiche thynge cam knowlege hooly abbot named pafuncius tooke hym seculer habyte shellyng purs wente cyte egypte gaf shellyng saye twelue pen hadde cause synne whanne taken money sayd hym late v entre chambre within whanne bothe entryd chambre sayd hym shold go bedde whiche preciously aourned wyth clothes thenne sayd hir yf ony secrete place late v goo therto thenne ledde hym dyuerse secrete place sayde alwey doubted sene sayd hym ther within place man entreth shalle man see v god yf thow drede hym place maye hydde hym whanne old man herd said knowest thow ther god answerd knowe god royamme comynge world shalle saued also tormentes helle synners sayd yf thow knowest wherfor hast thou lost many sowles thow shalt gyue acomptes thyn owne synne thou muste rekene haue synned herd knelyd doune foot abbot pafuncius sore wepynge prayd hym receyue penaunce sayeng fader knowlege penytent contryte trust veryly thy prayer shal haue remyssyon foryeuenes synnes axe space thre houres shal goo whyder someuer thou wylt shalle doo whiche thow shalt commaunde me· gyuen terme assigned whyder shold come thenne took tho goodes wonne synne brought myddle cyte fore peple brent fyre sayeng come ye forth alle haue synned see ye brenne whiche ye haue gyuen valewe goodes brente fyue honderd pound gold brente wente place whiche thabbot assigned ther monasterye vyrgynes closed celle sealed dore leed celle lytell strayte one lytel wyndowe opene whiche mynystred poure lyuynge thabbot commaunded shold gyue lytel brede water whanne abbot shold departe thaysys sayd hym fader shalle shede water whiche shal come fro conduytes nature sayd thy selle thou arte worthy thenne demaunded sholde praye ansuerde thou arte worthy name god ne name trynyte thy mouthe ne stratche thy handes heuen cause thy lyppes ben fulle iniquytees thyn handes full euyll attouchynges fowle ordure loke towards eest saye ofte wordes qui plasmasti miserere mei lord hast fourmed haue mercy whanne ben thre yere closed thabbot pafuncius remembryd sorowed wente thabbot anthonye requyre hym yf god forgyuen synnes cause told saynt anthonye called alle disciple commaunded shold wake nyght prayer soo god shold declare somme cause thabbot pafuncius come thenne prayd withoute ceassynge thabbot paule grettest disciple saynt anthonye sawe sodenly heuen bedde arraed precious vestymentes thre vyrgynes arayed clere vysages thre vyrgynes named fyrst drede drewe thaysys euylle second shame synnes commysed made deserue pardon thyrd loue ryȝtwysenesse whiche brouȝt hye souerayne place whanne powle sayd grace vysyon merytes saynt anthonye goodly voys answerd meryte anthony fader meryte thaysis synnar morne whanne thabbot powle recounted vysyon knowen wylle god thabbotte pafuncius departed grete ioye wente anone monasterye opened dore celle prayd hym myght yet abyde enclosed thabbotte sayd yssue go god hath forgeuen thy synnes answerd take god wytnesse syth entryd herin haue made synnes somme haue sette fore myn eyen lyke brethe departeth fro mouthe ne nosethrellys soo synnes departed neuer fro myn eye alwey haue bewepte whome abbot pafuncius sayd god hath pardonned thy synnes thy penaunce cause thow hast alwey drede thy courage took oute fro then lyued xv dayes thenne rested lord thabbot effrem conuertyd lyke wyse another comyn woman whanne comyn woman wold haue drawen saynt effrem haue synned dyshonestly sayd folowe folowed whanne cam place grete multytude men sayd sytte doune may haue doo sayde may doo amonge soo grete multitude peple standynge sayd yf thow ashamed peple thow oughtest haue gretter shame god whiche seeth alle thynges hydde wente awey ashamed ¶thus endeth lyf saint thaysis foloweth lyf saint denyse first name denyse moche saye hastely fleynge denyse sayd dya whiche moche saye two nysus whiche saye lyft vp lyft vp two thynges body sowle denys may sayd dyane venus goddesse beaute syos saye god sayth fayre god somme saye sayd dyonisia ysydore precious stone black whiche good ageynste dronkenesse hasty fleynge world parfyght renonciacion lyft vp contemplacion thynges within forth fayre god beaute vertues prouffyted synnars ageynste dronkenesse vyces many name fore conuersyon called ariopogita strete dwellyd called theosophus saye wyse god also wyse men grece sayd vnto daye perystera vranos say wynghe heuen flewe merueilously wynghe spyrytualle vnderstandynge heuen also sayd macharius blessyd also sayd countreye ionicus ionica sayth papye one langages grekes ionyces ben sayd maner round pylers ionicum sayd foote versyfyenge whiche hath two syllabes shorte tweyne longe whiche shewed wyse knowynge god inquysycyon thynges preuy thappostle callyd aryopagyte strete dwellyd • n strete callyd aryopage temple mar athene named euery strete goddes worshiped strete worshiped god mar called aryopage aryos saye mar pagus strete worshyped pan named panopage soo stretes aryopage moost excellent strete cause noble men haunted therin scolers artes lyberalle denyse dwellyd strete whiche ryght grete philosopher moche plante wysedome deyte hym called theosophus saye knowyng god one appollophanus felawe philosophye also epicurij whiche sayde alle felycyte man delyte body stoycy whiche helde oppynyon vertue courage thenne daye passion lord whan derkenesse vpon vnyuersalle worlde philosophres atthenes coude fynde cause naturelle cause derkenesse naturall eclypse mone thenne fro sonne xv dayes old soo parfyght distaunce fro sonne neuertheles eclypse taketh awey lyght vnyuersall partytyes world maye endure thre houres longe appiereth eclypse took awey lyght whiche saynt luke sayth lord suffryd alle membrys cause eclypse elyopolym egypte rome grece orose sayth gyece ende asye lasse sayth whan lord nayled crosse ther ryght grete tremblyng erth quaue thorugh world roches cutte sondre montaynes clouen ryght grete floodes fylle many partyes wonte doo day fro sixthe houre vnto nynthe houre sonne loste syghte thorugh oute alle londes vnyuersall world nyghte ther sterre sene alle egypte remembryth denys apolophanes sayenge epystle world derke communely obscurete derkenesses dyametre retorned purged whanne founden sonne myght suffre suche heuynes ne maye haue knowlege courage yet mysterye thynge oure connynge wysedome appollophanes myrrour doctryne shalle saye secretes hyd thynges attrybute putte mouthe dyuyne vnderstondynge ne speche humayne whome sayd good denyse ben mutacions dyuyne thynges thende sygnyfyed al along day yere thanunciacion powle doctour sayd deef eeres signes al men cryed whiche remembryd haue founden trouth delyuerd laas falsenes ben wordes denys wrote epistle polycarpe appollophanes sayenge tweyne helyopolym sawe mone heuen goo disordynately tyme couenable yet ageyn fro nynth houre vnto euensonge tyme dyametre sonne establysshed aboue naturel ordenaunce eclypse sawe begynne eest comynge vnto terme sonne retornyng ageyne purged defaute made contrarye dyametre thenne denys appollophanes wente helyopolyin egypte desyre lerne astronomye denyse retourned ageyne sayd eclypse tooke aweye lyght fro vnyuersalle partyes world apperith eusebe wytnessyth cronycles whiche sayth hath redde dyctes af ethyncyens ther bythynnia whiche prouynce asye lasse grete erthe shakynge also grettest derkenesse myght also sayth nycene whiche cyte bytynne erthe tremblynge threwe doune howses redde scolastica historia philosopher brought sayd god nature suffred dethe el ordynaunce nature world dissolued elementys lyeden god nature suffred elementis pyte hym sayd another place denyse sayth nyght sygnefyed newe lyghte world shold come atthenes made vnto god aulter sette tytle therupon aulter god vnknowen euery aulter goddes tytle sette aboue shewyng whome aulter dedycate whanne henyens wold make theyr sacryfyse vnto vnknowen god philosophres sayden god hath nede none goddes late v knele doune fore hym praye vnto hym deuoutely requyreth thoblacions beestes deuociōs corages blessyd saynt pawle cam athene philosophres epicurij stoycy disputed hym somme sayde wylle sower wordes • ye sayde semed shewer newe goddes ben deuyls thenne brought hy • strete philosophres examyne theyr newe doctryne sayd hym bryngest thow ony newe tydynges wold knowe thou hast brought v thatenyens entended none thynge somme newe thynges thenne whanne saynt powle hadde beholden al theyr aulters sawe amonge aulter god vnknowen pawle sayde whome honoure ye ye knowe hym shewe yow god made heuen erthe saide denyse whome sawe best lerned dyuyne thynges denyse vnknowen god denyse sayd veryly god whiche amonge goddes shewed v vnknowen come world regne withoute ende pawle sayd man spyryte denyse sayd god man vnknowen cause conuersacion heuen thenne sayd saynt powle preche whiche descended fro heuen toke nature humayne suffryd dethe aroos ageyne thyrd day saynt denys disputed yet saynt powle ther passed aduenture way blynd man fore anone denys sayd powle yf thow saye blynd man name thy god see thenne seeth shal anone byleue hym thou shalt vse wordes enchauntement thou mayst happely knowe somme wordes haue suche myghte vertue pawle sayde shal write fore forme wordes whiche ben name ihesu cryste borne vyrgyne crucyfyed deed whiche aroos ageyne ascended heuen then shal come iuge world see cause alle suspecion taken awey pawle seyd denyse hym self shold pronounce tho wordes whanne denyse seyd wordes maner blynd man anone blynd man recouerd syghte thenne denys baptysed damare hys wyf alle meyny trewe crysten man instructe taughte seynt powle thre yere ordeyned bisshop athene predycacion conuertyd cyte grete pāte regyon crysten feith seyd seynt powle shewed hym sawe whanne rauysshed thyrd heuen lyke seynt denyse seyth shewyth dyuerse place wherof speketh clerly gerarchyes aungels ordres disposicions offyces soo supposed lerned ony hym rauysshed vnto thyrdde heuen hadde sene alle thynges flouryd spyryte prophecye lyke appieryth epystle sente iohan theuangelyst yle pathmos whiche sente exyle prophecyed shold come ageyne sareng thus enioye thou veryly byloued wonderfulle desyred ryȝt well byloued thow shalt laten oute fro kepynge thow hast pathmos shalt retorne vnto land asye thou make folowynge thy good god good werkes hym shalt delyuer shalle come sene shewed booke name dyuyne deyenge blessyd virgyne marye whanne herd peter powle enprysoned rome vnder nero ordeyned bisshop vnder hym cam vysyte whanne martryd passyd god clement sett see rome certayne tyme sente seyd clement fraunce hadde companye rustyke elentherye thenne cam parys conuerted moche peple faith dyde doo make many chirches sette clerkes dyuerse ordres thenne shone soo grete heuenly grace bisshops thidolles moeued stryf peple aye • st hym peple cam destroye hym anone sene hym lefte alle cruelte knelyd doune foot hadde soo grete drede fledde aweye hym fere deuylle whiche enuye sawe euery day power mynnysshed destroyed chirche encreaced hadde vyctorye hym moeued domycyen themperour soo grete cruelte made commaundement someuer myght fynde ony cristen man shold constrayne doo sacryfyse tormente dyuerse tormentes thenne sent prouost sysynnyē rome paris ageynste crysten men fonde blessyd denyse prechynge made hym cruelly beten bespytte despysed fast bounden wyth rustyke elentherye brought fore hym whan sawe sayntes constaunt ferme knowlechynge oure lord moche heuy soroufull thenne cam thyder noble matrone whiche sayd husbond fowly deceyued enchaunteurs thenne anone husbond sente fore abydynge cō fession lord anone putte deth sayntes beten cruelly twelue knyȝtes straytly bounden chaynes yron put pryson day folowynge denys leyd vpon gredyron stratched al naked vppon celes fyre sange lord sayeng lord thy word vehemently firy thy seruaunt enbraced loue therof putte amonge cruel beestes whiche excited grete hongre famyne longe fastynge soone cam rennynge vpon hym maade signe crosse ageynste anone made mooste meke tame cast fornais fyre fyre anone quenchyd hadde neyther payne ne harme putte crosse theron longe tormentid taken doune put derke pryson felawes many crysten men song ther masse communed peuple lord appyeryd hym greete lyght delyuerd hym brede sayenge take dere frende thy reward moost grete presented iuge put ageyne newe tormentes thenne dyde smyte hedes thre felawes seye denyse rustyke elentherye name hooly trynyte done temple mercurye byheded wyth thre ax anone body saynt denys reysed hym self vp bare heede bitwene armes aungels ladde hym two leghes fro place whiche sayd hylle martirs vnto place resteth election purueaunce god herd soo grete swete melodye aungels many herd hit byleuyd oure lorde la • sia wyf forsaid prouost lubye sayd crysten anone byheded wycked felon baptysed blood soo deyed lysbyen sone whiche knyght rome vnder thre emperours cam afterward parys baptysed putte hym self nombre relygyous wycked paynyms doubted good crysten men wold burye bodyes rustyke elentherye commaunded shold caste sayne ryuer noble woman badde dyne bare whyles dyned lady toke aweye bodyes buryed secretely felde heerys whanne persecucion cessyd tooke then leyde theym honourably body seynt denys suffred deth aboute yere lord four score sixten vnder domycyan yere age saynt denys four departed oute world ygnarus bisshop reynes sayth pistse whiche sente charles denys sent fraunce denyse ariopagita afore sayd sayth iohannes scotus pystle charles lest reason countynge tyme shold sayd denys gerarchye aungels translated oute greke latyn receyued grete ioye nyght nynten seke men heled chirche aboute yere oure lord sixe honderd thre fourty lyke hit conteyned cronycle dagobert kynge vysyon vnto hooly man sowle hym rauysshed iugement many sayntes accused hym hadde despoylled theyr chirches wycked aungels wold haue hym paynes blessyd denys cam thyder hym delyuerd comynge escaped confessour whome purpose speke whan kyng etheldrede falle age made parlement whiche two sone shold kynge hym thenne prouysyon god concluded edward whiche thenne borne moders bely shold kyng excluded edmond yrensyde alfrede whiche kynges older sone whan kyng consented therto generall othe made performe tyme comynge whan child borne alle londe enioyed byrthe hopyng gretely releiud hym yet alweye cruelte dane soo grete whiche kyng moche doubted sente quene two sone • alfrede edward normandy took oldest sone edmond hym batayll fyght ageynst ye dane sorow thenne grete englond moche peple torned dane ageynst theyre owne kyng withoute pyte dyd brenne slee owne countre wyth dane among whome slayne saynt alphey archebisshop caunterbury grenewyche many good men bisshops prestes men relygyon fledde secrete place desertes deuoutely praid vnto almyȝty god haue pee lond werre contynued alle lyf etheldrede accordyng prophecye saynt dunston etheldrede regned edmond yrensyde sone ful grete trouble dayes man durst truste ne open courage neyghbour tyme eche man appechyd treason tente myght haue good power ouercome neyghbour torned vnto dane ageynst owen neyghbours helpe dane fulfylled furye wodenes ye dane shold cease sone said yt al punysshement synnes peple god shold purueye peasible kynge whiche shalle fynysshe alle woodenes enemyes dane whoos tyme shalle plente pee bothe come ageyne hadde defende hym wherfor counceiled hym reyse ayde amonge comyns lyke kynge canute hadde done dyuerse tymes ayde thenne cleped dane ghelte counceiled doo lyke wyse said nay wold agree therto notwithstondynge dayly cryed vpon hym sawe importune shewed grete peryls thenne laste saide preue late v see ye wyll whan herd owen mouthe ryght gladde sente commyssiones gadre spared countrey made paye largest wyse whan money leueyed brought kynges tresorye thenne brought kyng thyder see kyng thēne standyng fer fro sawe deuyll lykenes ape sittyng vpon ye tresour sayd haue ye done money haue ye broughte forsoth shalle one peny spente myn vse charge yow delyuer eche man money ageyne therto moche lothe saide myght spende dedes charyte thenne kyng sayd • god forbede shold spende goodes men almesse shold make ye godes poure comyns lauborers see ye deuyll sytteth vpon hepe money maketh grete ioye hath taken v snare wherfor charge paine dethe ye delyuer money ageyne ye euery peny thenne obeyed kyng repaid vnto whome receyued durst neuer moeue kyng suche mater ne none lyke dayes saint edward neyther taske ne tayllage leueyed amōge comyns whiche grete ioye royame tyme kynge seke lyeng bedde ther stode chā bre cheste open full gold syluer clerke cam supposynge kynge slepte took oute certayne somme money wente way soone cam agayne wold haue taken thenne kyng said forsothe thow arte vnwyse come ageyne thou haddest suffycyently ynow fore therfore beware yf tresorer come fynde thou arte lyke deye therfore wherfor yf thow loue thy lyf flee fast awey thow hast anone cam tresorer fond hou tresour born aweye grete parte sought enquyred dylygently theef stale hit kyng seyng grete trouble sorowe tresorer demaunded hym cause heuynes whan told kyng kyng sayd hym sorowe therfore peraduentur hath hath nede theef escaped pursued thynges quyete royamme counceill londe assemblyd treate maryage kyng whiche thyng whan moeued gretely abasshed dredyng lese tresour vyrgynyte whiche kepte fraylle brutyll vessell shold doo say wyst yf shold obstynatly denye dradde lest auowe chastyte shold openly knowen yf consentid therto dred lese chastyte wherfor commended hym self god thou hast surmounted deuylle whiche hadde deceyued troden hym vnder fote thy faithe shalle appiere· deuylle cause thou hast forsake hym armed cruelly ageynst behoueth suffre many thynges paynes haue iohan baptyst patriarkes prophetes aourned thabyte bisshop peter thappostles knyghtes martirs confessours al cam fore oure lord syttynge throne gyue hym lawde kynges thonour done world mortalle peple fyrst ben ben purged secondly whome ben purged thyrdly ben purged wete ben thre maners ben purged fyrst ben deye fore er haue done satisfaction penaunce yt hath ben enioyned hem neuertheles yf moch yf haue nede torned vnto wele ben purgatory second ben purgatory ben haue accomplysshed theyr penaunce alweye neclygence ignoraunce preest whiche confessyd suffysaunt yf haue right contricion may suffyse synne shalle accomplysshe alle cause lytell penaunce doyng lyf lord knoweth maner mesure paynes synnes gyueth payn suffysaunt suche wyse remayneth one payne vnpunysshed thenne penaunce thre wyndowes answerd hym sayd haue doon maad cause thre wyndowes lyghten alle world alle creature ij make derkenesse ¶ thenne hyr fader toke hyr wente doun pyscyne demaundyng hir thre wyndowes gyue barbara cursyd anone hys sheep became locustes consumed stone thenne hir fader took hir heer drewe hir doun fro montayn shytte hyr faste pryson maad hir kepte seruauntes vnto tyme sente iuge delyuer hir tormentes whan iuge aduertysed feythe byleue mayde dyd hir broughte tofore hym hir fader wente wich hyr accompanyed wyth seruauntes thretenyng hir wyth swerde delyuerd hir vnto iuge coniured hym hows one hyr enemye thenne delyuerd hyr strayte place dwelle whan sawe moche greuyd hoost hoostesse thenne salewed walles sayd shold gladly salewe men fynde thus beyng constraynte necessyte sente hir smale chyldren nourisshed dyuers place retorned hyr self fyrst place wente strayte weye vpon stone depe myre vnder ful fylthe passed mette olde woman whome doon moche good tofore olde woman wold gyue hir weye soo fyl depe myre fylth thenne aroos scraped hir vesture lawghed thys one hyr aunte grete pyte hir sente hir wysely hyr vncle bysshop banebergenence whyche receyued hyr moche honestlye reteyned hyr entente marye hyr ageyn whan hir chamberers herde therof whiche auowed contynence wyth hir passyng wroth wepte comforted sayd truste lord loue whome haue auowed contynence perdurable shal kepe purpeos shal take aweye alle vyolence shal corompe alle counceyl humayn yf myn vncle wold marye ony man shall wythstonde power shal gaynsay wyth wordes yf may soo escape shal cutte nose euery man shal hate lothelynes thenne bysshop dyd doo lede hyr castell ageynst hyr wylle abyde tyl somme man shold demaunde haue hyr maryage commaunded lord hir chastyte alle wepyng thenne lord ordeyned bone hir husbond shold broughte ouer see thenne bysshop maad hyr come goo deuoutelye mete boone hyr husbond thenne boone receyued bysshop righte grete honoure hir wyth grete deuocion wepyng teerys thenne sayd lord syr rendre grace thankynges thys may receyue bone swete husbond thou haste vouched sauf comforte pour caytyf syr loued hym moche • louyd lord loue suffred wel presence sente hym vnto helpe holy londe calle wytnes hit delectable thynge lyue yet wyth hym poure also poure beggar thorugh world ageynste thy wylle wold bye hym ageyn wyth heer ne wolde retorne ageyn mortal lyf lord commaunde hym thy grace thenne cladde hyr habyte relygyous kepte perpetuel contynēce deth hir husbonde obedyence performed toke wyl ful pouerte hyr clothyng cours vyle ware russet mantel hyr gowne another foule colour sleuys hir cote broken amended pyeces coloure hyr fader kynge hongarye whan herde hys doughter comen estate pouerte sente erle hir brynge hyr hir fader whan erle sawe hyr sytte suche habyte spynnyng escryed sorowe said neuer kynges doughter ware suche habite ne seen spynnyng wulle whan doon hys message desyred haue broughte hyr hyr fader wyse wold acoord • hit leuer nedy emonge poure peple thynne abounde grete rychesses wyth ryche peple ende shold empesshed hir wylle mynde shold alle weye lord prayed lord wold gyue hir grace despyse al erthely thynges take aweye fro hir herte loue hyr chyldren ferme constaunte ageynst persecucions whan accomplysshed hir prayer herde lord sayeng thy prayer herde thenne sayd hir chamberers lord hath herde voys repute alle erthelye thynges donge fylthe sette nomore myn owne chyldren thenne doo mennes neyghbours ne loue none thynge lord mayster conrade dyd hyr ofte thynges contrarye greuous suche thynges saw louyd remeuyd toke aweye fro hyr companye took fro hyr two maydens hyr chamberers byloued emonge alle ben nourisshed wyth hyr fro hyr chyldehode thys holy man dyd thys breke hyr wylle soo shold sette al loue lord ende shold remembre hyr fyrst glorye al thyse thynges hasty obeye constaunte suffre • pacyence myght possesse hyr sowle obedyence maad fayre ennobled sayd yf onely goddes sake drede soo moche man mortal moche ought drede doubte heuenly iuge therfore make obedyence mayster conrade poure man beggar ryche bysshop cause wold put aweye fro alle occasyon temporal comforte tyme cause wente cloyst • e nonnes whyche prayed hir dyligently vysyte wythout lycence hir maister bete hir sore therfore stroke apperyd hir thre wekes whiche shewed lord hir obedyence plesyng offeryng thousand hostyes better obedyence thenne sacrefyse soo grete humylyte wold suffre wyse hyr chamberers shold calle hir lady shold speke say hir lowest leste wesshe otherwhyle dysshes vessel kechyn hyd hyr otherwhyle chamberers shold lette hir wold say yf coude fynde another lyf despised wold haue taken chase best special grace wepe habundantly teris see celestyal vysyons enflamme hertes loue god ¶ day holy lente chyrche behelde ententyfly aulter lyke ben presence deuyne comforted reuelacion deuyne thenne retorned hir hows prophecyed hir self shold see ihesu cryste heuen anone laye doun feblenes lappe hyr chamberer began loke vp heuen soo glad began deboneyrlye lawghe whan ben longe ioyeful sodeynly torned wepyng thēne loked vp heuenward ageyn anone retorned hir fyrst ioye whan closed hir eyen began wepe thys manere abode tyl complyn dyuyne vysyons thenne stylle whyle sayd thus lord wyl thou ne wyl departe fro thyse thynges chamberers desyred hir telle lawghed wepte said haue seen heuen open ihesu crist whiche enclyned hym debonayrlye glad vysyon wepte departe fro hit sayd yf thou wylt shal wyth answerd lyke ye herde hyr prayer grete ardeur drewe good lyuyng tyme sawe yonge man called hym hyr sayd hym thou lyuest dissolutely thou oughtest serue god wylt thou praye wyl wel requyre desyrously thenne prayed hym yonge man also prayed hym self anone yonge man began crye seece ye lady leue prayed alweye ententyfly began crye ceace lady ceace begyn fayle alle brente esprysed wyth grete hete swette fledde hym self many ranne whiche despoyled hym grete hete hem self myght vunethe suffre hete hym whan accomplysshed hir prayer yonge man lefte hete came ageyn hym self grace gyuen hym entryd ordre frere menoures whan taken habyte relygyon prayed hym affectuously feruent prayer made hym brennyd colde lefte dyssolute lyf toke vpon hym ghoostly spyritual lyf thenne thys blessyd elysabeth receyued thabyte relygyon put hyr self dylygently werkys mercy receyued hir dowayr two hondred marke wherof gaue parte poure peple parte made hospytal therfore called wasteresse sole whyche alle suffred ioyously whan made hospytal became hyr self humble chamberer seruyce poure peple bare humbly seruyce nyght bare seek men betwene hyr armes lete doo theyr necessytees broughte theym ageyn made clene theyr clothes shetes foule broughte meselles bedde wysshe theyr soores wyped dyd alle longed hospytaller whan poure men wold spynne wulle whiche sente hyr abbey suche gate therof gaue poure peple whan moche pouerte receyued fyue hondred marke hir dowayr whiche gaue vnto poure moche ordynately thenne made ordenaunce someuer remeuyd place preiudyce another whan gaue hyr almesse shold haue hys heerys cut shoren thenne came mayde named radegounde whyche shone beaulte hyr heerys passyd haue almesse vysyte hyr suster whyche seek commaunded anone hir heer shold cut wepte ageyn sayd man whiche sayd innocente thenne saynt elysabeth sayd thenne leste said shal swere shal nomore cause hir goo daūces ne karollys ne haunte suche vanytees saynt elysabeth demaunded hir yf euer dysposyd purpoos vse weye helthe answerd yf fayre heer longe sythe taken thabyte relygyon sayd leuer thou sholdest lese thyn heer sone made emperour thenne anone mayde toke habyte relygyon saynt elysabeth fynysshed hyr lyf lawdably whan tyme approched god ordeyned whyche despysed reygne mortal shold haue reygne aungellys laye seek feuers torned hyr walle herde hyr put swete melodye whan one chamberers enquyred hir answerd sayd byrde came betwene walle sange swetely prouoked synge wyth hyt alweye hir maladye glad iocounde ne cessyd prayer laste day tofore hir departyng sayd hyr chamberers wyl ye doo yf deuyl come lytel whyle cryed wyth hygh voys fle fle fle lyke chaced aweye deuyl sayd mydnyght approcheth whiche ihesu cryste borne tyme god calle hys frendes heuenly weddynges thus yere lord thousand two hondred xxvj gafe vp hir spyrite slepte lord though body laye foure dayes vnburyed yet came stynche fro hit swete odour aromatyke came whyche refresshed alle thenne herde seen multytude byrdes soo many hath seen lyke tofore ouer chyrche beganne songe ryght grete melodye lyke obsequyes hyr theyr songe regnum mundi whiche songe preysyng virgyns grete crye pour pe ple hyr moche deuocyon pe ople somme toke heer hyr heed somme parte hyr clothes whiche kepte grete relyques thenne hyr body put monumente whyche founden redounde oyle many fayr myracles shewyd hyr tombe hyr dethe wel shewyd deyeng saynt elisabeth holynes wel modulacion byrde expulcyon deuyl byrde bytwene hir walle prouokyd hyr synge supposed hir good aungel whiche deputed hyr broughte hir tydynges shold goo euerlastyng ioye lyke wyse shewed cursyd men otherwhyle theyr euerlastyng dampnacyon partyes saxone monke hyghte hemer whyche falle soo grete sekenes cryed wold suffre creature haue reste aboute hym hows nyghte apperyd hym honourable lady clad whyt whyche aduysed hym shold auowe hym saynt elysabeth yf wold haue helthe nexte nyght appyeryd hym lyke wyse thenne counceyl abbot maad auowe thyrd nyght apperyd hym ageyn made sygne crosse vpon hym thenne receyued anone ful helthe parfytely hool whan abbot pryour came hym gretely admeruaylled doubted moche accomplysshemente auowe pryour sayd oftymes vnder lykenes good cometh illusyon fende counceylled hym confessyd hys auowe nyght folowyng persone apperyd vnto hym sayd thou shalte alweye seek tyll thou haste accomplysshed fulfylled thyn auowe anone infyrmyte toke hym ageyn wold leue hym afterwarde lycence gyuen abbot accomplisshed • auow made al hool mayde demaunded drynke seruaunte hir faders gafe hir drynke sayd deuyl mote thou drynke dranke hir semed fyre entryd hir body thenne began crye hyr bely swelle lyke barelle eche man sawe demonyake two yere estate broughte tombe saynt elysabeth made parfytely hool delyuerd fende one herman man dyosyse coloyn whych holden pryson callyd wyth grete deuocion saynt elysabeth vnto helpe nyght folowyng apperyd hym comforted hym morne sentence gyuen ageynst hym shold hanged iuge gaue lycence frendes take hym doun galowes bare hym aweye al deed began praye saynt elysabeth hym anone aroos fro deth lyf tofore al chylde foure yere olde fallen pytte drowned man came take water espyed deed chylde drawen thenne auowed hym saynt elysabeth anone restablysshed hys fyrst lyf helthe one frederyk maronner connyng swymmyng tyme baygned hym water mocaued poure man whiche saynt elysabeth enlumyned yeuen ageyn hym hys syght poure man sayd holy lady whiche hath helyd wyl auenge thou shalt neuer come water deed anone swymmer loste al hys strengthe myght helpe hym self sanke doun bottom lyke stone drowned thenne drawen water forthwith sōme frendes auowed hym saynt elysabeth gafe hym hys lyf ageyn man named dyeryk whyche greuously vexyd hys knee thyes myght goo auowed shold goo tombe saynt elysabeth viij dayes goyng thyder abode moneth remedye wente ageyn hys hows thenne sawe slepe woman sprynge water vpon hym awoke wythal angrye sayd hyr wherfore hast thou awaked caste water thenne said haue wette thys wetyng shal doo prouffyte ease thenne anone aroos al hool gaue thankynges god saynt elysabeth thenne lete v praye hir praye v suche thynges shal moost prouffyte sowles amen thus endeth lyf saynt elysabeth ¶here foloweth lyf saynt edmunde confessour saynt edmunde confessour bysshop whyche restyth pounteney fraunce borne englond towne abendon moder named mabely ryche ryȝt holy bothe wyf wydowe said saynt edmond hir sone borne saynt edmondes day kynge marter byrthe clothe fowled hym borne fyrst spryngyng day laye al day tyl nyght deed mydwyf wold haue hym buryed hys moder said nay sone reuyued borne chyrche crystenyd named edmond cause borne saynt edmondes day grewe eage encreced vertues brother named robert moder sette theym bothe scole also two doughters one named marye alyce whiche bothe made nonnes cattesby northamton shyre labour theyr broder edmonde moder gaue gyftes spynne delyuerd soo moche pounde spynners myght lyue therby whiche compleyned therof hir sone edmond toke yarne spōne 〈◊〉 pounde rakyd fyre certeyn tyme toke hyt fyre iuste pounde hurt ne lassed moche pounde wasted brente fyre whan sawe repentyd hyr gretely dyd neuer thys sente hyr two sone pary • scole delyuerd money •• eyr costes scolehyre also two shyrtes heyre prayed theym goddes loue here wold tho shyrtes one twyes weke shold lacke thynge nedeful graunted gladly moders desyre moche wythin whyle custome ware heyr euery day laye therin euery nyght blessyd moder vertuously broughte forth hyr chyldren shorte tyme saynt edmond encreaced gretely vertue euery man ioye hym gyuyng lawde god therof day felawes wente playe lefte felawshyp went allone medowe vnder hedge sayd deuocions sodeynlye apperyd tofore hym fayr chylde whyte clothynge whiche sayd hayle felawe goest allone saynt edmond beyng abasshed meruaylled fro whens thys chylde came chylde sayd edmond knowest thou sayd nay thy felawe scole alle thou goest euer thy right syde yet thou knowest leke forhede thou shalt fynde name wryton thēne edmonde loked forhede sawe wryton therin letter golde ihesus nazarenus rex iudeorum thenne chylde sayd drede edmond ihesu cryste thy lord shal thy deffendour whyle thou lyuest thenne edmond fyl doun mekely thankyng hym grete mercy goodnes thenne lord taughte hym say whan shal goo hys bedde aryse blysse hym prayer ihesus nazarenus rex iudeorum fili dei miserere mei remembraūce passyon deuyl shal neuer haue power ouercome thenne anone thys chylde vanysshed aweye saynt edmond thankyd humbly lord pleasyd hym shewe hym thys manere euer bothe euenyng mornyng vsed contynuelly blesse hym wyth holy prayer hys lyues ende dyd moche penaunce euer goddes sake whan contynued scole longe tyme parys came home went oxenford scole alweye thys tyme chaste lyuyng clene vyrgyn wylle deed neuer consented synne flesshe day made prayer deuoutely ymage lady put rynge vpon hyr fyngre promysed hir feythfully neuer haue wyf onely hir duryng lyf humbly grette lady wyth thyse foure wordes aue maria gracia plenum whyche wordes wryton sayd rynge hoost doughter laboured gretely make saynt edmond synne wyth hyr flesshely longe tyme put hyr laboured soo sore laste graunted hyr come bedde thenne right glad espyed hir tyme came hys chambre anone made hir redy come hys bedde stood naked tofore hym thenne toke sharpe rodde bete mayde blood ranne doun euery syde hyr body sayd hir thus thou shalte lerne lese thy sowle foule lustes thy flesshe soo wyth betyng put aweye alle hir fowle luste euer lyued clene vyrgyne vnto hyr lyues ende sone good moder sente edmonde hyr chyldren knewe shold shortely passe world charged edmond see brother susters shold wel guyded gaue blessyng departed thys world buryed abendon saynt nycholas chyrche tombe marble rode writon lyeth mabely floure wydowes saynt edmond dyd doo make chapel gatesby bothe susters buryed one pryoresse place deyed day certeyn besynesse forgate hit sayd wherfore saynt iohan apperyd hym gastful manere blamyng hym gretely sayd sayd euery day vnto lyues ende satte nyght studye labouryng dyuers seuen scyences spirite moder apperyd hym vysyon charged hym leue studye partyculer science shold fro forthon laboure dyuynyte onelye wylle god hath sente worde thys sayd vanysshed aweye euer laboured dyuynyte proffyted therin merueyllously men wonderd connyng whan radde scoles dyuynyte scolers herars prouffyted one day thenne dyd mennys techyng hole weke many hys scolers techyng ensaūple lyuyng forsoke world became relygyous men day came scole dyspute blessyd trynyte ony scolers came fyl slombryng syttyng chayer whyte dowue brought hym body lord put mowthe dowue assendyd vp heuen ageyn euer sayd edmond thoughte swete sauour lordes flesshe hys mowthe whiche knewe grete pryuytees lord heuen passyd alle doctours oxenford connyng spake lyke aungel man alle hys lesson remembred euer lordes passyon nyght studyed longe bookes sodeynly fyl slepe forgate blesse hym thynke passyon lord anone deuyl laye heuy hym myght blesse hym wyth neyther hande wyst thorugh grace god remembrid blessyd passyon holy chyrche deuyl hauyng euer enuye good werkys sette debate bytwene kynge hym whiche henry thyrd sone kynge iohan whiche desyred certeyn poyntes ageyn lybertees holy chirche thys good archebysshop wythstood hym power prayed kynge spare holy chyrche loue god mayntene theym bounden promysed kynge wold hym expresly dyd certeyn thynges ageynst ryght chirche menaced gretely saynt edmonde whan saynt
