confessour ¶ foloweth lyf saynt hughe bysshop confessour saint hughe holy remembraunce somtyme bysshop lyncoln borne vtterest partyes burgoyn ferre fro alpes otherwyse called montayns noble parentele lygnage came knyghtes thys holy man whan yonge tender eage sette scole whan ten yere olde put monasterye lerne rewles dysciplyne made professyd chanon reguler wherin lyued soo deuoutelye whan xv yere olde deputed pryour certeyn celle rewled suche wyse alle thynge vnder gouernaunce prosperyd wel spyritual thynges temperalle thynges thought adaunte put hys flesshe penaunce dysposycyon lord entrid thordre charterhows receyued vertuous lyuyng emonge straungers soo frendly wel belouyd lytel whyle made procuratour hows tyme henry kynge englond dyd bylde founded hows charterhow • englond wherfore sent burgoyn charterhows haue one haue gouernaunce rewle hit grete instaunce prayer kynge vnnethe coude gete sayd saynt hughe laste commaundemente oueryst requeste kynge sente royame englond maad procurator hows lyued holy deuoute lyf lyke dyd tofore stood soo kynges grace kynge named hym bysshop lyncoln electe chapytre channons chapytre lyncolne whyche bysshopryche kyng holden longe hys honde called therto sayd chapytre bysshopryche hym presented whiche dygnyte vtterly refused sayd playnly wyse wold receyue ony pontyfycal dygnyte without assente also commaundemente pryour charterhows whiche consented also hole eleccion chapytre lyncolne hym declared toke vpon hym offyce sacred bysshop lyncolne nexte nyght herde voys sayeng hym thou arte gone helthe thy peple wythstood myghtyly power wood people entended hurte preuylege chirche put body perylle lyke despysed brynge chirche fro seruytude recouerd many droytes ryghtes whiche ben taken aweye chyrche holy man maad many good statute ordynaunces dyocyse wente vysyted chirche place cure charge lyued holy lyf wold vysyte howses lepres lazar wente ofte entre theyr howses commaundemente wymmen departed men alle men foule desformed theyr vysage wold kysse humylite tyme chirche lyncolne honourable man channon named willyam chaunceller chyrche • good man wel letterd wold preue essaye yf ony elacion pryde corage said holy man saynt martyn kyssyng man foule lazare heled hym ye hele lepres ne lazar ye kysse anone answerd chaunceler saynt martyn certeynly heled leprous man kyssyng kyssyng kysse lepres heleth sowle humble meke answer holy man saynt hughe al lyf moche dylygent buryeng dede men humanyte wold gladly offyce aboute sepulture wherfore lord gafe rendrid hym retrybucion condygne honourable sepulture tyme departed thys world day body broughte chirche lyncolne happed kyng englond kynge scotlond thre archebysshoppes baron grete multitude peple gadred lyncolne presente honourable sepulture god hath shewed hym dyuers myracles thenne lete v praye vnto thys holy man saynt hughe lyncoln praye v thus endeth lyf saynt hughe bisshop lyncolne ¶ foloweth lyf saynt edmonde kyng marter prouynce englond olde tyme dyuers kynges londe departed emonge whome ther saynt edmond kynge norfolke suffolke whiche toke hys byrthe noble auncyent lygnage saxon fro begynnyng fyrst age blessyd man softe vertuous ful mekenes kepte truly veray relygyon crysten feythe gouerned kyngdom ful wel plesure almyghty god ¶ tyme happed two wycked tyrauntes one named hynguar hubba camen denmarke arryued contre northumberlonde robbed destroyed contre slewe peple wythout mercy euery place came thenne one hem named hynguar came contre thys cristen saynt edmond reygned vnderstode flowryng age stronge myghty batayle demaunded people theyr kynge resydente dwellyd whyche moste abydyng towne named thenne eglesdon called burye dane weye acustom wold neuer fyghte batayle sette ne apoynted euer lye wayte myght sleyght deceyte preuented falle good crysten men slee destroye lyke theuys lye awayte robbe slee good trewe men wherfore whan knewe thys holy kynge adressyd one knyghtes hym espye strengthe peple aboute hym hynguar hym self folowed wyth al hoost thende sodaynly shold falle vpon kyng vnaduysed myght subdue hym vnto lawes commaundementes thenne thys sayd knyght came thys holy kyng saynt edmonde made hys legacion message thys wyse drad lord londe see hynguar whiche hath subdued dyuers contrees londes prouynce vnto seygnorye strengthe armes purposeth wyth alle shyppes armye wynter hym thyse march sendeth commaundemente thou incontynente come make allyaunce frendshyp wyth hym thou departe hym thy paternal tresours rychesses suche wyse thou mayst regne vnder hym certeynly thou shalt deye cruel dethe whan blessed kynge saynt edmonde herde message anone syghed called hym one bysshoppes demaunded counceyl hym shold answer vpon thys demaunde axyd hym whyche bysshop sore dredyng kynges lyf exhorted hym many exaumples consente agree tyraunte hynguar kyng whyle said thynge remembryd hym wel many deuoute wordes atte laste answerd messager thys wyse sayd shalt thou saye thy lord knowe thou trouthe loue temporal lyf crysten kynge edmonde shal subdue hym paynym duc thēne vnnethe messager gone hynguar mette hym bad hym vse shorte wordes telle hym hys answer whiche message tolde vnto hynguar anone cruel tyraūte commaunded slee alle people wyth saynt edmonde destroye shold holde kepe onelye kynge whome knewe rebelle vnto wycked lawes thenne holy kynge taken bounden hys handes behynde hym broughte tofore duc many obprobryes wordes laste ladde hym forthe vnto tree whiche therby whyche tree aduersaryes bonde hym thenne shotte arowes hym thycke many thorugh wounded one arowe smote another alweye thys blessyd kynge cessyd alle woundes gyue lawde preysyng vnto almyghty god thenne thys wycked tyraunte commaunded shold smyte heed whiche dyd alwey prayeng sayeng orysons lord god thenne dane lefte body lyeng toke hede bare thycke wood hyd thyckest place emonge thornes brerys thende shold founden crysten men purueaunce almyghty god came wulfe whiche dylygently kepte holy hede fro deuowryng beestys fowles whan dane departed crysten men fonde body coude fynde heed wherfore sought wood one spake another arte thou whiche thycke 〈◊〉 cryed arte thou 〈◊〉 heed answerd sayd anone thenne alle came thyder sawe also grete wulfe syttyng enbracyng heed betwene forleggys kepyng fro alle beestys thenne anone toke heed brought vnto body sette place smyten anone ioyned gyder thenne bare thys holy body vnto place buryed wulfe folowed humbly body tyl buryed thenne hurtyng body retorned ageyn wood blessyd body heed ben ioyned gyder apperyth thynge smyten saufe hyt reed shynyng threde place departyng heed smyten place lyeth buryed noble monastarye made therin monkes ordre saynt benette whiche richely endowed whyche place almyghty god hath shewed many myracles holy kynge marter ¶thus endeth lyf passyon saint edmond kyng marter foloweth saint cecyle vyrgyne marter fyrste hyr name cecylle moche say lyle heuen waye blynde men sayd celo lya ellys cecilia lackyng blyndenes sayd celo heuen leo peple heuenly lyle clennes vyrgynyte weye blynde men informacion example heuen deuoute contemplacion lya besy operacyon lackyng blyndenes shynyng wysedom heuen people ¶ people behelde hyr folowyng spyrytuel heuen sonne mone sterrys say shynyng wysedom magnanymytee feythe dyuersyte vertues sayd lylye whytenes clennesse good concience adoure good fame sayd heuen ysodore saith phylosopres sayen heuen meuable rounde brennyng lyke wyse moeuyng besy operacion rounde perseueraūce brennyng fyry charyte ¶of saint cecillye saynt cecillye holy vyrgyn comen noble lygnage romayns fro tyme laye hir cradle fostrid nourisshed feythe cryste alle weye bare hir breste gospel hyd neuer cessyd day ne nyght holy prayer recommaunded god weye hir vyrgynyte whan thys blessyd vyrgyne shold spoused yonge man named valeryan day weddyng comen cladde ryal clothes golde vnder ware hayre heeryng organes makyng melodye sange hir herte onelye god sayeng lord beseche myn herte body may vndefowled confounded euery second thyrd day fasted commendyng hir self vnto lord whome dredde nyght cam shold goo bedde wyth hir husbond custome whan bothe theyr chambre allone sayd hym thys manere beste belouyd swete husbond haue counceyll telle yf thou wylt kepe secrete swere ye shal bewreye man valeryan sayd wold gladly promyse swere neuer bewreye thenne sayd hym haue aungel loueth euer kepeth body whether slepe wake yf may fynde ye touche body vylonye foule pollute loue certeynly shal anone slee shold ye lese floure yongthe yf soo thou loue holy loue clennesse shall loue loueth shal shewe grace thenne valeryan corrected wylle god hauyng drede sayd hir yf thou wylte beleue thou sayest shewe aungel thou spekest yf fynde verytable aungel god shal thou sayest yf thou loue another man shal slee bothe hym swerde cecylle answerd hym yf thou wylt byleue baptyse thou shalt wel see hym goo thenne forth via appia whiche thre myle towne thou shalt fynde pope urban poure folkes telle hym thyse wordes haue sayd whan hath purged fro synne baptesme thenne whan ye come ageyn ye shal see aungel forthe wente valeryan fonde holy man vrbane lowtyng emonge buryellys reported wordes cecylle said saynt vrbane ioye gan holde vp honde lete teerys falle eyen sayd almyghty god ihesu crist sower chaast counceylle keper v alle receyue fruyte seed thou hast sowen cecyllye lyke besy bee seruyth spouse whome hath taken whyche lyke wode lyon hath sente hym hyther lyke meke lambe wyth word apperyd sodeynlye olde man cladde whyte clothes holdyng book wryten wyth letter golde whome valeryan seyng fere fyl 〈◊〉 grounde deed whome olde man reysed toke vp redde wyse one god one feythe one baptesme one god fader alle abouen alle v alle euery whan olde man redde sayd byleuest thou dou test thou say ye nay thenne valeryan cryed sayeng ther thynge trewer vnder heuen thenne vanysshed olde man aweye thenne valeryan receyued baptesme saynt vrbane retorned home saynt cecyllye whome fonde wythin hir chambre spekyng wyth aungel thys aungel two crownes rose lyles helde honde whiche gafe one cecylle valeryen sayeng kepe ye thyse crownes wyth vndefowled clene body haue brought fro paradyse shal neuer fade ne wydder ne lose theyr sauour ne may seen theym whome chastyte pleasyth thou valeryan cause thou hast vsed prouffytable counceyl demaunde thou wylt valeryan sayd thynge thys world leuer thenne brother whome wold fayne myght knowe veray trouthe wyth whome aungel sayd thy petycyon pleseth lord ye bothe shal come hym palme marterdom anone tyburce brother came entryd thys chambre anone felte swete odour rose lylyes meruaylled fro whens came thenne valeryan sayd haue crownes whyche thyn eyen may see lyke prayer hast felte odour yf thou wylt byleue thou shalt see crownes rose lylyes haue thenne cecyllye valeryan began preche tyburcyen ioye heuen foule creaunce paynyms abusyon ydolles paynys helle whyche dampned suffre also prechyd hym incarnacion lord hys passyon dyd moche tyburcyen conuerted baptysed saynt vrbane fro forthon moche grace god euery day sawe aungellys alle euer requyred lord opteyned almachyus prouoste rome put deth many crysten men herde say tyburcyen valeryen buryed cristen men marterd gafe al good pour peple called tofore hym longe dysputacion commaunded shold goo statue ymage iubyter doo sacrefyse ellys shold byheded ledde prechyd feyth lord one called maxyme conuerted hym cristen feyth promysed hym yf veray repentaūce ferme creaūce shold see glorye heuen sowles shold receyue atte hour passyons hym self shold haue yf wold byleue thenne maximus gate leue tormentours haue home hows sayd maxymus al howsholde alle tormentours torned feyth thenne came saynt cecyllye thyder preestys baptysed afterward whan mornyng came saynt cecylye sayd ye knyghtes crist caste aweye fro werkes derknes clothe armes lyght thēne ledde four myle towne brought fore thymage iupyter wyse wold sacrefyse ne encence thydolle humbly grete deuocion knelyd doun byheded saynt cecylye toke bodyes buryed thenne maxymus saw thyng said sawe houre theyr passyon aūgels clere shynynge sowles ascende heuen whyche aungels bare vp wherfore many conuerted cristen feythe whan almache herde maxyme cristened dyd bete hym plommettes leed longe tyl gaue vp hys spyryte deyed who body saynt cecyllye buryed valeryan tyburcyan almache commaūded cecylye shold brought vnto hys presence doo sacrefyse iubyter prechyd came hyr conuerted fryth wepte sore fayr mayde noble shold put deth thenne said ye good yonge men noo thynge lese yongthe chaunge hit gyue claye take therfore golde gyue foule habytacle take precyous gyue lytel corner take ryght grete place god rewardeth one symple hondred folde byleue ye thys haue said sayd beleue cryste veray god whiche hath suche seruaunte thenne saynt vrbane callyd four hondred moo baptysed thenne almachyus callyng tofore hym saynt cecylye sayd hir condycyon arte thou sayd noble kynrede whome almachyus sayd demaunde relygyon arte thou thenne cecyle sayd thenne begannest thou thy demaunde folyly woldest haue two answer one demaunde whome almach • sayd fro whens cometh thy rude answer sayd good conscience feyth fayned whome almachyus sayd knowest thou power sayd thy power lytel drede like bladder ful wynde whiche wyth pryckkyng nedle anone goon aweye come nought whome almache sayd wronge beganst thou wronge thou perseueryst knowest thou prynces haue gyuen power gyue lyf slee sayd shal proue lyar ageynst veray trouthe thou mayst wel take lyf fro lyue deed thou mayst gyue lyf therfore thou arte mynystre lyf dethe whome almachyus sayd laye parte thy madnes sacrefyse goddes whome cecyllye sayd wote neuer thou hast loste thy syght thou sayest hen goddes see stone put thyn hande touchyng thou shalt lerne whiche thou mayste see wyth thyn eyen ¶ thenne almachyus wrothe commaū ded hyr ladde hyr hows brente brennyng bayne hir semed place colde wel attemperyd thenne almachyus heryng commmaunded shold byheded bath thenne tormentour smote hyr thre stroke coude smyte hyr heed fourth stroke myght lawe smyte lefte hir lyeng halfe lyue halfe dede lyued thre dayes manere gaue al poure peple contynuelly prechyd faythe al whyle alle conuerted sente vrbane baptysed sayd haue axed respyte thre dayes myght commende thyse sowles ye shold halowe myn hows chyrche thenne ende thre dayes slepte lord saynt vrbane wyth dekenes buryed hir body emonge bysshoppes halowed hir hows chyrche whyche vnto day sayd seruyce vnto lord suffred hir passyon aboute yere lord two hondred xxiij tyme alexaunder themperour redde another place suffred tyme marcij aurelij whyche reygned aboute yere lord two hondred twenty thenne lete v deuoutelye praye vnto lord merytes thys holy vyrgyne marter saynt cecyly may come euerlastyng blisse heuen amen thus endeth lyf saynt cecillye virgyne marter foloweth lyf saynt clemente pope marter first name clemente said cleos glorye men mynde glorious mynde glorious mynde purged fro al fylihe ornate wyth vertue decorate wyth al felycyte sayd clemence whiche mercyful sayd glosarye clemente sayd rightwys swete rype meke rightwys dede swete speche rype conuersacyon meke intencion hys lyf hym self sette book named itynerarye specyally vnto place whyche succeded saynt peter papacye remenaunte actes comynly taken dyuers place ¶of saynt clemente pope clement bysshop borne lignage romayns fader named faustyn moder matydyan two brethern one named faustyn faustynyen mathydyane meruayllous beaute hyr husbondes brother brennyd loue hir dysordynate concupyscence luxurye dayly vexyd hir desyryng hir accorde foule luste wyse wold consente hym doubted shewe hir husbond cause shold noo debate ne enemyte falle betwene brethern thenne thought absente hyr somme mene fro hym soo longe shold forgete dysordynate loue syght hir presence sette hym fyre cause myght haue lycence hir husbond fayned dreme subtylly whyche tolde hir husbond thys wyse sayeng vysyon comen thys nyght whiche commaunded departe thys cytee rome wyth two sone faustyn faustynyen shold abyde longe tyl commaunded retorne yf dyd shold deye chyldren also whan hir husbond herde sore abassled aferde sente wyf two sone athene wyth moche meyne shold abyde se • te hir sone scole fader helde clemente home hym whiche lefte v yere olde solas moder sayled see hir sone roos grete tempeste brought shyppe wracke alle broken moder throwen waw • see vpon roche escaped wenyng hir two sone perisshed sorowe dyscomforte wold haue drowned hir self see yf hope fynde hir sone whā sawe coude fynde alyue ne dede cryed brayed strongely bote hir handes wold comforted body thenne cam hir many wymmen tolde hyr fortune comforted none emonge thother ther came one said loste hir husbond yonge man see wold neuer maryed loue hym comforted hir dwellid hir gate dayly lyuyng wyth theyr handes anone hyr handes beten becam soo sore braken myght werke • e herberowed hyr palseye myght ryse hir bedde thus mathidyan constreyned begge axe hir lyuyng fro dore dore suche coude gete fedde hir self hir hostesse whan yere passed departed hir chyldren hyr husbond sente messagers athene knowe dyd sente retorned sente messagers retorned sayd founde none thenne lefte clemente hys sone vnder kepyng certeyn tutours wente seek wyf chyldren took shyppyng came ageyn thus clemente xx yere orphalyn neuer tydynges fader ne moder ne bro •• ern wente studye became souerayn phylosophre desyred enquyred dylygently maner myght knowe inmortalyte sowle therfore haunted ofte scoles phylosophye whan herde concluded dysputacyon sowle inmortal glad ioyous whan sayd mortal wente al heuy confused laste whan barnabe came rome prechyng feythe ih̄u criste phylosophres mocqued hym madde wytte somme saye clemente fyrst phylosophre mocqued hym despysed predycacion scorne put hym thys questyon sayeng cause culex whiche lytel beest hath vj foot two wynges olyphaunte whiche grete beest hath foure foot noo wynges whome barnabas sayd fool myght lyghtelye answer thy questyon yf thou demaū dest know trouth shold rude deef thynge saye ony thynge creature whan ye knowe maker creature cause ye knowe creatour al ryghte ye erre creature worde went moche herte clement phylosophre suche wyse enformed barnabe feythe ihesu cryste wente anone iudee saynt peter whyche taughte hym feyth shewyd hym clerely thynmortalyte sowle alle clerely tyme symon thenchauntour two dysciples wete aquyle nycete whan vnderstode knewe fallaces forsoke lefte hym fledde saynt peter dyscyples thenne saynt peter demaunded clemente lygnage tolde hym al ordre happened fader moder brethern sayd supposed moder brethern drowned see fader deed sorowe drowned also see whan saynt peter herde thys myght kepe hym wepyng tyme peter cam yle mathydyan moder clemente dwellyd yle pylers glasse meruayllous lengthe saynt peter behelde thyse pylers sawe mathydyan beggyng whome blamed cause laboured wyth hir handes answerd sayd syr haue thynge forme lykenes handes ben febled bytynge fele repenteth drowned self see shold lenger haue lyued tho peter sayd sayst thou woman knowest thou sowles slee self moost greuously punysshed whome sayd wold god certeyn sowles shold lyue dethe thenne wold slee self ende myght one houre see swete chyldren whan peter demaunded hyr cause • hat tolde hym al ordre thynges doon thenne peter sayd yonge mā wyth v named clemente sayth lyke thou sayest happed fader moder brethern whan herde smyton grete wonder fyl whan comen hyr self sayd wepyng saynt peter certeynlye moder yonge man knelyng doun tofore saynt peter prayed hym wold haste lye shewe hir hir sone peter sayd hir abyde whyle tyl yle yle peter toke hir hande brought hir shyp clemente chement saw peter holdyng woman honde began laughe anone thys woman nyghe clemente myght absteyne hir lenger enbraced hym aboute necke kyssed hym put hyr backe lyke ben frantyke moche angrye ageynst peter peter sayd hym someuer thou doest put thou aweye thy moder whan c • emente herde anone began wepe aduysed hym toke vp moder whyche fallen doun swowne began knowe hir thostesse laye palseye broughte forth commaundemente peter helyd hir anone thenne moder demaunded clemente fader said hir wente seche hir sythe neuer sawe hym whan herde syghed comforted hir sorowes grete ioye hir sone mene whyle nycete aquylle came whiche whan came whan sawe thys woman enquyred thenne clemente sayd moder whome god hath gyuen lord peter thenne peter tolde al ordre whan nycete aquylle herde aroos al abasshed sayd lord maker al thynges trewe haue herde dreme thenne peter sayd yf ye mynde thyse thynges alle trewe thenne sayd ben faustyn faustynyen whome moder supposed ben perysshed see thenne moder ranne enbraced aboute necke sayd may peter sayd thyse thy sone faustyn faustynyen whome thou supposedest ben perysshed see whan herde fyl donn swowne ioye whan comen ageyn hir self sayd say ye ye escaped sayd whan shyp broken borne vpon table maronners fonde v toke v theyr shyppe chaunged name solde v woman named iustyne whiche hath holden v hir sonnes hath made v lerne artes lyberalle lerned phylosophye sythe ioyned v vnto symon enchauntour whiche hath nourisshed wyth v whan knewe fallaces lefte hym alle maad dysciples peter nexte day folowyng peter thre dysciples clemente nycete aquyle wente secrete place praye moche auncyent honourable man night poure began resonne saye haue pyte brethern vnder lykenes pyte consyder gretelye erre god ne none worshyppyng ne prouydence world fortune onely engendrure happe doth al lyke haue founden expertely self see whiche enformed dysciplyne mathesys many thenne praye ye whether ye praye praye • whiche ordeyned destyne shal falle clemente behelde hym herte iuged seen hym tofore tyme whan clemente aquyle nycete longe disputed hym commaundemente peter shewyd hym prouydence open resons reuerence callyd hym • te fader aquyle said nede haue calle hym fader whan haue commaū dement ought calle man fader vpon erthe h • helde thys auncyent man sayd thou holdest iniuryed fader cause blamed broder called fader haue commaūdement shold calle man suche name whan said al companye laughed axed laughed clemente said thou doest whiche thou blamest callyng thys olde man fader whan ynough dysputed prouydence olde man said wel byleuyd prouydence myn owne conscience denyeth may byleue know destyne wyues whyche fortune hath destyned ordeyned eche body harken ye fortune happed wyf hir natyuyte mar wyth venus vpon centre mone wanynge hows mar endes saturne aduenture maketh aduoultrers breke theyr wedloke loue theyr seruauntes goo wyth straunge contreyes drowned water soo fallen wyf fyl loue hir seruaunte fledde hym perysshed see brother hath recounted loued hym fyrst wold consente hir thenne torned lecherous loue hir seruaunte ought layed ony blame hir hyr destynee hath made hir soo thenne tolde fayned dreme sayllyng toward athene perysshed thenne sone wold haue ronne hym haue dyscouerd matere peter deffended sayd suffre ye tyl plese thenne peter sayd hym yf shewe day thy wyf right chaast wyth thy thre sone wylt thou byleue destyne thynge sayd lyke thynge impossyble shewe thou hast promysed soo impossyble doo ony thynge aboue destynee thenne sayd peter clemente thy sone thyse two thy two sone faustyn faustynyen thenne olde man fyl doun ioye wythout sowle thenne sone came vnto hym kyssed hym aferde shold haue comen hym self ageyn whan swownyng goon herde alle ordre alle thynge happened thenne wyf came sodeynlye began crye wepe strongely sayeng husbond lord thys sayd al fro hir self olde man heeryng ranne hir enbracyd hyr straynyng wyth grete wepynge thenne thus dwellyng gyder came messager tolde apyon anubyon grete frendes vnto olde man faustynyan lodgyd wyth symon magus whome olde man moche glad wente vysyte forthwyth came messager whiche sayde comen mynystre thēperours vnto antyoche sought al enchauntours punysshe theym dethe thenne symon magus cause hated sone faustynyen cause forsoke hym enprynted symylytude lykenesse thys olde man faustynyan suche wyse euery man supposed symon magus thys dyd symon magus cause shold taken mynystres emperour slayne stede hym symon thenne departed fro tho partyes whan olde faustynyan cam ageyn saynt peter sone sone abasshed whiche sawe hym symylitude lykenesse symon magus vnderstood voys theyr fader saynt peter sawe naturell likenes hym hys wyf sone blamed repreuyd hym sayd wherfore blame ye flee fro fader sayd flee fro cause lykenes symon magus apperyth symon composed oynemente enoynted hym wyth al enprynted forme hym self arte magyke thys olde man whyche wepte sayd myshappe ala fallen haue one day knowen wyf child may ioyeful wyth wyf chyldren wepte sore tare theyr heer symon magus whan antyoche deffamed strongely saynt peter sayd cursed enchauntour homycide moeuyd peple ageynst peter purposed slee hym yf myght one holde hym thenne sayd saynt peter olde faustynyen cause thou arte like semest symon magus goo forth antioche excuse tofore al peple suche thynges symon hym self hath said shal come antioche shal take thys straunge likenes shal gyue ageyn thy propre naturel symylytude tofore al peple suppose saynt peter bad hym lye god hath nede lesynges thenne shold boke clement callyd iteneraryum appocryphum sayth none auctorite whiche thyse thynges ben wryton ought taken suche thynges pleaseth somme men neuerthelesse may sayd yf thyse wordes dylygently consyderyd shold say symon magus shold shewe peple semblaunce symon magus vysage shewyng saynt peter persone symon shold reuoke wordes sayd yf sayd symon towchyng trouthe vnto apparence lykenesse thenne fastynyen sayd symon sayth lyke vnto symon supposed symon peple thenne thys olde man faustynyen wente antyoche assemblyd peple sayd symon shewe confesse haue deceyued haue sayd peter thappostle traytre ne enchauntour sente helthe world wherfore yf euer herafter shal say ony thynge ageynst hym ye take trayter wycked put aweye fro penaūce knowleche haue said falsely euyl hym warne therfore ye byleue hym ye ne cite perysshe whan sayd thys peter commaunded hym styred peple loue peter saynt peter came hym made prayer toke aweye fro hym lykenes symon came naturell lykenesse thenne al peple antyoche receyued debonayrlye saynt peter grete honour enhaunced hym sette hym chayer bysshop whan symon magus herde thys came gadred people gyder sayd meruayle whan haue enseygned taugkte commaundementes helthe haue warned ye shold kepe fro trayter peter ye haue onely herde hym ye haue enhaunced hym haue sette hym chayer bysshop thenne al people aroos grete furye ageynst hym sayden thou arte thynge monstre thou saydest day thou repentedest thou haddest sayd ageynste saynt peter thou woldest ouerthrowe v thy selfe al attones roos ageynst hym caste hym towne alle thyse thynges saynt clemente telleth hym self book hath sette thys hystorye thys whan saynt peter came rome sawe passyon approched ordeyned clemente bysshop hym whan saynt peter prynce thappostles dede clemente whyche man pourueyed • ke hede tyme come leest ensaumple euery bysshop wold chese successour hym chyrche lord possede see god herytage gaue ouer lyue afterward clete theym clemente chosen compellyd take vpon hym wherin shone vertuous lyuyng good maners pleasyd wel vnto iewes crysten men paynyms poure peple wryton name eueryche relygyon gyue theym theyr necessyte louyd moche poure peple sayntefyed baptesme suffryd begge comynly whan sacred damoysel wyth veylle whyche vyrgyne nece domycien emperour conuerted feyth theodore wyf sysynne frende emperour promysed purpose chastyte sysynne doubte wyf entred hir chirche preuyly knowe vsed doo whan saynt clemente sayd orryson people answerd amen sysynne made deef blynde sayd seruauntes brynge hen lede ledde hym rounde aboute chirche coude come dores ne gate whan theodore sawe theym erryng soo wente fyrst dore wenyng hir husbond knowen hir axed seruauntes dyd sayd hir mayster wold see leeful therfore maad bothe blynde deef thenne sle gafe hir self prayer prayed god hyr husbonde myght goo fro then hir prayer sayd seruauntes goo ye hen brynge lord home hows went broughte hym thyder theodore wente vnto saynt clemente tolde hym happenyd thenne thys holy man came hym fonde hys eyen open saw ne herde thynge thenne saynt clemente prayed hym anone receyued syght heeryng whan sawe clemente stondyng wyf wode supposed illuded arte magyke commaunded seruauntes holde faste clemente hath made blynde arte magyke come wyf commaunded mynystres shold bynde clemente drawe hym bonde pylors stone wenyng sysynne bounden saynt clemente hys werkys drawen forth thenne clemente sayd sysynne cause thou worshyppest stone goddes tree therfore hast thou deseruyd drawe stone tree whyche supposed hym bounden verayly sayd shal doo slee thenne clemente departed prayed theodore shold cesse pray tyl lord vysyted hyr husbond thenne saynt peter apperyd theodore prayeng ande sayd hyr thy husbond shal saued accomplysshe poule broder sayth man myscreaunte shal saued trewe wyf sayeng vanysshed aweye anone sysynne callyd wyf hym prayed hir praye hym shold calle hym saynt clemente whan comen instructe feythe baptysed wyth thre hondred xiij mayne many noble men frendes themperour byleueden lord thys sysynne thenne erle sacrefyses gaue moche money moeuyd grete treson dyscorde ageynst saynt clemente thenne mamertyn prouoste cyte rome myght suffre dyscorde made saynt clemente brought tofore hym repreuyd assayed drawe hym lawe clemente sayd hym wold wel rather thou woldest come reason yf many dogges haue barked ageynst v haue byten v yet may take fro v men resonable ben houndes dysresonable dyscencyon whiche moeuyd shewyth hath certeyn ne trouthe thenne mamertyn wrote vnto traian emperour clemente answer shold doo sacrefyse exyled deserte beyonde cyte ouer see thenne prouoste sayd hym wepyng thy god whome thou worshyppest purely helpe thenne prouoste delyuerd hym shyppe alle thynge necessarye hym many clerkes laye peple folowed hym exyle prouoste fonde yle moo ij thousand peple cristen whiche longe dampned hewe marble roches anone whan sawe saynt clemente beganne wepe comforted sayd lord hath sente hyther merytes hath made partyner crowne whan vnderstood fette water syxe myle then bare vpon theyr sholdres sayd lete v al praye vnto lord opene v confessours thys place vaynes fontayn welle smote stone deserte synay water flowed haboundantlye gyue v rēnyng water soo may enioyed benefaytes whan made hys prayer loked sawe lambe stondyng whiche lyfte vp right foot shewyd place bysshop vnderstandyng lord ihesu crist whome onely sawe wente place sayd name fader sone holy ghooste smyte thys place whan sawe man wold smyte place lambe stood toke litel pykoys smote one stroke lightelye place vnder fote lambe anone welle fontayn sprange vp grewe grete flode thenne vnto al ioyeng saynt clemente sayd comyng flode gladeth cyte god fame thys myracle moche peple came thyder fyue hondred moo receyued baptesme hym one day destroyed temple thydolles thorugh alle prouynce wythin one yere edefyed lxxv chyrches honoure lord thre yere traiane emperour vnder stondyng thys whiche yere lord lxvj sente thyder duc whan duc sawe al wold gladly deye goddes loue lefte multitude toke onely clemente bonde ancre aboute hys necke threwe hym see sayd may worshyp hym god al grete multitude peple wente ryuage see behelde cruelte tyraunte thenne cornelye phebus dysciples saynt clemente commaunded alle praye lord wold shewe theym body marter anone see departed thre myle weye ferre myght goo drye fote thyder fonde habytacle temple marble whiche god made ordeyned fonde body saynt clemente layed arke cheste ancre therby shewed dysciples shold take aweye body fro then euery yere tyme hys passyon see departed seuen dayes duryng foure myle ferre whyche gafe drye weye came thyder one solempnytees woman wente thyder wyth litel chylde whan solempnyte feste accomplysshed chylde slepte noyse sowne water herde whyche came approched faste woman abasshed forgate hir chylde fledde vnto ryuage grete multitude peple afterward remembrid hir sone beganne strongely crye wepe ranne hyther thyder brayeng ryuage knowe yf aduenture body hir sone myght caste vpon ryuage whan sawe socour ne hope retorned home al yere wepynge heuynes yere folowyng whan see departed weye opene ranne tofore alle came place know yf aduenture myght haue ony knowleche fynde ony thynge hyr sone whan knelyd doun tofore tombe saynt clemente made hir prayer aroos vp sawe hir sone place lefte hym slepyng thenne supposed ben deed wente nerre haue taken body wythout lyf whan saw hym slepyng awook hym took hym hir armes tofore alle people al hool saufe enquyred hym ben al yere sayd wyste slepte one nyght swetely saynt ambrose sayth preface wyse whan moost wycked persecutour constrayned deuyl tormente paynes blessyd clemente gafe hym payn vyctorye marter caste flodde drowned therfore came good rewarde whiche peter mayster came heuen cryste approuyng myndes bothe flodes callyd clemente fro bottom see palme vyctorye releuyd saynt peter element shold drowned vnto heuenly royame lyon bysshop hostyence recounteth tyme mychel emperour gouerned empyre rome preest named phylosophre cam tersone demaunded dwellyd contre thynges ben reherced hystorye saynt clemente cause tyme straunge sayd knewe thynge therof synne contrey dwelled place water longe cessyd grysogone fyrste hys name grysogone may sayd gonos greke whiche moche say aungel wythout aungel worldly malyce sayd gonos whiche moche saye l • der ledde moche people waye trouthe hys ensaumple ¶ saynt grisogone grisogone taken sette pryson commaundemente dyoclesyan saynt anastase fedde hym gaue hym mete drynke lyue wherfore hir husbond put strayte pryson sente grysogone whiche enformed hyr feythe ihesu crist wrytyng thys foloweth holy confessour cryste grysogone anastas • haue taken yoke wycked husbond mercy god haue eschewed bedde fayned dyssymyled infyrmyte haue nyght day embraced stappes lord ihesu cryste husbond hath taken aweye patrymonye whiche ennoblysshed setteth fowle ydolles hath put pryson cursed enchaunteresse make lese lyf temporel bleueth nomore seruaunte spyrite may lye doun deye whiche dethe glorefye self gretely troubelyd mynde rychessls whiche ordeyned god wasted spente fowle thynges fare wel seruaunte god remembre whome saynt grysogone answerde ageyn wrytyng see thou angred ne troubled ony thynge doon foloneslye thy lyf though contrarye vnto thou mayste dysceyued yf thou preuyd tyme paysyble shal come anon derknes thou shalt see anone florysshed light god colde tyme froste yce shal come softe swete tyme fare wel wyth god praye thys blessyd anastase thus constreyned suche wise vnnethe ony brede gyuen hyr foure dayes supposed shold haue deyed wrote pystle hym thys wyse confessour crist grysogone anastase ende tyme comen remembre whan sowle shal departe receyue who loue suffre thyse thynges whyche thou shalt mowthe olde woman whome wrote ageyn apperteyneth alwey derkenes goo tofore lyght lyke wyse sekenes infyrmyte helth shal retorne lyf promysed deth alle aduersytees prosperytees thys world enclosed one ende cause desperacion shold haue domynacyon sorowful ne elacyon ne pryde shold domyne theym glad ioyeful one see whych shyp lady saylleth sowles vse offyse maronners vnder gouernaunce body shippes whiche ben fastenyd bounden wyth stronge chaynes passen wel wythout ony brekyng thorugh stronge wawes see somme shyppes haue brutyl feble ioyntures tree falle ofte peryll drowned thou handmayde ihesu cryste haue thy mynde saynt zeyle preest buryed heed also thus endeth lyf saint grisogone foloweth lyf saint katheryne virgyn marter first hir name katheryne said catha al ruyna fallyng alle edefyce deuyl fyl al fro hir lordes wyth good obeysaūce comyns trustyng good contynuaunce wherfore nede seke straunger rule v royame wyth good assystaunce ayde hope rule gouerne kepe royame good iustyce pee reste lyke wyse kynge grete sorowe heuynesse good vncle sayd thyse iiij notable thynges ye repute v madame sayd fyrst acerteyned ye comen moste noble blode world second ye grete enherytour grettest lyueth woman knowleche third ye science connyng wysdom passe alle fourth bodely shappe beaute none lyke wherfore madame v thynke thyse four notable thynges must nedys constreyne enclyne requeste thenne sayd thys yonge quene katheryne wyth sadde countenaunce vncle sythe god nature haue wrought soo grete vertues v soo moche bounden loue plese hym thanke hym humbly grete large yeftes sythe ye desyre moche shold consente notable thynges hym ouer al mesure soo ferforthly al creature shall haue nede hym nedeth none shal lord must noble blood al men shal hym worshyp therwyth grete lord shal neuer thynke made hym kyng riche passe al rychesses ful beaute aūgellys haue ioye beholde hym pure moder virgyne soo meke benygne gladly foryeue al offencys vnto hym haue descryued hym wyl haue desyre lord husbond goo ye seke hym yf ye fynde suche one wyl wyf al myn herte yf vouche sauf haue fynally yf ye fynde suche one shal neuer take none take thys fynal answer wyth cast doun hir eyen mekelye helde hir stylle whan quene reason commaundeth kepe hole vnhurte wherfore beseche mekely lady moder ye ne none moeue matere promyse playnly deye therfore shal neuer haue husbond onely hym haue descryued whome shal trewely kepe sore abasshed moche astonyed fyl doun dede thenne blessyd lady seyng called hym hys name goodly sayd brother adryan drede ye thynge come good honour prouffyte wyth toke hym vp mekelye comfortyng hym accordyng charge whan blessed virgyne katheryne herde message vnderstode certeyn tokenes came fetche hir hym whome feruently desyred anone aroos forgetyng hir estate meyne folowed olde man thorugh hir paleys cyte alysaunder vnknowen ony persone deserte waye walked demaunded hym many hyghe questyon answerd hir suffyciently alle hyr demaundes enformed hir feyth beuygnely receyued doctryne thus wente deserte holy man loste waye wyst alle confused hym self sayd secretlye ala fere deceyued illusyon ala shal virgyne perysshed emonge wylde beestys blessyd lady helpe almoste despayr saue mayden hath forsaken loue al hath obeyed commaundemente thus sorowed blessyd vyrgyne katheryne apperceyued demaunded hym hym eyled sorowed sayd cause fynde celle ne wote fader said drede ye truste ye verayly good lady whiche sente shal suffre v perisshe wyldernesse thenne sayd hym monaster yonder see whiche ryche fayr beholde demaunded hir sawe said yonder eest thenne wyped eyen sawe moste gloryous monasterye euer sawe wherof ful ioye sayd hir blessyd god hath endowed parfyte faythe place wherin ye shall receyue grete worshyp ioye neuer none lyke sauf onely blessyd lady cristes owne moder quene alle quenes good fader adryā hye fast al desyre ioye sone approched glorious place whan came gate mette theym glorious companye al clothed whyte chappelettes whyte lylyes theyr heedes who beaute soo grete bright vyrgyn katheryn ne olde man myght beholde alle rauysshed fyl doun grete drede thenne one excellent another spake fyrst sayd virgyne katheryne stonde vp dere suster ye ryght welcome ladde hir ferther tyl came second gate another gloryous companye mette hir al clothed purpure wyth fresshe chappelettes rede rooses theyr heedes holy virgyne seeyng fyl doun reuerence drede benygnely comfortyng hir toke hyr vp sayd hyr drede ye noo thynge dere suster neuer none hertely welcome souerayn lord thenne ye v alle ye shal receyue clothyng crowne grete honoure al sayntes shal ioye come forth lord abydeth desyryng thenne blessyd virgyn katheryne tremblyng ioye passed forth lyke rauysshed soo meruayllous ioye coude speke whan entred body chirche herde melodye meruayllous swetnesse passyd alle hertes thynke behelde ryal quene stondyng hir estate wyth grete multitude aungels sayntes who beaulte rychesse myght noo herte thynke ne noo penne wryte excedeth euery mannes mynde thenne noble companye marters felawshyp vyrgynes whyche ladde vyrgyne katheryne fyll doun flatte tofore thys ryal empresse wyth souerayn reuerence sayeng thys wyse moost souerayn lady quene heuen lady al world emperesse helle moder almyghty god kyng blysse who commaundement obeyen al heuenly creature erthly lyketh presente dere suster who name wryton book lyf besechyng benygne grace receyue hir doughter chosen humble handemayde accomplysshe werke blessid lord hath begonne hir blessyd lady said brynge ye wel belouyd doughter whan holy virgyn herde lady speke moche replenysshed heuenly ioye laye ben dede thenne holy companye toke hir vp broughte hir tofore blessyd lady whome said dere doughter ye welcom ye stronge good comforte ye specyally chosen sone honoured remembre ye syttyng parlamēte ye descryued husbonde ye grete conflycte bataylle deffendyng chastyte thenne holy katheryne knelyng wyth moste humble reuerence drede said moste blessyd lady blessyd ye emonge al wymmen remembre chaas lord whyche thenne ful ferre fro knowleche blessyd lady myghty mercy specyal grace hath opened eyen blynde conscience ygnoraunce see clere waye trouthe humbly beseche moste blessyd lady may haue hym whome myn herte loueth desyreth aboue alle thynge withoute may lyue thyse wordes hir spyrites fast closed laye ben dede thenne lady comfortyng hyr sayd dere doughter shal ye desyre yet ye lacke one thynge ye must receyue ye come presence sone ye must clothed wyth sacramente baptesme wherfore come dere doughter al thynge prouyded fonte solempnely apparaylled wyth al thynge requesyte vnto baptesme thenne blessyd lady callyd adryan olde fader hir sayd brother offyce longeth ye preest therfore baptyse ye doughter chaunge hir name katheryne shal named shal hir godmoder thenne holy man adryan baptysed hir lady sayd hir myn owne doughter glad ioyeful ye lacke thynge longeth wyf heuenly spouse shal brynge lord sone whiche abydeth soo lady ledde hir forth vnto quere dore sawe sauyour ihesu cryste grete multitude aungellys who beaute impossyble thoughte wryton erthely creature who syght blessyd vyrgyne fulfylled grete swetenesse expressyd whome blessyd lady benygnely sayd moste souerayn honour ioye glorye kynge blysse lord god sone loo haue brought vnto blessyd presence humble seruaunte ancylle katheryne whiche loue hath refused al erthely thynges hath sendyng obeyed come hyther hopyng trustyng receyue promysed hir thenne blessyd lord toke vp moder sayd moder whiche pleseth pleseth desyre myn desyre knytte maryage emonge al virgynes erthe sayd hir katheryne come hyther assone herde hym nempne hir name grete swettenes entred hir sowle al rauysshed therwyth lord yafe hir newe strengthe passyd nature said hir come spouse yeue hande lord espoused hir ioynyng hym self hir spirituel maryage promysyng euer kepe hir hyr lyf world lyf regne perpetuelly blysse token set rynge hir fyngre commaūded hir kepe remēbraūce said drede ye dere spouse shal departe fro al weye comforte strengthe thenne sayd newe espouse blessyd lord thanke alle myn herte alle grete mercyes besechyng souerayn lord make dygne worthy thy seruaunte handmayde plese whome herte loueth desyreth aboue alle thynges thus thys gloryous maryage maad wherof al celestyal courte ioyed songen thys verce heuen sponsus amat sponsam saluator visitat illam wyth soo grete melodye herte may expresse ne thynke thys gloryous synguler maryage whiche neuer none lyke erthe wherfore thys gloryous virgyne katheryne ought honowred lawded praysed emonge alle vyrgynes euer erthe thenne blessyd lord maryage sayd vnto blessyd katheryne tyme come muste departe vnto place came fro wherfore ye wyl desyre redy graunte departyng ye muste abyde wyth olde adryan x dayes tyl ye perfytely enformed alle lawes wylle whan ye shal comen home ye shal fynde moder deed drede ye ye neuer myssed al tyme ordeyned one stede alle men wene self whan ye come home stede shal voyde fare wel dere spouse thenne cryed wyth ful pyteous voys souerayne lord god al ioye sowle haue euer mynde wyth blessyd hir vanysshed aweye hir syght thenne sorowe departyng fyl swowne laye stylle large houre wythout ony lyf thenne adryan sory man cryed vpon hir longe laste came hir self reuyued lyfte vp hir eyen sawe noo thynge aboute hir saufe olde celle olde man adryan hyr wepynge al ryalte voyded bothe monasterye paleys al comfortable syghtes seen specyally whiche cause hir ioye comforte thēne sorowed morned wepte vnto tyme sawe rynge hir fyngre ioye therof yet swowned kyssed thousand sythes many pyteous tere thenne adryan comforted hir best wyse couthe wyth many blessyd exortacion blessyd virgyne katheryne toke al comfortes obeyed hym hyr fader dwellyd hym tyme lord assygned hir tyl suffycyently taughte al nedeful hir thenne wente home hir paleys gouerned hir holyly conuertyng many creature cristen feythe ihesu cryste al hir ioye hooly sette euer hyr mynde dwellyd stylle hyr paleys neuer ydle euer contynued seruyce lord ful charite whyle lete hir dwelle fulfylled vertues grace dere synguler sponse almyghty god thenne mene tyme maxencyus thenne emperour vycyous goddes lawe cruell tyraunte consyderyd noble ryal cyte alysaunder came thyder assemblyd al peple ryche poure make sacrefise thydolles crysten men wolde make sacrefyse lete slee holy virgyne tyme xviij yere age dwellyng hir paleys ful rychesses seruauntes allone wythout parentes kynne herde brayeng noyse beestys ioye made songe meruaylled myght sente one hir seruauntes hastelye enquyre whan knewe toke sōme peple hir paleys garnysshed hyr signe crosse went thyder fonde many cristen men ledde sacrefyse fere dethe thēne strongely troubeled sorowe wente forthe hardely emperour sayd thys wyse thenne demaunded cause callyd soo ferre partyes • emperour answerd sayd 〈…〉 mayden none comparable hyr wytte wysdom whyche confoundeth alle wyse men sayth goddes ben deuylles yf ye surmounte hem honoure shall sende ageyn contreye wyth ioye one herof despyte sayd dysdayn thys worthy counceyl emperour one mayde yonge fraylle hath doon assemble many sage fro ferre contrees one clerkys scolers may ouercome hyr kynge sayd may wel strengthe constreygne hyr sacrefyse leuer ouercomen argumentes thenne sayd lete hyr broughte tofore v whan shal ouercomen folye may knowe neuer sawe wyse man whan virgyn knewe stryffe dysputacion abode commaunded hir al vnto lord aungel cam hir sayd shold kepe hir fermelye shold vaynquysshed shold surmounte sende marterdom whan broughte tofore maysters oratours sayd emperour iugement sette fyfty oratours maysters ageynst one mayde promyse theym grete rewardes victorye compellest duspute wyth wythoute hope ony rewarde god ih̄u crist veray guerdon stryuen hym shal onelye wyth shal rewarde hope crowne fyghte hym whan maysters sayd impossyble god made man ne suffred deth vyrgyne shewyd paynyms sayd tofore made plato sayd god alle rounde slayne sybylle sayd thus ylke god shold blessyd happy shold hange crosse whan vyrgyne right wysely dysputed wyth maysters confounded theyr goddes open reason abasshed wyste saye al stylle themperour replenysshed wyth felonye ageynst theym began blame theym cause ouercomen soo fowlly one mayde thenne one mayster aboue al sayd emperour knowe thou syr emperour neuer ony myght stonde ageynst v anone ouercomen thys mayde whome spyryte god speketh hath soo conuerted v saye ony thynge ageynste ihesu cryste ne may ne dare wherfore syr emperour knowleche yf thou mayste brynge forth prouable sentence haue worshypped hytherto al conuerted ihesu cryste whan tyraūte herde thyng esprysed grete wodenesse commaunded alle shold brente myddes cytee holy vyrgyne comforted maad constaunte marterdom enformed dylygentlye feythe cause doubted shold deye without baptesme vyrgyne sayd theym doubte ye thynge theffusyon blood shal reputed baptesme garnysshe sygne crosse ye shal crowned heuen whan caste flammes fyre rendryd theyr sowles vnto god neyther heer ne clothe none harme ne hurte fyre whan crysten men buryed tyraunte spake vnto vyrgyne sayd ryght noble lady vyrgyne haue pyte thy yongthe thou shalte chyef paleys nexte quene thyn ymage shal sette vp myddes cyte shal adoured alle people goddesse whome virgyn sayd leue saye suche thynges euyll thynke hit gyuen maryed ihesu cryste spouse glorye loue swetnes may noo fayr wordes ne tormentes calle fro hym thenne beyng ful wodenesse commaunded shold despoyled naked beten wyth scorpyons beten 〈◊〉 derke pryson tormented hongre space twelue dayes themperour wente contreye certeyn cause quene esprysed grete loue virgyne wente nyght prison porphyrye ye prynce knyghtes whan quene entryd sawe pryson shynyng grete clerenesse aungellys enoyntyng woundes holy vyrgyne katheryne thenne saynt katheryne began preche quene ioyes paradys conuertyd hyr feythe sayd hir shold receyue crowne marterdom thus spake gyder tyl mydnyȝt whan porphyrye herde al sayd fyl doun hyr foot receyued feythe ihesu cryste wyth two hondred knyghtes cause tyraunte commaunded shold twelue dayes without mete drynke ihesu cryst sente hir whyte dowue whiche fedde mete celestyal ihesu cryst apperyd hir grete multitude aungellis virgynes sayd hir doughter knowe thy maker whome thou haste emprysed trauayllous bataylle thou constante whan themperour retorned commaunded hir brought tofore hym whan sawe hir shynyng whome supposed haue ben tormented grete famyne fastyng supposed somme fedde hir pryson fulfylled wyth furour commaunded tormente kepars pryson sayd hym veraylye toke neuer sythe mete man ihesu cryste hath fedde hys aungel praye sayd themperour sette thyn herte admoneste answer doutable wordes wyl holde chamberer thou shalt tryumple quene royame beaulte enhaunced whome blessyd vyrgyne katheryne sayd vnderstonde praye iuge trewely whome ought better chese thyse two kyng puyssaunt pardurable glorious fayre one seek vnstedfast noble foule thenne themperour hauyng dysdayne angrye felonye two chese one sacrefyse lyue suffre dyuers tormentes perysshe sayd tarye tormentes thou wylt desyre offre god blood flesshe lyke offryd god fader frende myn onely spouse thenne mayster warned aduysed kyng beyng wode angre shold make foure wheles yron enuyronned sharpe rasours cuttyng soo myght horrybly al detrenched cutte torment myght fere crysten peple ensaūple cruel torment thenne ordeyned two wheles shold torne ageynst ij grete force shold breke al shold betwene wheles thenne blessyd vyrgyne prayed lord wold breke thyse engynes praysyng hys name conuerte people anone thys blessyd vyrgyne sette tormente aungel lord brake tho wheles soo gret force slewe four thousand paynyms quene behelde thyse thynges came aboue hyd hir feythe tyl thenne descendyng anone began blame emperour grete cruelte thenne kyng replenysshed woodnes whan saw quene despysed doo sacrefyse dyd doo fyrste doo rente hyr pappes smyte hyr heed ladde vnto marterdom prayed katheryne praye god hyr sayd hyr ne doubte noo thynge well belouyd god day thou shalt haue royame perdurable thys transytorye royame inmortal spouse mortal constaunte ferme feythe bad tormentours deo commaunded thenne sergeauntes broughte hir cyte araced hyr pappes tonges yron smote hir heed who body porphyrye toke aweye buryed nexte day folowyng demaunded holy body quene emperour bad many sholde put tormente knowe body porphyrye came thenne tofore al escryed sayeng buryed body ancylle seruaunte ihesu crist haue receyued feythe god thenne maxence began rore braye madde man cryed sayeng wretchyd caytyf loo porpherye whiche onely kepar sowle comforte al myn euylles deceyued whiche thynge • e tolde knyghtes whome sayd also ben cristen redy suffre deth ihesu cryst thenne emperour dronken wodenes commaunded al shold byheded bodyes shold caste dogges thenne called katheryne said hir thou hast made quene deye thyn arte magyke yf thou repente thou shalt fyrst chyef paleys thou shalt day sacrefyse thou shalt criste hope helpe byleue beaute glorye virgyns good kyng beseche praye someuer shal remembre passyon deth ony necessyte calle may haue thy mercy theffecte requeste prayer thenne came voys hir sayeng come vnto fayr loue spouse loo beholde yate heuen opene also shal halowe thy pas • promyse comforte heuen requyre whan byheded yssued hir body mylke steed blood aungellys toke body bare vnto moūte synay thenne twenty iourneyes fro then buryed honourably contynuelly oyle rennyth hir boone whiche heleth al maladyes sekenesses suffred deth vnder maxence tyraunte yere lord thre hondred maxence punysshed thys felonye conteyned thystorye thynuencyon holy crosse moche knowen longe holy body becomen grete sorowe lamentacion emonge cristen men sayeng ala moste clere lyghte feyth wysdom temple holy ghoost goon v besought god deuoutely myght plese hym shewe holy relyque came knowleche thys manere deserte boute mounte synay many cristen heremytes whyche enflamed grete deuocyon toward thys holy vyrgyne saynt katheryne wherfore comyn assente ordeyned chapel whyche thys holy vyrgyne shold specyally remembryd whiche chapell mounte synay ferre hylle faste place lord apperyd busshe moyses whyche place holy heremytes lyueden grete abstynence deuocyon gloryous lyf whome tyme aungell god apperyd sayd god hath holden affectuel deuocyon fro heuen therfore hath graunted grace shal founden 〈◊〉 knowen holy body gloryous virgyne saynt katheryne souerayn honoure glorye therfore aryse ye vp folowe though soo ye see yet shadowe palme bere myn honde shal neuer departe fro syght thenne heremytes wente forth folowed aungel tyl came place vnnethe ony creature myght entre straytenes waye sharpenesse rockes whan came toppe hylle sawe thaungel sawe euydently shadowe palme semed al place shadowed leuys palme whiche came vnto place body layen hondred thyrty yere stone hir flesshe dryed vp lengthe tyme bone compacte pure semed kepte cure aungellys thenne toke vp grete ioye reuerence thys holy body bare doun chapel whyche made doon grete myracle place laye stepe thycke streyte soo daungerous semed mannes reson impossyble come ther holy men broughte body wyth solempnytee ordeyned feste thynuencion holy body shold solempnysed whiche yet kepte tyme thynuencyon holy crosse whiche place gretely honoured lord shewith many myracles bone floweth oyle largelye whiche many maladyes guarisshed sayd tofore body founden monke wente mounte synay dwellyd space seuen yere moche deuoutelye seruyce saynt katheryne tyme prayed grete deuocyon myght haue somme thynge hir body sodeynlye came ioynte one hir fyngres hir honde whyche yefte toke ioyefully lord redd • man moche deuoute saynt katheryne ofte called hir ayde lengthe tyme fyl foule thoughte loste deuocion saynt cessyd praye hir tyme prayer sawe grete multytude vyrgyns passyng hym emonge whome one replendysshaunte thenne whan approched hym couerd hir vysage passed fore hym hir face couerd meruaylled moche beaute hyr puyssauntlye thyrdly meruayllous constaunce moste constaunte ageynst thretenynges menace despysed theym alle answerd themperour tarye tormentes thou hast purposed desyre offre god blood make ende thou hast conceyuyd thy corage redy suffre al secondly ferme whan grete yeftes offred hir refused sayd themperour whan promysed holde hir second lady paleys sayd leue say suche thynges felonnous thynke thyrdly constaunte tormentys doon hir fourthly constaunte clennesse chastyte kepte chastyte emonge tho thynges chastyte wonte perisshe fyue thynges whiche chastyte may perysshe plesaunce rychesses poule preperacōn sepulcre saynt clemente heeryng grauntyng petycyons saynt margarete whan prayed remembryng hyr memorye al thise thynges gyder blessyd vyrgyn saynt katheryne apperyth hir legende thenne lete v deuoutely worshyp holy vyrgyne humbly praye hir aduocatryce al nedes bodely ghoostly merytes hyr prayer may shorte transytorye lyf come vnto euerlastyng blysse ioye heuen lyf pardurable quod ipse prestare dignetur qui cum patre et spiritu sancto viuit et regnat deus peromnia secula seculorum amen thus endeth lyf saynt katheryne foloweth lyf saint saturnyne fyrst hys name saturnyne sayde saturare fylled nux note ye paynyms fylled marter hym lyke squyrelle eteth note whan squyrelle taketh note haue oute hulle hit semeth hym bytter thenne goeth vp hygh tre lete falle thenne hulle breketh note spryngeth thus paynyms fylled saynt saturnyn bytter cause wold sacrefyse thenne broughte hym vp hygh capytoyl caste hym doun stappes grees brake heed brayn sprange ¶of saint saturnyne saturnyne ordeyned bysshop disciple thappostles sente cytee tholouse whan entryd cyte deuylles cessyd gyue answer thenne one paynyms sayd yf slewe saturnyne shold haue none answer theyr goddes took saturnyne whiche wold doo sacrefyse bonde hym foot bulle drewe hym vnto hyghest place capytoylle caste hym doun degree stappes grounde heed alle broken brayne sprange accomplysshed marterdom two wymmen toke body buryed depe place fere paynyms afterward successours toke vp body transported honourable place another saturnyne whome prouoste rome helde longe pryson reysed hym tormente named eculee dyd doo lete hym wyth synewes roddes scorpyons dyd brenne sydes thenne toke hym doun smote heed aboute yere lord two hondred lxxx vnder maxymyen ¶ yet another saturnyn affryca whiche brother saynt satyre saynt renouele saynt felycyte suster saynt perpetua whyche noble lygnage whyche al suffred deth togyder whome passyon holden another tyme whan prouoste sayd shold sacrefyse thydolles refused vtterlye thenne put pryson fader saynt perpetua herde cam pryson wepyng sayd doughter thou hast dyshonoured al thy lygnage tyl neuer none thy lygnage put 〈◊〉 pryson whan knewe crysten ranne vpon hyr wold haue cratched hir eyen wyth fyngres cryeng lowde yssued blessyd perpetua sawe vysyon whiche mornyng sayd hir felawes sawe said ladder golde meruaylous heyght erecte heuen strayte man myght goo one allone cultres swerdes yron sharpe fixed right syde lyfte syde wente vp myght neyther loke ne byhoued alweye beholde ryght vp heuen dragon horryble grete fourme laye vnder ladder whiche made euery man drede fere mounte vp sawe satyre assendyng vnto boue lokyng v ward sayd doubte ye thynge dragon come vp surely ye may wyth whan herde vysyon al gaue thankynges lord • od knewe thenne
