place many myle ye shal holde crystemasse ester wyth v lyke tolde thenne byrde flewe felawes ageyn thenne saynt brandon felowes saylled forth occyan sone fyl grete tempeste gretely troubelyd longe tyme sore forla • oured fonde purueaunce god ylonde whyche ferre fro theym thenne ful mekelye prayed lord sende thyder sauftee fourty dayes came thyder wherfore alle monkes wery trouble sette lytel pry theyr lyues cryed contynuelly lord haue mercy brynge ylonde saufte purueaunce god came laste lytel hauen soo strayte vnnethes shyp myghte come came ancre anone monkes wente londe whan longe walkyd aboute laste fonde two fayre • lys one fayr clere water somwhat trowbly thycke thenne thanked lord ful humbly broughte hem thyder saufete wold fayne haue dronken water saynt brandon charged shold take wythoute lycence yf absteyne v whyle lord wyl pourueye v beste wyse anone came fayr olde man wyth hoor welcomed ful mekelye kyssed saynt brandon ledde many fayre welle tyl came fayre abbey receyuyd wyth grete honour solempne processyon wyth xxiiij monkes al ryall cope clothe golde ryal crosse thenne abbot welcomed saynt brandon hys felawshyp kyssed ful mekely toke saynt brandon honde ledde hym monkes fayre halle set doun rewe vpon benche abbotte place wysshe alle theyr foot wyth fayre water welle sawe ladde fraytour sette emonge couente anone came one purueaunce god whiche seruyd wel mete drynke euery monke sette hym fayre whyt loof whyte rootys herbys whyche ryght delycyous wyst rote dranke water fayr clere welle sawe whan came fyrst londe saynt brandon forbadde thenne thabbot came chered saynt brandon hys monkes prayed theym ete drynke charyte euery day lord sendeth goodelye olde man coueryth thys table setteth mete drynke tofore v knowe cometh ne ordeyne neuer mete ne drynke v yet haue lxxx yere euer lord worshypped mote fedeth v ben xxiiij monkes nombre euery feryal day weke sendeth v xij loues euery sonday festeful day xxiiij loues brede leue dyner ete sowper comyng lord hath sente v xlviij loues make v mery gyder brethern alweye twelue v goo dyner whyles twelue kepe quere thus haue lxxx yere longe haue dwellyd thys abbey came hyther thabbey saint patrikes yrelonde thus ye see lord hath pourueyed v none v knoweth cometh god allone whome gyuen honour law • e world withouten ende thys londe euer fayre weder non v hath ben seek sythe came hyther whan goo masse ony seruyce lord chirche anone seuen tapres waxe sette quere ben lyght euery tyme wythout mannes honde brenne day nyght euery houre seruyce neuer waste ne mynysshe longe haue whiche lxxx yere thenne saynt brandon wente chirche wyth abbotte place sayd euensonge gyder ful deuontely thenne saynt brandon loked vpwarde towarde crucyfyxe sawe lord hangyng crosse made fyn crystalle curyously wroughte quere xxiiij seetys xxiiij monkes seuen tapres brennyng thabbottes sete made myddes quere thenne saynt brandon demaunded abbotte longe kepte scilence none spake sayd thys xxiiij yere spake neuer one another thenne saynt brandon wepte ioye holy conuersacion thenne saint brandon desyred abbotte monkes myght dwelle stylle hym whome thabbot sayd syr may ye wyse lord hath shewed maner ye shal guyded tyl vij yere fulfylled terme thou sbalt thy monkes retorne yrlonde saufte one ij monkes cam last shal dwel ye ylonde ankers shal goo quyck helle saynt brandon knelyd chirche sawe bryghte shynyng aū gel come wyndowe lyghted alle lyghtes chyrche thenne flewghe oute ageyn wyndowe vnto heuen thenne saynt brandon meruaylled gretely lyght brennyd fayr wasted thenne abbotte sayd wryton moyses saw busshe al fyre yet brennyd therfore meruaylle herof myght lord grete euer thas whan saynt brandon dwellyd fro crystemasse euyn tyl twelfthe day passed thenne toke hys leue abbot couente retorned wyth hys monkes hys shyppe saylled fro then wyth monkes toward abbay saynt illaryes grete tempestys see fro tyme tyl palme sonday thenne came ylonde sheep receyued olde man whyche broughte fayre halle seruyd sherthursday souper wesshe theyr foot kyssed lyke lord dyd hys dyscyples abode tyl satyrday ester euen thenne departed saylled place grete fysshe laye anone sawe cawdron vpon fysshes backe lefte twelue moneth tofore kepte seruyce resurrexyon fysshes backe fter saylled day mornyng ylonde tree byrdes thenne sayd byrde welcomed saynt brandon alle felawshyp wente ageyn tree sange ful meryly hys monkes dwellyd fro ester tyl trynyte sonday dyd yere full grete ioye myrthe dayly herde mery seruyce byrdes syttyng tree thenne byrde tolde saynt brandon shold retorne ageyn crystemasse abbay monkes ester thyder ageyn dele yere laboure occean ful grete perylles fro yere yere tyl seuen yere accomplysshed thenne sbal ye come ioyeful place paradys dwelle yl dayes ful grete ioye myrthe ye shal retorne home owne abbey saufete ende lyf come blysse heuen whiche lord boughte wyth precyous blood thenne aungel lord ordeyned alle thynge nedeful saynt brandon hys monkes vytaylles al thynges necessarye thenne thanked lord grete goodnes shewed ofte grete nede thenne saylled forth grete see occyan abydyng mercy lord grete trouble tempestys sone came horryble fysshe whyche folowed shyppe longe tyme castyng soo moche water hys mowthe shyppe supposed haue ben drowned wherfore deuoutelye prayed god delyuer grete perylle anone came another fysshe gretter thenne west see faughte wyth hym atte laste claue hym thre pyeces thenne retorned ageyn thenne thanked mekelye lord theyr delyueraunce fro grete perylle grete heuynesse cause theyr vytaylles nyghe spente ordenaunce lord came byrde broughte grete braunche vygne ful rede grape whiche loued fourtene dayes thenne came lytel ylonde wherin many vygnes ful grape londed thanked god gadred many grape lyued xl dayes alwey sayllyng see many storme tempeste thus sayled sodeynly cam fleyng toward grete grype assayled lyke haue destroyed ¶ wherfore deuoutelye prayed helpe ayde lord ihesu cryste thenne byrde tree yle londe holden theyr ester tofore came grype smote bothe eyen slewe hym wherof thanked lord thenne sayled forth contynuelly tyl saynt peter day thenne songen solempnely seruyce thonour feste place water clere myȝt see al fysses aboute wherof ful sore aghast monkes counceylled saynt brandon synge noo al fysshes laye thenne slepte thenne saynt brandon sayd drede ye ye haue kepte two ester feste resurrexyon vpon grete fysshes backe therfore drede ye thyse lytel fysshes thenne saynt brandon made hym redy wente masse bad monkes synge beste wyse coude thenne anone al fysshes awoke came aboute shyppe thycke vnnethes myght see water fysshes whan masse done al fysshes departed nomore seen seuen dayes saylled alweye clere water thenne came south wynde droof shyppe • northward sawe ylonde ful derke ful stynche smoke herde grete blowyng blastyng belowes myght see noo thynge herde grete thonderyng wherof sore aferde blessyd ofte sone came one stertyng al brennyng fyre stared ful ghastlye grete staryng eyen whome monkes aghaste departyng fro made horryblest crye myght herde sone ther came grete nombre fendes assayled hokes brennyng yron mallys whiche rannen water folowyng shyppe faste suche wyse semed al see fyre plesure lord power hurte ne greue ne theyr shyppe wherfore fendes began rore crye threwe theyr hooke malles thenne sore aferde prayed god comforre helpe sawe fendes al aboute shyppe semed thenne al ylonde see fyre sorowful crye al tho fendes departed fro retorned place came fro thenne saynt brandon tolde parte helle therfore charged stedfaste feythe shold yet see many dredeful place came home ageyn thenne came south wynde droof theym ferther northe sawe hylle al fyre foule smoke stynche comyng fro then fyre stood eche syde hylle lyke walle al brennyng thenne one monkes began crye wepe ful sore sayd ende comen myght abyde lengyr shyppe anone lepte shyppe see thenne cryed rored ful pyteously cursyng tyme borne also fader moder bygate hym cause saw better correccion hys yonge age must goo perpetuel peyne thenne sayeng saynt brandon verefyed sayd hym whan entryd therfore good man penaunce forsake synne houre dethe incerteyn thenne anone wynde torned northe droof shyppe southe whiche saylled seuen dayes contynuelly came grete rocke stondynge see theron sat naked man ful grete myserye payne wawes see beten hys body alle flesshe gone noo thynge lefte synewes bare bonys whan wawes goon canuas hynge ouer hys heed whyche bete hys body ful sore wyth blowyng wynde also two oxe tonges grete stone satte whyche dyd hym ful grete ease thenne saynt brandon chargyd hym telle hym sayd name iudas solde lord ihesu cryst xxx pen whiche sytteth thus wretchydlye worthy grettest payne lord mercyful hath rewarded better thenne haue deserued ryght place brennyng hell certeyn tymes yere fro crystemasse twelfth day fro ester tyl whytsontyde paste euery festeful day lady euery satyrday none tyl sonday euensonge doon tymes lye stylle helle ful brennyng fyre wyth pylate herode cayphas therfore acursed tyme euer knewe hem thenne iudas prayed saynt brandon abyde stylle al nyght wold kepe hym stylle fendes shold fetche hym helle said goddes helpe thou shalte abyde alle nyght thenne asked iudas cloth henge ouer heed sayd clothe gaue lepre whiche boughte wyth money stale fro lord whan bare purs wherfore dothe ful grete peyne betyng face wyth blowyng wynde two oxe tonges hange aboue gafe somtyme two prestys praye boughte wyth myn owne money therfore ease cause fisshes see gnawe spare stone sytte laye somtyme desolate place eased man toke then leyed fowle waye dyd moche ease wente waye therfore easeth euery good dede shal rewarded euery euyl dede shal punyssled sonday ageynst euen ther came grete multytude fendes blastyng roryng bad saynt brandon goo then myght haue theyr seruaunte iudas dare come presence mayster yf brynge hym helle v thenne sayd saynt brandon lete maysters commaundemente power lord ihesu charge leue hym thys nyght tyl morowe darest thou helpe hym solde mayster thyrty pen iewes caused hym also deye moste shameful dethe vpon crosse thenne saynt brandon charged fendes passyon shold noye hym nyght thenne fendes wente theyr weye roryng cryeng towarde helle mayster grete deuyll thenne iudas thanked saunt brandon soo ruthefully thot pyte see morne fendes came wyth horryble noyse sayeng nyght suffred grete payn cause broughte iudas sayden shold suffre double payn vj dayes folowyng toke thenne iudas tremblyng fere payne saynt brandon saylled southward thre dayes thre nyghtes fryday sawe yle londe thenne saynt brandon began syghe sayd see ylonde wherin saynt poule thermyte dwellyth hath dwellyd xl yere wythout mete drynke ordeyned mannes honde whan came londe saint poule came welcomed humbly olde forgrowen man myght see body whome saynt brandon said wepynge see man lyueth lyke aungel thenne man wherfore wretch may ashamed lyue better thenne saynt poule sayd saynt brandon thou arte better thenne lord hath shewed moo preuytes thenne hath doon wherfore thou oughtest praysed whome saynt brandon sayd ben monkes must labour mete god hath prouyded suche mete thou holdest plesed wherfore thou arte moche better whome saynt poule sayd somtyme monke saynt patrykes abbey yrelonde wardeyn place men entre saynt patrykes purgatorye day came one asked hym sayd abbot patryke charge thou departe hen morne erly see syde thou shalt fynde shyppe whiche thou muste entre whiche god hath ordeyned who wylle thou must accomplysshe nexte day aroos wente forthe fonde shyppe whiche entred purueaunce god w brought ylonde seuenth day thenne lefte shyppe wente londe walked vp doun good whyle thenne purueaunce god came otter gooyng hyndre foot brought flynte stone yron smyte fyre wyth two fore clawes foot also aboute necke grete plente fysshe whiche caste doun wente waye smote fyre made fyre styckes dyd sethe fysshe whyche lyued thre dapes thenne ottyr came ageyn brought fisshe iij dayes thus hath done lj yere thorugh grace god grete stone whiche lord made sprynge fayr water clere swete wherof drynke dayly thus haue lyued one fyfty yere fourty yere olde whan came hyther hondred xj yere olde abyde tyl please lord sende yf plesyd hym wold fayn dyschargyd thys wretched lyf thenne bad saynt brandon take water welle carye hys shyppe tyme thou departe thou hast grete iourneye doo thou shalt sayle ylonde whiche fourty dayes sayllyng hen thou shalte holde thyn ester lyke thou hast doon tofore tree byrdes fro then thou shalte sayle londe byheest shalte abyde fourty dayes retorne home thy contre saufete thenne thyse holy men toke leue eche wepte bothe ful sore kyssed eche thenne saynt brandon entryd shyppe sayled xl dayes euyn southe ful grete tempeste ester euen cam theyr procuratour whiche maad good chere tyme then came grete fysshe wheron sayd matyns masse ester day whan masse doon fysshe began meue swāme forth faste see wherof monkes sore agaste whiche stode vpon hym grete meruayl see suche fysshe grete alle contre swymme faste water wylle lord fysshe sette al monkes londe paradys byrdes hole sounde thenne retornyd place came fro thenne saynt brandon monkes thankyd lord theyr delyueraunce grete fysshe kepte theyr estertyde tyl trynyte sonday lyke doon tyme took theyr shyppe saylled eest xl dayes fourty dayes ende began hayle ryght faste therwyth came derke myste whiche lasted longe whyche feryd saynt brandon 〈◊〉 monkes prayed lord kepe helpe thenne anone came theyr procuratour bad good chere come londe byheest sone myste passed aweye anone sawe fayrest contre eestward ony man myght see clere bright heuenly syght beholde al tree charged wyth rype fruyte herbes ful floures whyche londe walked fourty dayes coude see none ende londe alweye day neuer nyght londe attemperate ne hote ne colde laste came fayr ryuer durste goo ouer came fayre yonge man welcomed curtoysly called eche name dyd grete reuerence saynt brandon sayd ye ioyeful thys londe ye haue soughte lord wyl yt ye departe hen hastelye wyl shewe hys secretes whan ye come ageyn see lord wyl ye lade shyppe wyth fruyte thys londe hye hen ye may lenger abyde thou shalte sayle ageyn thyn owne contree sone thou comest home thou shalt deye thys water thou seest departeth world sondre syde thys water may man come thys lyf fruyte ye see alle waye thus rype euery tyme yere alwey lyght ye see kepeth lordes hestys al tymes shal see thys londe passe thys world thenne saynt brandon monkes toke fruyte moche wolde also toke grete plente precyous stone thenne toke theyr loue wente shyppe wepyng sore cause myght lenger abyde thenne toke theyr shyppe came home yrelonde saufete whome theyr brethern receyued wyth grece ioye gyuyng thankynges lord whiche kepte al seuen yere fro many peryl brouȝt home saufete whome yeuen honour glorye world without ende amen sone holy man saynt brandon wexe feble seek lytel ioye thys world euer ioye mynde ioyes heuen shorte tyme beyng ful vertues departed thys lyf euerlastyng lyf worshypfully buryed fayr abbey whiche hym self founded lord shewyth thys holy saynt many fayr myracles wherfore lete v deuoutely praye thys holy saynt praye v lord haue mercy v whome gyuen lawde honour empyre world withouten ende amen thus endeth lyf saynt brandon foloweth lyf saint erkenwolde bysshop saynt erkenwolde borne noble lygnage hys fader named offa kyng eest englond also suster named alburgh whiche erkenwolde alburgh right parfyte lyf theyr fader paynym yet thyse two chyldren crysten whan erkenwolde parfyte age wente relygyon made first abbot chirchesey lyued holy lyf made bysshop london suster alburgh trewe folower good werkys woman relygyon hir holy lyf made abbesse berkynge thys holy man informacion saynt austyn mellyte enformed feythe suche wyse vtterly forsoke world ordeyned buylded ij monasteryes one hym selfe chyrcheseye another hys suster barkyng whiche hir baptesme named ethelburga saynt erkenwolde counceylled suster flee worldely vanytees dyd hym self gaue hym deuyne contemplacyon gaue gladly suche goodes besyde spente fondacyon buyldyng sayd monasteryes poure peple chaunged erthely herytage worldly dygnyte hys grete patrymonye herytage lyuelode holy chirche haue hys herytage heuen dyd al thyse expencis called bysshop london holy theodore archebysshop caunterburye dyd consecrate hym bysshop london hys suster sette berkyng vyrgynes alweye ocupyd seruyce lord happed tyme thartyfycers bylded monasterye berkynge ouer seen takyng mesure pryncipal beme shorte wolde accorde place ordeyned wherfore made moche sorowe thenne holy man saynt erkenwolde suster seyng thys mysfortune toke beme bytwene theyr hondes drewe suche wyse suffycyente lengthe accorded vnto propre place ordeyned whiche myracle anone knowen openlye people tyme noo nonnes englonde wherfore saint erkenwolde sente ouer see deuoute relygyous woman named hyldelyth whome bytoke suster enformed relygyon wel connyng good maners vertuous doctryne prouffyted suche wyse passed hir felawes connyng sone made abbesse chyef al monasterye happed sone bysshop london deyed who name cedda consente kynge alle people thys holy man god erkenwolde bysshop london someuer taughte worde fulfylled dede parfyte wysedom softe dyscrete worde bysy prayer chaast body hooly yeuen goddes lore planted rote charyte afterward whan suffred moche trybulacion wyth many ghoostly bataylles began waxe ryght seek thenne commaunded make redy chare myght goo preche cytee worde god wherfore kepte custome longe tyme dyscyples many touche hym kysse hym someuer sekenesse anone delyuerd therof made parfytelye hool day somer thys blessyd saynt saynt erkenwolde rode hys chare preche word god fortuned one whele chare fyl fro axtre notwythstondyng chare went forth right wythout fallyng whyche ageyn nature reson fayre myracle god guyded chare meruaylle alle sawe ¶ mercyable god meruayllous aboue al thyng alle brute beestys made meke wylde thynges obedyente thou vouchesauf calle thy mercy thy blessyd seruaunte make hym partable thy excellente ioye thou yeue v grace prayer knewe reuelacyon sowle shold losed body temporall dethe preserued fro al manere euyl euerlastyng dethe whan thys blessyd saynt erkenwolde god wold came berkyng fyl grete sekenesse whiche ended temporalle lyf soo moche knewe sente seruauntes suche drawyng hym yaue holsom swete lesson blessyd grete deuocyon emonge yelded vp hys spyrite almyghty god who passyng felte merueyllous swete odour hous ful swete bawme whan hyghe channons saynt powles london herde thys monkys chyrcheseye also anone came holy body haue nonnes sayd oughte haue body cause deyed also cause founder monkes said ought rather haue hym caust bothe theyr abbot founder thenne chappytre powles people said stroue vayne shold broughte london owne chirche thus ther grete stryffe laste london toke vp holy body bare toward london wente fyl grete tempeste moche water myght passe constrayned sette doun corp al storme taper borne aboute body alweye bryght brennyng thenne nōnes sayd god shewyd wel london ought haue hym cause tempeste atte laste many wordes clerke whyche longyng saynt erkenwolde sawe thys stryf stode vp commaunded scylence tolde peple grete commendacyon vertuous lyf holy saynt sayd honest ne accordyng mysentrete holy body vyolente hondes lete v byseche almyghty god wyth good deuocyon mekenesse herte shewe v somme token reuelacyon place holy body shal reste alle people consented therto knelyd doun prayed deuoutelye whyles prayer sawe water deuyded dyd moyses reed see chyldren goyng thorugh deserte lyke wyse god gafe drye path peple london conueye thys holy body thorugh water cytee anone toke vp body grete honoure reuerence one assente bare thorugh pathe water stondyng vp euery syde peple wetyng theyr foot came stratforde sette doun bere fayre mede ful floures anone wedder began wexe fayre clere tempeste tapres made brenne wythout puttyng fyre ony mannes honde thus plesyd lord multeplye myracles thonour worshyp holy saynt wherfore peple full ioye gladnes gaue lawde almyghty god thenne toke vp body brought poules many seek folkes touched bere made hole anone touched bere al sekenesses merytes holy bisshop saynt erkenwolde leyed buryed body honourably saynt poules chirche lord hath shewed many fayr myracle delyueryng prysoners theyr yrons seke folke helth blynde syght lame men bodelye strengthe emonge al hath ben special protectour sayd chirche ageynst fyre tyme chirche brente shryne whiche thenne tre sauyd thorugh holy merytes moche clothe laye vpon perisshed another tyme whan grete fyre brente grete parte cyte shold haue entred vpon chirche saynt erkenwolde seen chirche baner fyghtyng ageynst fyre saued kepte chirche fro brennyng thenne lete v praye vnto holy saynt special aduocate v almyghty god may preserued al perylles fyre water gouerne v bytwene welth aduersyre present lyf beyng assoyled synne vyces may brought vnto heuenly ioye laude honour glorye gyuen blessyd trynyte word wythouten ende amen thus endeth lyf saynt erkenwolde bysshop ¶ foloweth holy abbot pastor first name pastor said fedyng cause fedeth shep holy man pastor fedde sheep spyrytuelly brethern spyrytuel wordes doctryne maners holy relygyon holy abbot pastor abbotte pastor many yeris grete abstynence deserte tormēted flesshe longe tyme shyned grete holynesse relygyon hys moder desyred moche see hym brethern sawe day brethern went chirche sawe hir anone fledde fro hir entryd theyr celle shytte dore ageynste hir came dore satte sore cryeng wepyng thenne pastor came dore sayd cryest thou thou olde woman thenne vnderstood voys hym cryed lowder sayd wold see sone sholde see moder bare yaue souke al hore age whome hir sone sayd whethyr wylt thou see v thys world another thenne sayd yf see shal see said hir yf thou mayst suffre see v wythout doubte thou shalt see v whiche thenne departed ioyefully sayeng yf shal see wyl see thenne iuge wold nedes see abbotte pastor myght thenne toke susters sone though malefactour put hym pryson sayd yf pastor wyl come praye hym shal delyuer hym lete hym goo thenne moder chylde came wepyng dore pastor prayed hym helpe hir sone whan coude gete none answer hym thenne sayd hym grete vyolence yf thyn entraylles ben harde yron hast pyte nothynge yet leste oughtest thou moeuyd haue pyte thyn owne blood whiche sone thenne pastor sent hir sayd engendryd noo chylde thenne anone departed angre thenne sayd iuge atte leste lete hym commaunde mowthe shal lete hym goo thenne abbotte pastor sente hym worde shold examyne cause accordyng lawe yf worthy deye lete hym deye yf doo shal plese taughte hys brethern sayd kepe hym self consydere haue dyscrescyon ben werkys sowle pouerte trybulacion dyscrescyon ben werkys solytarye lyf wryton thyse thre men noe iob danyel noe representeth persone possedeth iob troubled danyel ben dyscrete yf monke hateth two thynges may fre thys world one brethern asked hym sayd flesshly couetyse vayne glorye sayd yf thou wylte fynde reste worlde whyche come saye euery caas deme man tyme whan brother offendyd theyr congregacion abbotte counceyl one solytarye put hym oute whiche wepte dyspayr thenne abbotte pastor maad hym brought tofore hym whome comfortyng benygn elye sente hym hym solytarye sayeng heryng desyre see laboure therfore come whan comen pastor sayde hym two men whyche two seruauntes dede one lefte owne wente bewayle dede seruaunte others whan solytarye man herde hym anone vnderstood hym wyste wordes mente compuncyon brother whiche sore trowbled wold leue place cause herde certeyn wordes another brother prouffyted pastor sayd shold byleue tho wordes trewe affermyd ageyn hym trewe trewe brother tolde hym whome pastor said trewe sayd sayd haue seen wyth myn eyen thenne demaunded hym festue beme answerd festue festue beme beme pastor sayd put thyn herte al thy synnes thou shalte fynde lyke beme smale synnes hym ben lyke festue brother whyche doon grete synne beyng wyl • e doo penaunce thre yere axed hym yf moche whyche sayd moche thenne axed yf wold commaunde hym yere sayd moche stood demaū ded fourty dayes sayd hit moche sayd trowe yf man repente hym herte wyl retorne synne doth penaunce thre dayes lord shal receyue hym mercy thenne demaūded worde angred brother wythout cause sayd al euer thy brother greuyd angry wyth hym tyl put oute thy ryght eye yf thou wrothe hym abasshed repreuyd false men dyd hym honoure thenne dyd thys kynges sone nourysshed paleys came age grewe playnely taughte al wysdom meruaylled wherfore hys fader enclosed hym called one seruauntes whiche moste famylyer wyth hym 〈◊〉 demaunded hym thynge sayd hym grete heuynesse myght goo oute mete ne drynke sauerid hym ne dyd hym good whan fader herde ful sorowe anone lete make redy horse semblable yonge man whan shold haue wedd • noble wyf forsoke hyr fledde aweye came place sawe virgyn doughter olde poure man laboured preysed god hir mowthe whome sayd thou doest doughter arte poure alweye thou thankest god like thou haddest receyued grete thynges hym whome sayd lyke lytel medecyne ofte delyuereth grete langour payne right gyue god thankynges alweye lytell yefte made gyuer grete yeftes thynges ben withoutforth ben oures wythin v ben oures therfore haue receyued grete thynges god hath made lyke ymage hath gyuen vnderstondyng hath called glorye hath opened yate kyngdom therfore thyse yeftes syttyng gyue hym praysyng yonge man seyng hyr prudence axed hir fader haue hyr wyf whome fader sayd thou mayst haue doughter thou arte sone ryche noble kynne poure man whan sore desyred hir olde man sayd hym may gyue hir syth thou wylt lede hir home hows thy fader myn onelye doughter haue moo said shal dwelle wyth shal accorde al thynges thenne dyd precyous vestementes dyd hym habyte olde man soo dwellyng hym toke hir vnto wyf whan olde man longe preuyd hym ladde hym hys chambre shewyd hym grete plente rychesses euer gaue hym al thenne iosaphat sayd hym thys narracyon toucheth couenably trowe thou hast sayd thys saye fader many yere arte thou olde conuersest thou fro wyl neuer departe balaam sayd haue dwellyd xlv yere deserte londe sennaar whome iosaphat sayd thou semest better lxx yere sayd yf thou demaundest alle yeres natyuyte thou hast wel estemed accounte nombre lyf specyally haue dyspended vanytee world thenne dede toward god nombre yerys dethe wyth yerys lyf whan iosaphat wold haue folowed hym deserte balaam sayd hym yf thou shal haue thy companye shal thenne thauctor persecucyon brethern whan thou seest tyme couenable thou shalt come thenne balaam baptysed kynges sone enformed hym wel feythe retorned celle lytel whyle kynge herde saye hys sone crystened wherfore moche sorouful one frende named arachys recomfortyng hym sayd syr kynge knowe right well olde hermyte resembleth moche balaam secte shal fayne hym balaam shal deffende fyrste feyth crysten men shal leue retorne fro thus sone shal retorne thenne kynge wente deserte seche balaam toke thys hermyte fayned taken balaam whan kynges sone herde balaam taken wepte bytterlye afterwarde knewe reuelacyon deuyne thenne kynge wente sone sayd hym thou hast put grete heuynesse thou hast dyshonoured myn olde age thou hast derked light myn eyen sone hast thou doon thou hast forsaken honour goddes answerd hym haue fledde derkenessys comen lyght haue fledde errour knowe trouthe therfore trauaylle nought thou mayst neuer wythdrawe fro ihesu cryste lyke impossyble touche heuen wyth thy honde drye grete see chaunge thenne fader sayd cause herof self gloryously haue nourysshed neuer fader nourisshed hys sone whyche cause thyn euyl wyll hath made wood ageynst wel ryght astronomyens thy natyuyte sayd thou sholdest proude dyshobedyente thy parentes thou wylte obeye thou shalte nomore sone shal thyn enemye fader shal neuer dyd myn enemyes whome iosaphat sayd fader wherfore arte thou angry cause made partyner good thynges fader euer sorouful prosperyte hys sone shal nomore calle fader yf thou contrarye shal flee serpente thenne kynge departed hym grete angre sayd arache frende alle hardnes sone counceylled kynge shold gyue hym noo sharpe wordes chylde better reformed fayr swete wordes day folowyng kynge came sone beganne clyppe enbrace kysse hym sayd hym ryght swete sone honoure thou myn olde age sone drede thy fader knowest thou wel good obeye thy fader make hym glad doo contrarye synne angre synne euyl whome iosaphat sayd tyme loue tyme hate tyme pee tyme bataylle ought wyse loue ne obeye wold put v aweye fro god fader moder whan hys fader sawe stedfastnesse sayd hym syche see thy folye wylte obeye come shal knowe trouth balaam whiche hath deceyued bounden pryson lete v assemble peple wyth balaam shal sende alle galylees may saufly come wythout drede dyspute yf ye balaam ouercome v shal byleue obeye yf ouercome ye shal consente v thys plesyd wel kynge iosaphat whan ordeyned named hym balaam shold fyrste deffende feythe cryste suffre hym ouercomen soo assemblyd thenne iosaphat torned hym toward nachor whyche fayned hym balaam sayd balaam thou knowest wel thou haste taughte yf thou deffende feyth haue lerned shal abyde thy doctryne ende lyf yf thou ouercomen shal auenge anone myn iniurye shall plucke tonge thyn heed wyth myn handes gyue dogges thende thou hardy put kynges sone errour whan nachor herde grete fere sawe wel yf sayd contrarye dede taken owne snare thenne aduysed better take holde wyth sone thenne wyth fader eschewe perylle deth kynge sayd hym tofore shold deffende feythe hardelye without drede thenne one maysters sayd hym thou arte balaam whiche hast deceyued sone kynge sayd balaam whyche haue put kynges sone ony errour haue broughte hym errour thenne mayster sayd hym right noble mearuyllous men haue worshypped goddes hym feythe morne sente hym deserte baptysed ledde lyf hermyte thenne enchauntour named theodas whan herde thynge came kyng sayd shold make sone retorne byleue hys goddes kyng said hym yf thou shal make ymage golde offre sacrefyses therto lyke goddes sayd take aweye al ben aboute thy sone put hym fayre wymmen wel aourned commaunde alle waye abyde hym shal sende wycked spyryte shal enflamme hym luxurye noo thynge may sone deceyue yonge men beaulte wymmen sayd yet kynge whyche wyth grete payne sone wyse maysters sayden yf sawe sonne mone wythin ten yere shold lose syghte eyen thenne hit ordeyned thys chylde shold nourisshed wythin pytte made grete roche whan ten yere passyd kynge commmaunded hys sone shold brought forth thynges shold broughte tofore hym cause shold knowe name tho thynges thenne brought fore hym iewelles horse beestys al maners also golde syluer precyous stone thynges whan demaūded name euery thynge mynystres tolde hym sette nought therby whan fader saw retched suche thynges thēne kynge made broughte tofore hym wymmen quayntely arayed demaunded wold soo lyghtly telle hym wherof anoyed mayster squyer kyng sayd iapyng deuylles deceyue men thenne kynge demaunded hym lyeuest al seen answeryd fader soule coueyteth noo thynge moche deuylles deceyue men therfore suppose none thynge shal surmounte thy sone wymmen whiche moeue men alle waye lecherye thenne kynge put alle mynystres sette therin sone rizt noble fayre maydens whyche alweye hym admonested playe none myght speke ne serue hym anone enchauntour sent hym deuyl enflame hym whiche brennyd yonge man wythinforth maydens wythoutforth whan felte hym soo strongelye trauaylled moche angry recommaunded hym self alle god receyued deuyne comforte suche wyse al temptacyon departed hym kynge sawe deuyl thynge sente hym fayre mayden kynges doughter whyche faderles whome man god prechyd answerd yf thou wylte saue take aweye fro worshyppyng thydolles conioyne vnto couplyng maryage patryarkes prophetes peter appostle wyues sayd hir woman thyse wordes sayest thou nought apperteyneth wel crysten men wedde wyues haue promysed lord kepe vyrgynyte sayd hym thou wylte yf thou wylte saue sowle graunte lytel requeste lye wyth onelye nyght promyse morne shal made crysten ye say aungels haue ioye heuen one synnar doyng penaunce thenne many grete guerdon due hym doth penaunce conuerteth hym therfore graunte onely thys requeste soo thou shalte saue thenne began strongely assayle toure hys conscience thenne deuyl sayd felawes loo see thys mayde hath strongely put forth myȝt moeue come thenne lete v knocke strongely ageynst hym syth fynde tyme couenable whan holy yonge man sawe thys thynge caytyfnes couetyse hys flesshe admonested hym synne also desyred sauacyon mayde entysyng deuyl moeuyd hym thenne put hym self prayer wepynge fyl slepe sawe vysyon broughte medowe arayed wyth fayr floures leuys tree demened swete sounde whiche came wynde agreable thereut yssued merueyllous odour soo grete raynes thondres lyghtnynges tempestes neuer soo grete ony man myght remembre stone fyl grete egges square whyche medlyd wyth rayne destroyed vygnes tree corne slewe men beestys crowys byrdes hongary whiche wyf lantgraue thurynge hessyn emonge innumerable myracles reysed xvj dede men gaue syght one borne blynde who body oylle floweth vnto thys day whan otto deposed frederyke sone henry whan xij yere olde kepte faders shepe tyme behelde chyrche anone replenysshed wyth holy ghoost lefte hys shepe wente chirche accompanyed hym wyth good auncyent man sayd hym thys manere fayre fader wente bare •• ed homewarde god hym selfe fourme lyknesse poure man receyued sayd hood may byleuyd sente hym ageyn sayd hood wherof grete meruayllous myracle tyme whan gyuen alle breed poure folkes loues breed broughte hym ynough suffyse hym poure peple felawshyp wyth alle woman vnknowen whyche hir presente delyuerd vanysshed aweye neuer seen another tyme receyued poure man apperyng ryght fowle dysfourmed ouer foule clothynge made hym ete sette hande owne dysshe wyth hym thys poure man departyng sayeng god wyth helpe hys gowne wonder fowle sayd became soo whyte grete resplendour shynyng face fayre apperyd bryght al hows replenysshed fylled wyth grete lyghte archebysshop af narbonne vexyd wyth stronge ax feblenesse nature reputed holden dede alle theym whyche aboute hym eyen shytte manere deed man thynuocacion callyng saynt yue maad salue sayd archebysshop hys parentes frendes wyth wepynges vowes deuocyons forsayd archebysshop thorugh merytes saynt restored vnto lyf • syght good helthe grace vertue hym writen • enlumyneth exen gyueth lyf helthe blessyng lyght sapyence whyche god creatour enlumynatour sauyour thanked preysed worshypped syecle syecles amen thus endeth lyf saint yue foloweth lyf saint morante kyng theodorik commaunded saynt morant dowey whyche parys sone aldebaulte noble ffrenssheman saynt rotrud marchyennes whiche thre doughters vyrgynes sayntes wete clotende eusebe ellysente saynt rotr • dwellyd marchyennes nonnerye wyth clotente elyssente hyr doughters ordenaunce saynt amand many passyd fro thys world eusebe hir doughter dwellyd abbay nonnes haynegowe wyth graunte moder saynt aldebaulte hir fader whyche called gertrude abbey nyuelle yefte foundacyon saint amand contreye many abbayes monkes wherof co •• purpoos saynt morante 〈◊〉 rotrud moder dyd bylde 〈◊〉 abbey theyr owne groūde 〈◊〉 monkes therin gafe rente possessyons lyue called place bruell kyng theodoryk wel wyste commaunded saynt morante shold make saynt amer ledde prysonner fro peronne vnto sayd newe abbay hym kepte shold scare fro then goo somwhere place saynt morante came peronne fro then brought hym saynt amer thorugh cambray saint amer whyles made dyner redy wente lady cambray made prayer knelyng toke bothe gloues hys habyte caste nyghe glasse wyndowe rayes bemys sonne susteyned fro groūde hanged vpon staffe holy man whiche euer loked humbly dounward perceyued saynt morant folowed hym sone chirche whan came sawe myracle al abasshed prayed hym mercy broughte hym thyder like prysonner besought hym fro then forthon wold become fader god commaundementes wolde obeye saynt amer thenne whiche retched lyfte hym self vp reuestyd hym habyte gloues thanked moche saynt morant sayd hym shold obeye kynge therto holden hym shold obeye lord shold bere al pacyence aduersytres gladly wolde goo wyth hym ordeyned goo saynt morante thenne ledde saint amer bruel haynegow many holy mynsters abbayes separed gouernyd dyscyples saynt amande whyche alle sayntes saynt amer lyke paradys terrestre al contree aboute resplendysshed sayntes bothe men wymmen grete penaunces seruauntes frendys god euerychone forced hym self passe felawe wele wythout euyl wicked enuye wyth grete charyte one gafe ensaumple another wel whan saynt morante saynt rotrud moder knewe ynough wyste deuocion humylite pacyence doctryne saynt amer prayed hym wold empryse vndertake cure gouernemente abbey bruel whiche foūded theyr patrymonye gafe theyr owne self theyr abbay al theyr good hym saynt amer receyued mekelye dwellyd togyder pesablye alle holy men desyred moche doctryne saynt amer enorted taughte moche saynt morante made hym clerke ordeyned hym vnto deaken maad hym abbotte owne hows founded honour god lord saynt peter saynt amer dyd make chambre ioynyng chirche oratorye wherin restyd hym wyth lord slepyng watchyng fastyng contynuelly prayeng made holy man hys holy penytence longe lyued whan lord wold calle hym vnto companye receyued hys ryghtes toke leue saynt morante freres soo deyed buryed within chyrche saynt peter doway rendred yaue sowle lord aboute yere grace seuen hondred ¶ haue sayd whiche say lyf sayntes nyghe loste alle theyr legendes norman whiche wasted spylte londe wyth ij hondred two fyf • shyppes men armes whiche aryued came londe walked thorugh fraunce vnto romanye gooyng comyng space fourty yere beganne aboute yere viij hondred one fyfty yf one scaped • weyne loste yet oner alle dyuers werrys merueylle knowe none therfore shal praye lord ihesu cryste ¶thus endeth lyf saint morante ¶here folowe lyf saint lowys kynge fraunce saynt lowes somtyme noble kyng fraunce fader kyng ryght cristen named lowys lowys fader bataylled foughte ageynst heretykes ablygoys contre tholouse extyrped here ye retourned fraunce passyd vnto lord thenne chylde holy chyldehode faderlesse abode dwellyd vnder kepyng quene blaunche moder somtyme doughter kynge castylle louyd hym tenderlye betoke hym lernyd taughte vnder cure gouernaunce special maister condycyons lettres also yonge salamon chylde wyse dysposed haue good sowle prouffyted right gretelye al thynges ony childe age whiche good lyf chyldehode debonayr moder enioysyng hir self sayd ofte tymes hym thys manere ryghte deresone rather wold see deth comyng thenne see falle dedely synne ageynste thy creatour whiche worde deuoute chylde took shette soo wythin hys courage grace god deffended kepte hym founde euer felte ony • ouchemente • atche spotte mortal crysme ende pourueaunce moder baron londe thende noble royaulme ne shold faylle suc • essyon ryalle holy man took wyf receyued gate hyr fayr chyldren whyche souerayn cure le made nourysshed endoctrined taught loue god despyte world knowe selfe holy admonestyng ensaumples whan myght tende secretelye vysytyng requyryng theyr prouffyte auncyente thobye gaue admonestyng salut techyng ouer alle thynges drede god kepe absteyne assyduelly alle synne garlondes made rose floures forbade deffended fryday crowne thorne suche day put heed lord cause wyste wel knewe chastyt • e delyces pyte rychees humnlyte honour often peryshen betoke gaue courage sobryete good dyete humylite sericorde kepyng hym self ryght curyously fro pryckyng sawtes watche world flesshe deuyll chastysed hys body brought seruytude ensaumple appostles forced hym self serue spyryte dyuers castygacion chastysyng vsed hayre many tymes nexte hys flesshe whan lefte cause ouer feblenesse body instaunce hys owne confessour ordeyned said confessour gyue poure folke recompensacion euery day faylled hit fourty shyllynges fastyd alweye fryday namelye tyme lente aduentes absteyned hym tho dayes al maner fysshe fro fruytes contynuelly trauayll • paynyd body watchynges orysons secretes abstynences dyscyplynes humylite beaute vertues resplendysshed stronge hym better wexyd dauyd shewyd hym self meke humble foule reputed hym god acustomed euery satyrday wosshe owne handes secrete place foot somme poure folke dryed wyth fayre towel kyssed moche humbly semblahly theyr handes dystrybuyng desyng euery one certeyn syluer also seuen score poure men whiche dayly came courte admynystred mete drynke wyth hys owne handes fedde habonndantlye vygyles solempne somme certeyn dayes yere two hondred poure ete dranke owne handes admynystred seruyd theym bothe mete drynke euer bothe dyuer sowper thre auncyente poure whiche ete nyghe hym whome charytably sente suche mete broughte hym somtyme dysshes mete poure lord touched wyth theyr handes specialle soppes whiche fayne ete made theyr remenaunte relyef brought hym ende shold ete yet ageyn honour worshyp name lord poure folke ashamed ete theyr relyef also wold vse scarlate ne gownes ryche clothe ne also furryng ouer grete pryse coste namelye sythe came fro partyes beyonde see fyrste tyme ageyn coueytyd grete desire growyng vp feyth wherfore veray louer feyth couetous enhaunce yet late con • allesshed yssued greuous seeknesse lyeng pontoyse toke crosse grete deuocyon fro hande bysshop parys ledde hym thre hys brethern wyth grettest lordes baron hys royalme many knyght peple hym applykd waye ryght grete hoost arryued egypte whyche settyng foot grounde ocupyed took force men armes cytee renommed whiche called damette alle regyon aboute thenne crysten oost esprysed bete moche grete wonderful sekenesse iuste iugemente god many crysten men deyed soo moche nombre two thyrty thousand fyghtyng men ne lefte lyue syx thousand men god fader myserycorde wyllyng hym self shewed wonderful meruaylable saynt gafe betoke sayd kyng champyon deffensour feythe handes euyl paynyms thende shold appere meruaylable debonayr kynge myght haue scaped nexte shyppe nygh then alwayes yelded hym self good gree thende myght delyuer hys peple thorugh encheson hym put grete raunsom whiche payed wold yet abyde prysonner payemente raunsom hys lordes baron thenne put lefte ioseph oute chartre pryson egypte fleeyng dredeful retorned anone vnto propre owne partyes fyrst abode contynuelly space fyue yere syrye conuertysed many paynyms feythe beyng crysten paynyms handes dyched fortefyed many townes castellys stronge walles ¶ founde thenne aboute sydoyne many dede bodyes crysten men many one dysmembryd eten wyth beestys stanke ouer moche whiche gadred assemblid wyth owne handes thayde helpe vnnethe myght endure ne suffre stenche humbly deuoutelye betook buryeng holy chyrche vnderstondyng sekenesse quene moder counceyl baron assented retourne fraunce vpon see thyrd nyght nygh rysyng aurora shyppe kynge hurted smote twyes ageynst roche strongelye maronners wende shyppe shold haue broken plonged see thenne preestys clerkys folke abasshed wyth grete hurtyng sayd shyppe founde holy kyng deuoutelye prayeng body lord wherfore fermelye beleuyd god almyghty merytes prayer thys holy kynge saued forsayd perylle dethe thenne sayd saynt retourned fraunce receyued alle wyth grete ioye ardant lye brennynglye prouffytyng vertue vertue became al maner perfeccion lyf myseracion pyte growyng hym hys yongthe neuerthelesse shewed thenne euydentelye charytable dedes poure folke socouryng prouffytably soo myght theyr nede began thenne bylde founde hospytalles howses poure people lye edefyed mynstres relygyon gaue yerely poure suffretours dyuers place royame moche money pecunyes syluer founded many couentes thordre freres prechours many poure relygyous bylded chyrches cloysters dortoyrs edefyces couenables gafe god largelye almoses ye blynde begynes doughters god releuyd mynstre many poure nonnerye enryched many chirche founded hym wyth grete reuenues rente whiche many tymes excercyted thoffice charite meruayllous humylyte humbly deuontelye seruyng poure owne handes grete myserycorde whan came parys cytees vysyted hospytalles smalle howses poure peple laye wythout abhomynacion dyfformyte ne ordure fylthe somme pacyente seek admynystred many tymes knelyng gyuyng mete poure wyth hys owne handes abbay royalmonte whyche founded dowed grete reuenewe rente shewyd notoryly suche semblable almoses made many tymes yet gretter meruaylle monke sayd abbay leper abhomynable thenne proued bothe nose eyen corupcyon sayd seeknesse blessyd saynt lowys admynystred humbly puttyng knelyng owne handes bothe mete drynke wythin mowthe sayd leper wythoute ony abhomynacion abbotte presente wyche vnnethe myght see wepte syghed pyteously al indygente openyd bosom myserycorde neuerthelesse watched deuyne seruyces prayed sowles maad gretter almoses ofter grete almose dalte euery yere couentes parys bothe freres predycatours mynours sayd somtyme famylyers god almose wel sette bestowed moche grete nombre freres affluyng comyng parys oute fro alle londes lerne deuyne scryptures thende myght shewe vtter thorugh al world cure saluacyon sowles almoses dyd thorugh yere tunge shold suffyse reherce worshypped holy relyques wyth moche grete deuocyon assyduelly grewe cultyuyng god thonour sayntes bylded parys fayr chapel within paleys ryalle purposed put ryght dylygently holy crowne thorne lord wyth grete parte holy crosse also yron heed spere wherwyth syde lord openyd wyth many relyques whiche receyued emperour constantynoble wold speke body whyle chyrche heryng deuyne seruyce wythoute grete nede grete vtylyte comyn wele thenne wyth shorte substauncyous wordes vtteryd wold say thende hys deuocyon shold letted myght ne forbere reproches blasphemyes doon crysten feythe ennamoured loue god phynees punysshed right greuously wherof hefyl cytezeyn parys lothely sweryng blasphemxed ihesu cryste ageynst acte statute ryal whiche saynt lowys counceyl prelate prynces ordeyned made swerars blasphematours commaundement sayd saynt marked tokened lyppes hym hote brennyng yron sygne punycyon synne terrour dredefulnesse alle cause heryng somme say cast hym many cursynges sayd wold fayne susteyn lyppes suche laydure shame longe shal lyue soo alle euyl vyce sweryng lefte caste alle royame sygnacle fygure holy crosse soo right grete reuerence eschewed trede hit reporte knowyng desolacyon perplexyte perylles holy londe another machabeus wyth hys sone wyllyng crysten folke holy persones shold susteyn ne bere ony lenger euyl payne enspyred wyth holy ghoost passed saylled ageyn ouer hyghe see vnto holy lande accompanyed wyth noble moche comynaltee royame whan shyppes redy saylle saynt lowys beholdyng thre sone specyally dressyng hys wordes toward theldest said sone consyder thou must ferforth age one haue passed ouer see also quene thy moder grete age procedyng nygh hir laste dayes blessyd god possessen pesably royame without ony werre delyces rechesses honoures moche plesyth v apperteyneth loke thenne loue ihesu cryste chirche ne spare myn olde age haue pyte thy dyscomforted wooful moder leue bothe delyces honoures expose myn owne selfe perylle ihesu cryste whiche thynges wyl thou knowe thende whan thou comest successyon royalme thou doo shyppes thenne redy saylled see longe hoost areyued hauen cartage auffryke force armes crysten men took castel enioyed londe aboute betwyxte thunes cartage dressyd theyr tentes dwelle lytel tyme meane whyle saynt lowys many vertuous werkys soo many paynes labour suffred feythe ihesu cryste god wold benewrely consume lyf yelde hym fruyte gloryous laboures benefaytes sente hym ax contynuel thenne holy enseygnementes techynges whiche writen frensshe exposed dylygently phelyp eldest sone commaunded soon shold accomplysshed thenne beyng thought syght heeryng hoole sayeng seuen psalmes callyng alle sayntes deuoutelye took sacramentes chyrche last comyng last houre stratchyng armes denys fraūce buryed whiche place also dyuers thys gloryous saynt resplendyssheth many myracles day saynt lowes buryed woman dyocyse see recouerd hir syght whiche loste sawe noo thynge merytes prayer tyme dyocyse beauuays ten men broken wythin quarrye dyd fetche grete stone •• e wythal fyl grete quantyt • e erthe soo moche couerd wyth hit clerke thenne passyd foreby •• e theyr syghyng hauyng pyte theym nyghe deed knelyd doun erthe remembryng newe canonyzacion blessyd saint lowys fore wepyng made forsayd men prayer hym hys prayer doon sawe folke comyng waye called forthwyth deluyd wyth suche staues moche merytes saynt whome trusted moche oute quarrye forsayd ten men whyche founde vnhurted hoole euer certeyn deed happed another tyme grete walle fyl chylde reputed deed al folke hys moder vowed hym sayd saynt maad stone couerd hym awaye founde hyr chylde lawghyng hole alle hys membrys woman agreuyd wyth sekenesse whiche men calle fyre saynt anthony came poyssy saynt lowys borne founte maad •• yng ostage sayd prouynce catheloygne purposed accomplysshe seeyng fere sayd kynge fader freres durst receyue hym solempnelye renewed sayd vowe maner persuacion admonestyng ne ony prouysion haue audegonde hir suster wyth hir hir dysporte comforte companye veray loue charytee audegonde holy virgyne sente thyder taughte endoctryned hir suster manere holdyng relygyon fewe dayes hir moder yet supposyng haue maryed hir wente bothe hyr doughters audegonde gaue pyete lynnen clothe suche prynces commaunded hyr therwyth shold make shertes shetys kerchyers hyr paramour good virgyn wenyng hir moder mente hyr spouse ihesu cryste took sayd clothe therof made crysmes whyche put newe borne chyldrens heedes whan borne fontes baptysed whome preest sayth take thou thys whyte clothynge whiche thou shalte bere tofore syege trybunal lord wherfore sayd holy vyrgyne ende shyrtes hir owne shapyng making shold borne hir spouse ihesu cryste made crysmes hir moders clothe whan made moche fayre ryche kynges sone wyth mery countenaunce gaue hir moder sayeng doon beste wyse coude whan hir moder sawe crysmes hir lynnen cloth thus employed moche wroth euyl apayed fette rodde bete hir doughter wythal blessyd saynt fledde vnto foreste mau • euge nyghe made hyr penytence wyth comforte helpe lord sayd whyche thassente graunte hir moder shold haue hir wyf came said foreste haue rauysshed hir force coude neuer fynde ne see hyr alle wente nyghe hyr abode vnto tyme hyr moder dede wente moune sacred vnto nonne handes saynt obyer saynt amande anone bylded founded hyr abbay mauleuge brouhte thys holy vyrgyne grete fysshe whiche put fountayn kepte happed suche grete fysshes ben acustomed doo lepte hyghe fro water fyl grounde coude retourne fontayn hym cam grete rauen whiche wold haue ete hit came lambe kepte fysshe fro harme foughte ageynst rauen longe ladyes nonnes place perceyued bataylle somme cam fontayn toke fysshe brought wyth said lambe euer folowed vnto tyme fysshe presence saint audegōde neuer wold departe tyl ye holy vyrgyn said hym ye haue right wel goo herde ageyn nyȝt saint audegonde hir suster togyder spekyng secretely spouse lord ihesu cryste theyr candyl fyl fro candel stycke put saynt audegonde took god wold lyghted self ageyn item tyme two wente gyder toward chirche saynt peter aboute houre sexte yates thenne shytte sodaynlye openyd instaunce theyr orysons prayer item one thyrste water broughte hyr whyche tourned wyne grace hym galylee dyd tourne water wyne saynt wandrud sawe vysyon fyue dayes dethe holy audegonde hyr suster blessyd vyrgyn marye bothe saynt peter saynt powle prynces appostles accompanyed wyth many sayntes grete legyon aungellys whyche ledde hyr suster audegonde paradyse therfore came place hyr suster laye seek pres • nte whan rendred hyr sowle hir spouse lord ihesu cryste whome shal praye thorugh merytes blessyd vyrgyne audegonde whyche myracles bothe hyr lyf hyr dethe wythoute nombre may come glorye without ende amen ¶thus endeth lyf saint audegonde virgyne foloweth lyf saint aulbyne bysshop saynt aulbyne borne noble lygnage partyrs ytaly • chydehode loued seruyd god ententyfly wyth grete wylle lefte bothe fader moder parentys frendes lande alle worldely rychesse became monke abbay callyd latyn tincillacense monasterium nedyd shewe noblesse onelye good condycyons humble seruysable vnto alle euer contynuel prayer replenysshed wyth alle vertues redy apparaylled flee eschewe alle vyces whan saynt aulbyne came eage thyrty yere maad abbotte sayd abbay whyche gouerned bothe temporelle spryrituel space fyue twenty yere lord al tymes wel deuotelye seruyd al goodes temporalle dayly grewen bisshop anger deyed tyme thenne thys holy saynt aulbyne grace wylle lord comune concordable assente alle chappytre promoted dygnyte bisshop afterwarde knowen parfyte charytable doubtelesse promocyon cause saluacyon many sowles woman cytee angyers whyche hir handes lame counterfeyted cause sekenesse men calle gowte wherwyth sore vexyd made hyr prayer demaunded helpe saynt soone holpen releuyd sekenesse onelye handelyd thre tymes hyr handes tyme saint aulbyn went thorugh dowue within dyocyse sawe fader moder wepyng ouer theyr chylde dede toke pyte made prayer vnto lord sodaynlye chylde reysed lyf item blynde man demaū ded helpe saint aulbyn holy bisshop made signe crosse ouer • ym anon enlumyned ageyn item saynt aulbyn dyd passe tyme pryson hows anger prysonners cryed besought hym helpe holy bysshop hauyng grete compassyon yede vnto baylye prayed hym theym nought auayled prayer wherfore wente chyrche soone prayer made god knelyng hygh aulter grete parte pryson walle fylle doun soo scapyd euery prysonner woman vexyd wyth wycked spiryte broughte thys holy bysshop assone enemye perceyued holy man put hym selfe woman eye fourme litel whelk rede ony blood saynt aulbyn makyng sygne crosse sayd thou wycked spyryte thou shalte destroye eye whiche thou madest cannest make anone lytel whelke beganne blede one flymed hit enemye thenne wente hyr whyche good helthe lefte hir wytte restoryd ¶ englysshe tunge albinus moche say primo whyte quia albinus dicitur quasi albus thus thys holy saynt al whyte purete clene lyuyng secundo hym self hath bountee goodnes sic albinus dicitur quasi bonus veraylye thys holy bysshop good tercio vygour force flyeth spirytualte sic albinus dicitur ala bi na habens wete hope feyth therwyth holy saynt replenysshed redde saynt aulbyn ij wyues wete two nourysses whicbe dyd nourysshe hym wherof proces taale suche saynt aulbyn lyeng cradel lefte allone doubtyng none inconuenyente gardyn wolfe came rauysshed chylde bare feldes two maydens thenne passed waye perceyued chylde cam thyder laye therthe hauyng pyte hym one two sayd wold god mylke foustre wythal wordes thus sayd saw hir pappes grewe roos vp fylled mylke thenne toke chylde gafe gym sowke semblably said prayed mayde anone mylke hir felawe two nourysshed holy chylde aulbyn happed tyme norman grete nombre men armes came contreye holy corp saynt aulbyn restyd peple sore trauaylled ne wyste become flee man armed alle whyte came emonge sayd peple sayd doubte sawte befyghte enemye ye haue saynt aulbyn helpe deffence sayd vanysshed awaye wherfore peple toke courage armyd wente ageynst enemyes dyscomfyted saynt aulbyne buryed anger whan hys successour wold haue translated hym gretter chappel presence saynt germayn many moo cam thyder foure men counterfeted lame al membris also two blynde men whiche alle vj merites saynt aulbyn releuyd good helthe wete countrefayted redressyd membris blynde enlumyned holy saynt aulbyn bysshop anger space twenty yere vj monethes who sowle toke syege paradyse yere natyuyte four score merytes hym may lede v fader sone holy ghoost amen ¶thus endeth lyf saint aulbyne begynneth noble historye thexposicion masse herte deuoute vnderstonde say masse also consecrate body lord precious sacrament thaulter knowe ye masse may comprysed four partyes principal first parte dureth begynnyng masse vnto thofferyng second dureth thoffryng pater noster said third parte dureth fro pater noster vnto persepcion fourth parte dureth fro percepcion vnto thende masse towchyng first parte begynnyng masse vnto thoffrynge vnderstonde preest whiche sheweth waye god peple reuesteth hym wyth chezuble begynneth saith psalme thyrd nocturne psaulter psalme begynneth iudica deus discerne psalme asketh iiij thynges fyrst may parted al euyl companye second may delyuerd fro al euyl temptacio • thyrd may holy ghoost enlumyned fourth ihesu crist gyue hym self consecrate hym entente may surely deuoutely consecrate sayd sacramente confesseth hym self generally al synnes sayeng confiteor confiteor sheweth four thynges fyrst sheweth hym self worthy redargucion rebuke secondly sheweth hym self playne contricion thirdly requyreth ayde aboute hym may haue remyssyon synnes fourthly demaū deth lord veray absolucyon preest kysseth thaulter kyssyng sygnefyeth vnyte dyleccion shewyng lord wold vnye ioyne humanyte dyuynytee grete loue take chirche owne spouse wherfore holy chyrche may say thus quasi sponsam decorauit corona et quasi sponsam ornauit monilibus saye lord propre spouse hath aourned cladde thynges precyous preest draweth hym ryghte parte syde aulter sygnefyeng god whan taken humanyte passyon vertue hys resurrexyon translated hym ryght hande fader preest begynneth thyntroyte masse sygnefyeth comyng lord ihesu cryste wold come world whiche comyng thauncient faders prophetes patryarkes feythful peple lord desyred moche ardantlye cryed wyth hyghe voys said emitte agnum domine dominatorem terre syeng thus god fader syr praye thou wylt sende swete lambe hauyng domynacion al erthe god sone sayd thus veni domine noli tardare saye praye thou wylt come hastelye tarye secondly sayd introyte signefyeth preest oweth entre seruyce god thys foloweth verse psaulter sayd introyte suche apperteyneth day whiche verse sygnefyeth ought putte handes ioyntelye prayeng hym deuoutelye made propre brother takyng humanytee shewe v waye trouthe foloweth gloria patri whiche sygnefyeth preysyng lawde fader sone holy ghoost good werkes ought folowe lawdyng preysyng preest repeteth introyte masse ende desyres auncyent faders prophetes patryarkes may better shewed preest begynneth sayth thre tymes kyryeleyson vnderstonde fader thre tymes xpēleyson sone thre tymes kyryeleyson holy ghoost callyng vpon mercy god thende holy chirche accompanyed wyth ix ordres aū gel regnyng companye god thys sheweth sygnyfycacion wordes sayd whan men say kyryeleyson lord haue thou mercy v vnderstonde fader sone holy ghoost called thys worde onely kyryeleyson cause one nature myserycorde god sone callyd thys worde xpēleyson sone touchyng dyuynyte one naturei wth fader holy ghoost wythstondyng wold take nature another nature humanyte v gyue lyf pardurable preest begynneth gloria excelcis whyche gyueth wytnesse natyuyte lord whan aungellys god knowleged god born thēne al togyder enioyed therof cryeng wyth hyghe voys glorye laude heuen trynyte also pee erthe alle creature good wylle ¶ al creature noo pee thys thenne warre betwyxte god creature betwyxte thaungels creature betwyxte creature creature inobedyence adam caused first werre offended god wherof folowed ij werres therfore veray pee wold borne therthe shewe sette emonge v veray pee therfore al companye aungellys paradys sange wyth hyghe voys gloria excelsis sit inter angelos say glorye lawdyng emonge aungellys heuen pee concorde erthe betwyxte creature god therforehe wold take nature god man rendre v pee hym reconcyled therfore creature may oweth say good herte ensaumple aungelles paradyse wordes folowyng laudamus te benedicimus te glorifi • amus te say lawde blysse glorefye thy grete glorye yelde grace thankes lord god lambe god sone god fader thou takest aweye synnes world haue mercy v thou takest synnes fro world wylte receyue prayer thou syttest ryghte honde fader haue mercy v thou arte holy thou allone arte lord thou onelye arte hyghest ihesu cryst glorye god fader wyth holy ghoost al • hese lawdynges doeth preest wyth prayer sayeng gloria • xcelsis c̄ alle holy chirche ¶ whan preest hath sayd gloria excelsis tourneth hym toward peple saleweth sayeng dominus vobiscum sygnefyeth salut whyche lord gafe appostles blessyd resurrexyon whan apperyd sayd pax vobis say pee wyth thys representyng saleweth people sayeng dominus vobiscum thende creature haue thouȝte toward god peple answerd et cum spiritu tuo sygnefyng oughte praye hym hath say oryson prayeth v ende oryson may herde god enhaunced thenne retorneth preest toward aulter sayeth oremus sygnefyeth yet ageyn incyteth v praye suche manere dyd lord dyscyples sayeng orate ne intretis temptacionem saye honoure praye god fader ende ye entre euyl temptacyon preest goeth prayeth sayeng oryson al creature whiche entendeth hath memorye praye lord hath sayd holy euangylle alle ye shal aske fader name ye shal haue preest sayth ende oryson per dominū nosttrum ihesum xpristum wold say thys praye praye name lord ihesu cryste reygnyng wyth fader holy ghoost wete somtyme preest also sayeth oryson whiche sygnefyeth vnyte feythe vnyte sacramente somtyme preest saith thre orysons sygnefye holy trynyte ellys thys lord hys passyon honoured prayed god fader thre tymes somtyme sayth fyue orysons sygnefyeng v woundes lord somtyme sayth seuen sygnefyeng seuen yeftes holy ghoost oweth euery one wete knowe many preest sayth orysons begynnyng masse many sayth secrete many thende masse cause shal appere playnelye atte second parte orysons epystle foloweth moche worthe message sente somme letter sygnefyeth doctryne appostles lord whiche sente lord teche endoctryne people vnto waye trouthe may sayd also thys epystle sygnefyeth predycacion saynt iohan baptyste whiche sente god anounce comyng doctryne hym whiche lore sayth thus penitenciam agite appropinquabit enim regnum celorum saye doo penytence royalme heuen shal come nyghe swete comyng sayth yet saynt iohan ecce agnus dei c̄ say lambe god taketh aweye synnes fro world thys epystle may also gyue v testymonage lord wyl descende vnto precious sacramente aulter sacrefise shal appere second parte masse thys saynt iohan taughte predycacion shold doo penytence acquyre haue royalme heuen foloweth grayel may sygnefye lamentacion enbracemente penaunce creature deuoute hath herde predycacion god oweth put hande werkys power thys grayel cam greek tunge sygnefyeth creature oweth mounte goo vp god fro degree degre vertu humylyte wete betwyxe octaues ester penthecoste grayel sayd thys grayel sygnefyeth penaūce lamentacyon mornynge thys tyme pasque moder holy chyrche ne doth ioye maketh solacyon resurrexyon ihesu cryste therfore thenne sayd alleluya whyche sygnefyeth ioye consolacion creature hath doon penaunce vertu humylite wepynges lamentacions must lede ioye veray consolacion lord sayth thus beati qui lugent quoniam ipsi consolabuntur say blessyd thoo wepyn contrycyon shal haue veray consolacion wete worde alleluya expowned four maners foure doctours fyrst saynt austyn whiche exposeth thus alleluya id est saluum fac domine say syr saue thou saynt iherome exposeth hit thus alle id est cantate lu id est laudem ya id est deum vel dominum say synge laudyng lord ihesu cryste saynt gregore exposeth thus alle id est pater lu id est filius ya id est spiritus sanctus say fader sone holy ghoost thus hym self exposeth alle id est lux lu id est vita ya id est salus alleluya thenne exposycyon moche say lyght lyf helthe fourthly mayster peter ansydotoyr expowneth moche wel sayth thus alle id est altissimus leuatus est cruce lu id est lugebant appostoli ya id est iam surrexit moche say ryght hyghe lyfte crosse whyche thynge appostles haue wepte sone rysen whyche exposycyon thre thynges shewyd v fyrst cruel passyon lord ihesu cryste second sorowe anguysshe thappostles thyrd myrthe ioye v sayth lord rysen tokenyng men syngen alleluya thys alleluya sayth verse whiche sygnefyeth alle swetenesse vertuous werke whyche men retournen veray iubylacion therfore repeteth alleluya verse sayd good werke men retourne ageyn veray consolacion wete fro septuagesme vnto ester day men owe say alleluya stede say tracte whiche tracte sygnefyeth wepynge lamentacyon passyon lord ihesu cryste cometh nygh tyme wete holy tyme lente therfore creature deuoute alle herte oweth drawe thynke holy passyon duryng tyme men saye noo sequence sequence sygnefyeth ioye consolacyon tyme lente ne sygnefyeth mournynges wete sequence sayd alleluya sayd specyally holydayes solempne sygnefyeng plente multytude myrthes consolacyon sygnefyed sayd alleluya sequence moche day solempne thenne dayes oweth creature lede make gretter ioye lawdyng holy trynyte al thynges preest translateth book synyster parte aulter say euangylle sygnefyeng lord whan cam doun erthe expose holy euangylle al creature drewe hym senyster parte toward iewes anounce holy euangylle tyme iewes drawen self lyfte syde thys preest place may represente lord pr • chyng anouncyng lawe ende may excerce doo offyce parfytelye begynnyng sayth softelye oryson begynneth thus munda cor meum c̄ whiche oryson prayeth lord wyl make clene herte anounce predycacion demaundeth blessyng lord sayeng iube domine benedicere moche saye lord commaunde thou may haue thy blessyng anone leuetenaunte lord answereth sayth thus lord herte lyppes may worthely competently anounce holy euangylle god name fader sone holy ghoost preest saleweth people sayeng dominus vobiscum ij cause fyrst cause thentente peple incited worde god therfore peple draweth toward euangylle standeth theyr foot thordenaunce anathasy thenne pope sygnefyeth peple ought redy apparaylled susteyne feyth god veray loue thys yet people incyted euangylle god preest representeth place god sayth sequencia sancti euangelij c̄ makyng sygne crosse ende enemye may empeche hym thenne clerkes peple answeryn gloria tibi domine glorefyeng god hath sente worde salute sayeng lord lawdyng yeuen thy worde v shewyd thenne preest sayth euangylle whyche sygnefyeth sayd predycacyon lord god whiche fynysshed said preest warneth hym self wyth sygne crosse thentente enemye may take aweye fro creature hertes worde god foloweth crede testymonage confyrmacyon forsayd euangylle whyche made composed appostles lord ihesu cryste sygnefyeng thys appostles sayd fermelye beleuyd byleuyng anounced wete crede sayd holy dayes composed appostles lord ihesu cryst holy dayes whyche mencyon made wythin crede wete alle sondayes yere crystemasse day epyphanye xiij day sherethorsday ester day whytsonday trynyte sonday also alle holy dayes lady many whyche men maketh mencyon thys may suffyse fyrste parte masse endeth firste parte masse folowtth second parte second parte masse fro offryng vnto pater noster euery one oweth vnderstonde creature hath herde worde god holy euangylle adiousteth ferme stedfaste feythe whyche fygured crede oweth thenne offre gyue hys herte god therfore foloweth offrynge ende peple incyted preest retourneth hym toward folke sayth dominus vobiscum say lord wyth euen wold say yf lord wyth ye doo noo good werke ne good offeryng toward hym preest sayth oremus incytyng v honoure praye god thenne sayth offrytorye preest taketh lydde chalys whyche hoost whyche oweth conuertyd body lord offreth god fader sayeng suscipe sancte pater c̄ fader wylte thou receyue thys hoostye wythoute tatche spotte whyche thy seruaunte vnworthy offre god veray certeyn al synnes haue doo without nombre also alle aboute al fyables god lyue alle passed thys world thentente thys oblacion may prouffytable saluacyon sowles lyf parmanable euerlastyng preest maketh comyxcyon wyne water gyder wete sayd water vnderstonde people wyne representeth lord sygnefyeng sayd water wyne shewen v humylyte also comyxyon peple oweth haue god may sayd also thys water medlyd wyth sayd wyne thys bothe blood water yssued syde lord thys sayth deus qui humane substancie c̄ whiche oryson prayeth alle ende vertue myxyon people may vnyed god veray loue dyleccion preest offeryth chalys god sayeng offerrimus tibi sygnefyeng lord ihesu cryste offeryd hym self god fader crucefyed thaulter crosse helthe preest couereth chalyce none ordure shold touche holy sacrefyse maketh crosse ouer hoostye ouer chalys sayeng venisanctificator c̄ moche say kynge almyghty praye thou wylte blesse halowe thys sacrefise thy swete name hert deuoute haue pardon preest draweth hym self ryght syde aulter representyng lord receyueth offrynges creature thenne peple deuocyon come offreth ensaumple peple god peple offryd wythin temple salamon god one offryd golde syluer offeryd brede offeryd wyne dyuers maners offrynges preest wessheth handes apperteyneth soo precyous sacramente worthely clenely made draweth hym self euen myddes aulter maketh depe enclynacion sayeng suscipe sanctum rinitas c̄ inclynacion may sygne fye inclynacyon god whyche enclyned hym sacramente foot appostles prayed god fader kysseth aulter sygnefyeng vertu passion peaseth creature hym preest retourneth hym selfe toward folke sayth orate pro fratres c̄ thys prayeth peple wyl praye god hym ¶ none thynge say right dere brethern praye god may make sacrefyse worthely may see god ioyously preest retourneth hym toward aulter begynneth orysons secrete whiche sayd cause whiche fyrst orysons ben sayd many nombre wete orysons sayd softely secretelye thys preest nyghe sacramente therfore wyl haue none empesshemente lettyng neyther wy ne manere lord entente myght secretelye honour praye wente hys dyscyples ferre stone myght throwen orysons ben also sayd lowe secretelye thys whan lord reysed lazarus iewes wold haue sleyne hym wherfore drewe hym self cyte effraym place al allone fro tyme cessyd predycacion vnto palme sonday euen thenne came hows symon openlye began preche thys preeste thende hys orysons dressyng handes vp hye sayth per omnia secula seculoram thys messager god peple people heeryng thys message answereth amen preest begynneth preface whiche called preparacion fyrst apparayl gooeth sacrefyse pryncypal therfore saleweth sayeng dominus vobiscum sayeng prepare make v redy lord may dwelle wyth v peple answeryth et cum spiritu tuo thus peple preest bothe prayen eche preest incytyng v sayth sursum corda say peple haue herte vpon hye toward god thenne answereth peple habemus ad dominum say haue god therfore people suche houre tyme hath sette herte god may lyght lye preest sayth gracias agamus domino deo nostro say yelde grace thankynges god yf people tyme hath somme deuocyon ought lawde thanke god therfore thys clerke alle people answereth dignum et iustum est ryght euen wold say worthy lawful thynge lawde god iuste thynge honoure hym preest maketh mencyon aungels archaungellys alle courte heuen preysen lawden god thys thende prayeth forsayd companye alle may prayse lawde god sayeng wyth ferme deuocion sanctus sanctus sanctus whiche wordes folowen preface ryght euen preest representyng moder holy chyrche hauyng hope accompanyed bothe aungels archaungels confermyth hym self sayth sanctus c̄ wete thys sanctus deuyded two partyes fyrste parte conteyneth lawdyng aungellys seconde conteyneth lawdyng people preest thenne fyrst parte may represente thaungellys heuen whyche redde book ysaye prophete seraphyns cryed hygh wy one another sanctus sanctus sanctus c̄ prayeng trynyte sayeng holy fader holy sone holy spyryte alle erthe replenysshed wyth thy glorye second parte may represente peple israel whyche rede whan lord descended fro montayne olyuette came cyte iherusalem cryed wyth hyghe wy benedictus qui venit nomine domini c̄ moche say blessed cometh name god hym requyre pardon benediccion blessyng whiche swete preest maketh crosse whych representeth v lord cometh sacrefysed holy crosse descendeth wyl consecrate ende men may see hym presentelye therfore verayly deuoute people hereth masse right oweth drawe self wythin chambre hir conscyence ende may cherysshe therin swete lambe deuoute oryson prayeng hym hys goodelye comyng consolacion ioye vnto euery creature also owe thynke consydere euyl dedes offence thende may shewe declare ferme stedfast contrycyon hym presentlye cometh thus creature shal mowe thanke regracye god deuoute contemplacion alle thynges foloweth canon whiche named canon mysterye precious sacrament made consecrate thys canon sayd lowe secretelye vertue wordes thende holde fylthe auncyently profferryd sayd hye wherfore knowen mooste parte folke sange thorugh stretes wherof fynde somtyme shepherdes took somme breed put stone sayd wordes wryton canone breed tourned conuertyd pyece flesshe sone wylle god fyre descendyd fro heuen vpon al combusted brente therfore holy faders stablysshed werdes sayd lowe also none shold say wythout preest canon conteyneth ix partyes fyrst parte preest enclyneth hym self aulter whiche enclynacion sygnefyeth beto • keneth humylite lord shewed whan enclyned hym selfe crosse preest spekyng lord sayth thus tei gitur clementissime c̄ say fader ryght debonayr praye thou wylte accepte blesse swete oblacyons holy sacrefyses wythout corupcyon prest kysseth aulter sygnefyeng compassyon hath passyon lord ihele cryste maketh thre tymes sygne crosse bothe ouer breed ouer wyne iij cross sygnefyen lord geuen offred thre maners fyrst god fader redempcyon secondly iudas iewes grete treson thyrdly iewes pylate grete detraccion second parte preest prayeth al holy chirche vnyuersally sayeng offerrimus c̄ saye offeren therfore preest speketh owne persone persone holy chyrche ny none wycked euyl preest may consecrate precyous body lord ihesu cryste thyrd parte preest hath specyal mynde alle subgettes holy chyrche specyally paas sayth ioynynge hys handes memento eciam domine famuborum c̄ say syr haue thou mynde thy seruauntes preest resteth hath specyal memorye alle creature whome entendeth praye hath also mynde partyculer ꝑsones whome bounde praye wete thys memorye persones ben lyue prayeth alle heren hys masse wyth feythe deuocyon fourth parte thende hym self also whyche hath memorye may haue partycypacyon glorye paradyse wyth thaungels holy appostles marters sayth deuoute oryson begynneth thus communicantes c̄ whyche oryson preest maketh specyal commemoracyon vyrgyne marye twelue appostles ihesu cryste many marters fyfthe parte preest enclyneth hym sayth oryson begynneth thus hanc igitur oblacionem c̄ whyche oryson doeth foure thynges fyrst prayeth god wyl receyue seruyce second may haue veray pee god thyrd fro dampnacion wyl kepe v fourth wyth chosen wyl lede u preest comyng nygh pryncypal consecracion sayth quam oblacionem preest maketh fyue tymes sygne crosse ouer breed ouer wyne remembraunce tokenyng v woundes lord prayer sentence may suche syr wyth herte praye oblacion made consecrate aproued confermed hoostye ryȝt resonable sacrefyse acceptable thys breed transferred thy body thys wyne translated blood thy right dere sone v suffred grete tormente therfore sayth vj parte canon masse foloweth wete al preest doth consecracyon representeth betokeneth al lord dyd hys dysciples day cene sherethorsday toke breed yeldyng grace god fader brosyd gaue dyscyples sayeng take ete myn owne propre body manere doth preest thys syxte parte excepte ryght bruseth breed signyficacion tokenyng preest enclyneth bothe one syde thenne preest wypeth first thyse thre fyngres corporal entente clenlye may take precyous hoostye taketh lokyng vpward hye rendre grace god techyng tokenyng whan enterpryse good werke ought lyfte vpward god eyen herte hym begynnyng pryncypal alle good werkys conuerted propre owne body ihesu cryste vpon crosse deyed v lord souper toke wyne drscyples yeldyng grace god fader blessyd gaue dyscyples sayeng take drynke thys chalys propre owne blood confyrmacyon bothe newe olde testamente mysterye feythe whyche shal spylte peple remyssyon synnes many tymes ye shal doo thys shewe ye shal memorye therfore seuenth parte canon masse preest whan hath layed doun body lord taketh chalys lokyng vpward blessyth sayth take drynke chalyce myn owne propre blood right soone preest hath sayd forsayd wordes latyn mynde lord wyne conuerted propre owne blood ihesu cryste whyche spylte v rood tree wete thys precyous sacramente may consyder ix myracles moche meruayllous whiche may aprouyd somme semblaunce lykenesse nature fyrst substaunce breed wyne chaunged substaunce body precious blood cryste thys shewyd v suche symylytude lykenesse naturally food brede wyne bothe flesshe blode engendryd creature moche stronger lord souerayne nature may doo vertu thynge secrete may vttere reherce hit many dyuers place notwythstondyng ne wote ne better dyd toforne ¶ thyrd euery day lord parted eten hath dymynysshyng say god sacramente lesse therfore reason naturalle yf haue candel lyght euery one may take lyght wythout lessyd dymynysshed therfore also euery one may take holy sacramente withoute dymynysshyng hit taketh vnworthely dymynyssheth hym self fourth myracle whan hoostye parted god eche parte entyerly ensaumple glasse whan glasse parted broken pyeces euery parte hit apperyth fygure thynge presented hit fyfthe myracle yf thys precyous sacramente taken euyl synful creature sacramente hit self fowled therfore see beemes sonne passeth thorugh ouer ordure fylthe sonne nothynge foule therfore rather thordure fylthe made clene therof thus somtyme whan creature hath receyued body lord vnworthely consyderyng hath mysdoon haue receyued sauyour grete ordure fylth synne conceyueth bytternesse smartyng grete contrycyon therfore retourneth grace thus pourged made clene synne syxth myracle body lord ihesu cryste sode dethe synnars saynt paule appostle sayth eteth vnworthely eteth dampnable iugemente ryght euen stronge wynes stronge mete vnprouffytable lettyng seeke peple ryght body lord ihesu cryste nuysable lettyng synnars ¶ seuenth myracle grete thynge whyche alle world may comprehende conteyned soo lytel hoostye see
